nherit;"><br></p><h2 style=3D"color: black; font-weight: normal; margin: 1e=
m 0px 0.25em; overflow: hidden; padding: 0px; border-bottom-width: 1px; bor=
der-bottom-style: solid; border-bottom-color: #aaaaaa; font-size: 1.5em; fo=
nt-family: 'Linux Libertine', Georgia, Times, serif; line-height: 1.3; back=
ground: none;"><span class=3D"mw-headline" id=3D"Terminology_conflation">Te=
rminology conflation</span><span class=3D"mw-editsection" style=3D"-webkit-=
user-select: none; font-size: small; font-weight: normal; margin-left: 1em;=
 vertical-align: baseline; line-height: 1em; display: inline-block; white-s=
pace: nowrap; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-family: sans-serif;"><span class=
=3D"mw-editsection-bracket" style=3D"margin-right: 0.25em; color: #555555;"=
>[</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=3DDeep_web_(=
search)&amp;action=3Dedit&amp;section=3D1" title=3D"Edit section: Terminolo=
gy conflation" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: =
none;" target=3D"_blank">edit</a><span class=3D"mw-editsection-bracket" sty=
le=3D"margin-left: 0.25em; color: #555555;">]</span></span></h2><p style=3D=
"margin: 0px; line-height: inherit;">The first<span class=3D"Apple-converte=
d-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Skunked_term=
" title=3D"Skunked term" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; ba=
ckground: none;" target=3D"_blank">conflation</a><span class=3D"Apple-conve=
rted-space">&nbsp;</span>of the terms came about in 2009 when the deep web =
search terminology was discussed alongside illegal activities taking place =
on the<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https:/=
/en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Freenet" title=3D"Freenet" style=3D"text-decoration:=
 none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">Freenet</a><spa=
n class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipe=
dia.org/wiki/Darknet" title=3D"Darknet" style=3D"text-decoration: none; col=
or: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">darknet</a>.<sup id=3D"ci=
te_ref-5" class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolat=
e; font-size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"=
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Deep_web_(search)#cite_note-5" style=3D"text-=
decoration: none; color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; background: none;" t=
arget=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>5<span>]</span></a></sup><br data-mce-bogus=
=3D"1"></p><p style=3D"margin: 0px; line-height: inherit;">Since then, the =
use in the<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"htt=
ps://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Silk_Road_(marketplace)" title=3D"Silk Road (mar=
ketplace)" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none=
;" target=3D"_blank">Silk Road</a>'s media reporting, many<sup id=3D"cite_r=
ef-6" class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; f=
ont-size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"http=
s://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Deep_web_(search)#cite_note-6" style=3D"text-deco=
ration: none; color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; background: none;" targe=
t=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>6<span>]</span></a></sup><sup id=3D"cite_ref-7" =
class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-si=
ze: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en=
.wikipedia.org/wiki/Deep_web_(search)#cite_note-7" style=3D"text-decoration=
: none; color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_=
blank"><span>[</span>7<span>]</span></a></sup><sup id=3D"cite_ref-8" class=
=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 1=
1.2px; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wiki=
pedia.org/wiki/Deep_web_(search)#cite_note-8" style=3D"text-decoration: non=
e; color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_blank=
"><span>[</span>8<span>]</span></a></sup><span class=3D"Apple-converted-spa=
ce">&nbsp;</span>people and media outlets, have taken to using Deep Web<spa=
n class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipe=
dia.org/wiki/Skunked_term" title=3D"Skunked term" style=3D"text-decoration:=
 none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">synonymously</a=
><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>with the<span class=3D"=
Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wik=
i/Dark_web" title=3D"Dark web" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b00=
80; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">dark web</a><span class=3D"Apple-c=
onverted-space">&nbsp;</span>or<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;=
</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Darknet" title=3D"Darknet" =
style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=
=3D"_blank">darknet</a>, a comparison<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">=
&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=3DBright=
_Planet&amp;action=3Dedit&amp;redlink=3D1" class=3D"new" title=3D"Bright Pl=
anet (page does not exist)" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #a55858;=
 background: none;" target=3D"_blank">Bright Planet</a><span class=3D"Apple=
-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>rejects as inaccurate<sup id=3D"cite_ref-con=
fusion_9-0" class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isol=
ate; font-size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=
=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Deep_web_(search)#cite_note-confusion-9" =
style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; backgr=
ound: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>9<span>]</span></a></sup><span=
 class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>and consequently is an ongoin=
g source of confusion.<sup id=3D"cite_ref-10" class=3D"reference" style=3D"=
line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-weight: norm=
al; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Deep_web_=
(search)#cite_note-10" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; whit=
e-space: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>10<span=
>]</span></a></sup><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><i><a=
 href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wired_(website)" title=3D"Wired (web=
site)" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" t=
arget=3D"_blank">Wired</a></i><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;<=
/span>reporters<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=
=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kim_Zetter" title=3D"Kim Zetter" style=3D=
"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank=
">Kim Zetter</a><sup id=3D"cite_ref-11" class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-h=
eight: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; fo=
nt-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Deep_web_(searc=
h)#cite_note-11" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; white-spac=
e: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>11<span>]</sp=
an></a></sup><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>and<span cl=
ass=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.=
org/wiki/Andy_Greenberg" title=3D"Andy Greenberg" style=3D"text-decoration:=
 none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">Andy Greenberg<=
/a><sup id=3D"cite_ref-12" class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1; uni=
code-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; font-style: nor=
mal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Deep_web_(search)#cite_note-=
12" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; ba=
ckground: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>12<span>]</span></a></sup>=
<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>recommend the terms be u=
sed in distinct fashions.</p><h2 style=3D"color: black; font-weight: normal=
; margin: 1em 0px 0.25em; overflow: hidden; padding: 0px; border-bottom-wid=
th: 1px; border-bottom-style: solid; border-bottom-color: #aaaaaa; font-siz=
e: 1.5em; font-family: 'Linux Libertine', Georgia, Times, serif; line-heigh=
t: 1.3; background: none;"><span class=3D"mw-headline" id=3D"Size">Size</sp=
an><span class=3D"mw-editsection" style=3D"-webkit-user-select: none; font-=
size: small; font-weight: normal; margin-left: 1em; vertical-align: baselin=
e; line-height: 1em; display: inline-block; white-space: nowrap; unicode-bi=
di: isolate; font-family: sans-serif;"><span class=3D"mw-editsection-bracke=
t" style=3D"margin-right: 0.25em; color: #555555;">[</span><a href=3D"https=
://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=3DDeep_web_(search)&amp;action=3Dedit=
&amp;section=3D2" title=3D"Edit section: Size" style=3D"text-decoration: no=
ne; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">edit</a><span clas=
s=3D"mw-editsection-bracket" style=3D"margin-left: 0.25em; color: #555555;"=
>]</span></span></h2><p style=3D"margin: 0px; line-height: inherit;">In the=
 year 2000, Michael K. Bergman said how searching on the Internet can be co=
mpared to dragging a net across the surface of the ocean: a great deal may =
be caught in the net, but there is a wealth of information that is deep and=
 therefore missed.<sup id=3D"cite_ref-bergman2000_13-0" class=3D"reference"=
 style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-we=
ight: normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki=
/Deep_web_(search)#cite_note-bergman2000-13" style=3D"text-decoration: none=
; color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"=
><span>[</span>13<span>]</span></a></sup><span class=3D"Apple-converted-spa=
ce">&nbsp;</span>Most of the web's information is buried far down on sites,=
 and standard search engines do not find it. Traditional search engines can=
not see or retrieve content in the deep web. The portion of the web that is=
 indexed by standard search engines is known as the<span class=3D"Apple-con=
verted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Surface=
_Web" title=3D"Surface Web" class=3D"mw-redirect" style=3D"text-decoration:=
 none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">surface web</a>=
. As of 2001, the deep web was several<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space"=
>&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Order_of_magnitude" =
title=3D"Order of magnitude" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080=
; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">orders of magnitude</a><span class=
=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>larger than the surface web.<sup id=
=3D"cite_ref-bergman2001_14-0" class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1;=
 unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; font-style:=
 normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Deep_web_(search)#cite_n=
ote-bergman2001-14" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; white-s=
pace: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>14<span>]<=
/span></a></sup><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>An analo=
gy of an iceberg used by Denis Shestakov represents the division between su=
rface web and deep web respectively:</p><blockquote style=3D"overflow: hidd=
en; margin: 1em 0px; padding: 0px 40px;"><p style=3D"margin: 0px; line-heig=
ht: inherit;">It is impossible to measure, and harsh to put estimates on, t=
he size of the deep web because the majority of the information is hidden o=
r locked inside databases. Early estimates suggested that the deep web is 4=
00 to 550 times larger than the surface web. However, since more informatio=
n and sites are always being added, it can be assumed that the deep web is =
growing exponentially at a rate that cannot be quantified.</p><p style=3D"m=
argin: 0px; line-height: inherit;">Estimates based on<span class=3D"Apple-c=
onverted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Extra=
polation" title=3D"Extrapolation" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0=
b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">extrapolations</a><span class=
=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>from a study done at<span class=3D"=
Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wik=
i/University_of_California,_Berkeley" title=3D"University of California, Be=
rkeley" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" =
target=3D"_blank">University of California, Berkeley</a><span class=3D"Appl=
e-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>in 2001<sup id=3D"cite_ref-bergman2001_14-1=
" class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-=
size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://=
en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Deep_web_(search)#cite_note-bergman2001-14" style=3D"=
text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; background: non=
e;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>14<span>]</span></a></sup><span class=
=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>speculate that the deep web consist=
s of about 7.5<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D=
"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Petabyte" title=3D"Petabyte" style=3D"text-d=
ecoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">petab=
ytes</a>. More accurate estimates are available for the number of resources=
 in the deep web: research of He et al. detected around 300,000 deep web si=
tes in the entire web in 2004,<sup id=3D"cite_ref-he07_15-0" class=3D"refer=
ence" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; fo=
nt-weight: normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org=
/wiki/Deep_web_(search)#cite_note-he07-15" style=3D"text-decoration: none; =
color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><=
span>[</span>15<span>]</span></a></sup><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space=
">&nbsp;</span>and, according to Shestakov, around 14,000 deep web sites ex=
isted in the Russian part of the Web in 2006.<sup id=3D"cite_ref-16" class=
=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 1=
1.2px; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wiki=
pedia.org/wiki/Deep_web_(search)#cite_note-16" style=3D"text-decoration: no=
ne; color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_blan=
k"><span>[</span>16<span>]</span></a></sup><br data-mce-bogus=3D"1"></p></b=
lockquote><h2 style=3D"color: black; font-weight: normal; margin: 1em 0px 0=
.25em; overflow: hidden; padding: 0px; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-bot=
tom-style: solid; border-bottom-color: #aaaaaa; font-size: 1.5em; font-fami=
ly: 'Linux Libertine', Georgia, Times, serif; line-height: 1.3; background:=
 none;"><span class=3D"mw-headline" id=3D"Non-indexed_content">Non-indexed =
content</span><span class=3D"mw-editsection" style=3D"-webkit-user-select: =
none; font-size: small; font-weight: normal; margin-left: 1em; vertical-ali=
gn: baseline; line-height: 1em; display: inline-block; white-space: nowrap;=
 unicode-bidi: isolate; font-family: sans-serif;"><span class=3D"mw-editsec=
tion-bracket" style=3D"margin-right: 0.25em; color: #555555;">[</span><a hr=
ef=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=3DDeep_web_(search)&amp;ac=
tion=3Dedit&amp;section=3D3" title=3D"Edit section: Non-indexed content" st=
yle=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"=
_blank">edit</a><span class=3D"mw-editsection-bracket" style=3D"margin-left=
: 0.25em; color: #555555;">]</span></span></h2><p style=3D"margin: 0px; lin=
e-height: inherit;">Bergman, in a seminal paper on the Deep Web published i=
n<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><i>The Journal of Elect=
ronic Publishing</i>, mentioned that Jill Ellsworth used the term<span clas=
s=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><i>Invisible Web</i><span class=3D=
"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>in 1994 to refer to<span class=3D"Appl=
e-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/We=
bsite" title=3D"Website" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; ba=
ckground: none;" target=3D"_blank">websites</a><span class=3D"Apple-convert=
ed-space">&nbsp;</span>that were not registered with any search engine.<sup=
 id=3D"cite_ref-bergman2001_14-2" class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height:=
 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; font-sty=
le: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Deep_web_(search)#cit=
e_note-bergman2001-14" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; whit=
e-space: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>14<span=
>]</span></a></sup><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>Bergm=
an cited a January 1996 article by Frank Garcia:<sup id=3D"cite_ref-17" cla=
ss=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size:=
 11.2px; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wi=
kipedia.org/wiki/Deep_web_(search)#cite_note-17" style=3D"text-decoration: =
none; color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_bl=
ank"><span>[</span>17<span>]</span></a></sup><br data-mce-bogus=3D"1"></p><=
blockquote style=3D"overflow: hidden; margin: 1em 0px; padding: 0px 40px;">=
<p style=3D"margin: 0px; line-height: inherit;">It would be a site that's p=
ossibly reasonably designed, but they didn't bother to register it with any=
 of the search engines. So, no one can find them! You're hidden. I call tha=
t the invisible Web.</p></blockquote><p style=3D"margin: 0px; line-height: =
inherit;">Another early use of the term<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space=
">&nbsp;</span><i>Invisible Web</i><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&n=
bsp;</span>was by Bruce Mount and Matthew B. Koll of Personal Library Softw=
are, in a description of the #1 Deep Web tool found in a December 1996 pres=
s release.<sup id=3D"cite_ref-PLS_18-0" class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-h=
eight: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; fo=
nt-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Deep_web_(searc=
h)#cite_note-PLS-18" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; white-=
space: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>18<span>]=
</span></a></sup><br data-mce-bogus=3D"1"></p><p style=3D"margin: 0px; line=
-height: inherit;">The first use of the specific term<span class=3D"Apple-c=
onverted-space">&nbsp;</span><i>Deep Web</i>, now generally accepted, occur=
red in the aforementioned 2001 Bergman study.<sup id=3D"cite_ref-bergman200=
1_14-3" class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate;=
 font-size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"ht=
tps://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Deep_web_(search)#cite_note-bergman2001-14" sty=
le=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; backgroun=
d: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>14<span>]</span></a></sup><br dat=
a-mce-bogus=3D"1"></p><h2 style=3D"color: black; font-weight: normal; margi=
n: 1em 0px 0.25em; overflow: hidden; padding: 0px; border-bottom-width: 1px=
; border-bottom-style: solid; border-bottom-color: #aaaaaa; font-size: 1.5e=
m; font-family: 'Linux Libertine', Georgia, Times, serif; line-height: 1.3;=
 background: none;"><span class=3D"mw-headline" id=3D"Content_types">Conten=
t types</span><span class=3D"mw-editsection" style=3D"-webkit-user-select: =
none; font-size: small; font-weight: normal; margin-left: 1em; vertical-ali=
gn: baseline; line-height: 1em; display: inline-block; white-space: nowrap;=
 unicode-bidi: isolate; font-family: sans-serif;"><span class=3D"mw-editsec=
tion-bracket" style=3D"margin-right: 0.25em; color: #555555;">[</span><a hr=
ef=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=3DDeep_web_(search)&amp;ac=
tion=3Dedit&amp;section=3D4" title=3D"Edit section: Content types" style=3D=
"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank=
">edit</a><span class=3D"mw-editsection-bracket" style=3D"margin-left: 0.25=
em; color: #555555;">]</span></span></h2><p style=3D"margin: 0px; line-heig=
ht: inherit;">Methods which prevent web pages from being indexed by traditi=
onal search engines may be categorized as one or more of the following:</p>=
<ol style=3D"margin: 0.3em 0px 0px 3.2em; padding: 0px; list-style-image: n=
one;"><li style=3D"margin-bottom: 0.1em;"><b>Contextual Web</b>: pages with=
 content varying for different access contexts (e.g., ranges of client IP a=
ddresses or previous navigation sequence).</li><li style=3D"margin-bottom: =
0.1em;"><b>Dynamic content</b>:<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;=
</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dynamic_Web_page" title=3D"=
Dynamic Web page" class=3D"mw-redirect" style=3D"text-decoration: none; col=
or: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">dynamic pages</a><span cl=
ass=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>which are returned in response t=
o a submitted query or accessed only through a form, especially if open-dom=
ain input elements (such as text fields) are used; such fields are hard to =
navigate without domain knowledge.</li><li style=3D"margin-bottom: 0.1em;">=
<b>Limited access content</b>: sites that limit access to their pages in a =
technical way (e.g., using the<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;<=
/span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robots_Exclusion_Standard" t=
itle=3D"Robots Exclusion Standard" class=3D"mw-redirect" style=3D"text-deco=
ration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">Robots E=
xclusion Standard</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>or<=
span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wik=
ipedia.org/wiki/CAPTCHA" title=3D"CAPTCHA" style=3D"text-decoration: none; =
color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">CAPTCHAs</a>, or no-st=
ore directive which prohibit search engines from browsing them and creating=
<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wi=
kipedia.org/wiki/Web_cache" title=3D"Web cache" style=3D"text-decoration: n=
one; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">cached</a><span c=
lass=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>copies).<sup id=3D"cite_ref-19"=
 class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-s=
ize: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://e=
n.wikipedia.org/wiki/Deep_web_(search)#cite_note-19" style=3D"text-decorati=
on: none; color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D=
"_blank"><span>[</span>19<span>]</span></a></sup><br data-mce-bogus=3D"1"><=
/li><li style=3D"margin-bottom: 0.1em;"><b>Non-HTML/text content</b>: textu=
al content encoded in multimedia (image or video) files or specific<span cl=
ass=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.=
org/wiki/File_formats" title=3D"File formats" class=3D"mw-redirect" style=
=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_bl=
ank">file formats</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>not=
 handled by search engines.</li><li style=3D"margin-bottom: 0.1em;"><b>Priv=
ate Web</b>: sites that require registration and login (password-protected =
resources).</li><li style=3D"margin-bottom: 0.1em;"><b>Scripted content</b>=
: pages that are only accessible through links produced by<span class=3D"Ap=
ple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/=
JavaScript" title=3D"JavaScript" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b=
0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">JavaScript</a><span class=3D"App=
le-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>as well as content dynamically downloaded =
from Web servers via<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a h=
ref=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Macromedia_Flash" title=3D"Macromedia =
Flash" class=3D"mw-redirect" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080=
; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">Flash</a><span class=3D"Apple-conver=
ted-space">&nbsp;</span>or<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</spa=
n><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ajax_(programming)" title=3D"Aja=
x (programming)" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background=
: none;" target=3D"_blank">Ajax</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&n=
bsp;</span>solutions.</li><li style=3D"margin-bottom: 0.1em;"><b>Software</=
b>: certain content is intentionally hidden from the regular Internet, acce=
ssible only with special software, such as<span class=3D"Apple-converted-sp=
ace">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tor_(anonymity_n=
etwork)" title=3D"Tor (anonymity network)" style=3D"text-decoration: none; =
color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">Tor</a>,<span class=3D=
"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wi=
ki/I2P" title=3D"I2P" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; backg=
round: none;" target=3D"_blank">I2P</a>, or other darknet software. For exa=
mple, Tor allows users to access websites using the<span class=3D"Apple-con=
verted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/.onion"=
 title=3D".onion" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; backgroun=
d: none;" target=3D"_blank">.onion</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space"=
>&nbsp;</span>host suffix anonymously, hiding their IP address.</li><li sty=
le=3D"margin-bottom: 0.1em;"><b>Unlinked content</b>: pages which are not l=
inked to by other pages, which may prevent<span class=3D"Apple-converted-sp=
ace">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Web_crawling" ti=
tle=3D"Web crawling" class=3D"mw-redirect" style=3D"text-decoration: none; =
color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">web crawling</a><span =
class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>programs from accessing the co=
ntent. This content is referred to as pages without<span class=3D"Apple-con=
verted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Backlin=
k" title=3D"Backlink" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; backg=
round: none;" target=3D"_blank">backlinks</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted=
-space">&nbsp;</span>(also known as inlinks). Also, search engines do not a=
lways detect all backlinks from searched web pages.</li><li style=3D"margin=
-bottom: 0.1em;"><b>Web archives</b>: Web archival services such as the<spa=
n class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipe=
dia.org/wiki/Wayback_Machine" title=3D"Wayback Machine" style=3D"text-decor=
ation: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">Wayback M=
achine</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>enable users t=
o see archived versions of web pages across time, including websites which =
have become inaccessible, and are not indexed by search engines such as Goo=
gle.<sup id=3D"cite_ref-20" class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1; un=
icode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; font-style: no=
rmal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Deep_web_(search)#cite_note=
-20" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; b=
ackground: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>20<span>]</span></a></sup=
><br data-mce-bogus=3D"1"></li></ol><h2 style=3D"color: black; font-weight:=
 normal; margin: 1em 0px 0.25em; overflow: hidden; padding: 0px; border-bot=
tom-width: 1px; border-bottom-style: solid; border-bottom-color: #aaaaaa; f=
ont-size: 1.5em; font-family: 'Linux Libertine', Georgia, Times, serif; lin=
e-height: 1.3; background: none;"><span class=3D"mw-headline" id=3D"Indexin=
g_methodologies">Indexing methodologies</span><span class=3D"mw-editsection=
" style=3D"-webkit-user-select: none; font-size: small; font-weight: normal=
; margin-left: 1em; vertical-align: baseline; line-height: 1em; display: in=
line-block; white-space: nowrap; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-family: sans-s=
erif;"><span class=3D"mw-editsection-bracket" style=3D"margin-right: 0.25em=
; color: #555555;">[</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?=
title=3DDeep_web_(search)&amp;action=3Dedit&amp;section=3D5" title=3D"Edit =
section: Indexing methodologies" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b=
0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">edit</a><span class=3D"mw-editse=
ction-bracket" style=3D"margin-left: 0.25em; color: #555555;">]</span></spa=
n></h2><p style=3D"margin: 0px; line-height: inherit;">While it is not alwa=
ys possible to directly discover a specific web server's content so that it=
 may be indexed, a site potentially can be accessed indirectly (due to<span=
 class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikiped=
ia.org/wiki/Vulnerability_(computing)" title=3D"Vulnerability (computing)" =
style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=
=3D"_blank">computer vulnerabilities</a>).</p><p style=3D"margin: 0px; line=
-height: inherit;">To discover content on the web, search engines use web c=
rawlers that follow hyperlinks through known protocol virtual<span class=3D=
"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wi=
ki/Port_numbers" title=3D"Port numbers" class=3D"mw-redirect" style=3D"text=
-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">por=
t numbers</a>. This technique is ideal for discovering content on the surfa=
ce web but is often ineffective at finding deep web content. For example, t=
hese crawlers do not attempt to find dynamic pages that are the result of d=
atabase queries due to the indeterminate number of queries that are possibl=
e.<sup id=3D"cite_ref-wright2009_4-1" class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-hei=
ght: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; font=
-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Deep_web_(search)=
#cite_note-wright2009-4" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; wh=
ite-space: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>4<spa=
n>]</span></a></sup><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>It h=
as been noted that this can be (partially) overcome by providing links to q=
uery results, but this could unintentionally inflate the popularity for a m=
ember of the deep web.</p><p style=3D"margin: 0px; line-height: inherit;"><=
a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DeepPeep" title=3D"DeepPeep" style=
=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_bl=
ank">DeepPeep</a>,<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a hre=
f=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Intute" title=3D"Intute" style=3D"text-d=
ecoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">Intut=
e</a>,<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https:/=
/en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Deep_Web_Technologies" title=3D"Deep Web Technologie=
s" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" targe=
t=3D"_blank">Deep Web Technologies</a>,<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space=
">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scirus" title=3D"Sc=
irus" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" ta=
rget=3D"_blank">Scirus</a>, and<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;=
</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ahmia.fi" title=3D"Ahmia.fi=
" class=3D"mw-redirect" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; bac=
kground: none;" target=3D"_blank">Ahmia.fi</a><span class=3D"Apple-converte=
d-space">&nbsp;</span>are a few search engines that have accessed the deep =
web. Intute ran out of funding and is now a temporary static archive as of =
July 2011.<sup id=3D"cite_ref-21" class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height:=
 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; font-sty=
le: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Deep_web_(search)#cit=
e_note-21" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; white-space: now=
rap; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>21<span>]</span></a=
></sup><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>Scirus retired ne=
ar the end of January 2013.<sup id=3D"cite_ref-22" class=3D"reference" styl=
e=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-weight:=
 normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Deep=
_web_(search)#cite_note-22" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080;=
 white-space: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>22=
<span>]</span></a></sup><br data-mce-bogus=3D"1"></p><p style=3D"margin: 0p=
x; line-height: inherit;">Researchers have been exploring how the deep web =
can be crawled in an automatic fashion, including content that can be acces=
sed only by special software such as<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&=
nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tor_(anonymity_network=
)" title=3D"Tor (anonymity network)" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color:=
 #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">Tor</a>. In 2001, Sriram Rag=
havan and Hector Garcia-Molina (Stanford Computer Science Department, Stanf=
ord University)<sup id=3D"cite_ref-raghavan2000_23-0" class=3D"reference" s=
tyle=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-weig=
ht: normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/D=
eep_web_(search)#cite_note-raghavan2000-23" style=3D"text-decoration: none;=
 color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">=
<span>[</span>23<span>]</span></a></sup><sup id=3D"cite_ref-24" class=3D"re=
ference" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px;=
 font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.=
org/wiki/Deep_web_(search)#cite_note-24" style=3D"text-decoration: none; co=
lor: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><sp=
an>[</span>24<span>]</span></a></sup><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">=
&nbsp;</span>presented an architectural model for a hidden-Web crawler that=
 used key terms provided by users or collected from the query interfaces to=
 query a Web form and crawl the Deep Web content. Alexandros Ntoulas, Petro=
s Zerfos, and Junghoo Cho of<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</s=
pan><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/University_of_California,_Los_=
Angeles" title=3D"University of California, Los Angeles" style=3D"text-deco=
ration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">UCLA</a>=
<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>created a hidden-Web cra=
wler that automatically generated meaningful queries to issue against searc=
h forms).<sup id=3D"cite_ref-25" class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: =
1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; font-styl=
e: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Deep_web_(search)#cite=
_note-25" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; white-space: nowr=
ap; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>25<span>]</span></a>=
</sup><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>Several form query=
 languages (e.g., DEQUEL<sup id=3D"cite_ref-26" class=3D"reference" style=
=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-weight: =
normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Deep_=
web_(search)#cite_note-26" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; =
white-space: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>26<=
span>]</span></a></sup>) have been proposed that, besides issuing a query, =
also allow extraction of structured data from result pages. Another effort =
is<a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DeepPeep" title=3D"DeepPeep" sty=
le=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_=
blank">DeepPeep</a>, a project of the<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">=
&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/University_of_Utah" t=
itle=3D"University of Utah" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080;=
 background: none;" target=3D"_blank">University of Utah</a><span class=3D"=
Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>sponsored by the<span class=3D"Apple-co=
nverted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nation=
al_Science_Foundation" title=3D"National Science Foundation" style=3D"text-=
decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">Nati=
onal Science Foundation</a>, which gathered hidden-web sources (web forms) =
in different domains based on novel focused crawler techniques.<sup id=3D"c=
ite_ref-27" class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isol=
ate; font-size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=
=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Deep_web_(search)#cite_note-27" style=3D"=
text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; background: non=
e;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>27<span>]</span></a></sup><sup id=3D"ci=
te_ref-28" class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isola=
te; font-size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D=
"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Deep_web_(search)#cite_note-28" style=3D"tex=
t-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; background: none;"=
 target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>28<span>]</span></a></sup><br data-mce-bog=
us=3D"1"></p><p style=3D"margin: 0px; line-height: inherit;">Commercial sea=
rch engines have begun exploring alternative methods to crawl the deep web.=
 The<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://e=
n.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sitemap_Protocol" title=3D"Sitemap Protocol" class=3D"=
mw-redirect" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: no=
ne;" target=3D"_blank">Sitemap Protocol</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-s=
pace">&nbsp;</span>(first developed, and introduced by Google in 2005) and<=
span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wik=
ipedia.org/wiki/Mod_oai" title=3D"Mod oai" style=3D"text-decoration: none; =
color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">mod oai</a><span class=
=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>are mechanisms that allow search en=
gines and other interested parties to discover deep web resources on partic=
ular web servers. Both mechanisms allow web servers to advertise the URLs t=
hat are accessible on them, thereby allowing automatic discovery of resourc=
es that are not directly linked to the surface web. Google's deep web surfa=
cing system computes submissions for each HTML form and adds the resulting =
HTML pages into the Google search engine index. The surfaced results accoun=
t for a thousand queries per second to deep web content.<sup id=3D"cite_ref=
-29" class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; fo=
nt-size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https=
://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Deep_web_(search)#cite_note-29" style=3D"text-deco=
ration: none; color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; background: none;" targe=
t=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>29<span>]</span></a></sup><span class=3D"Apple-c=
onverted-space">&nbsp;</span>In this system, the pre-computation of submiss=
ions is done using three algorithms:</p><ol style=3D"margin: 0.3em 0px 0px =
3.2em; padding: 0px; list-style-image: none;"><li style=3D"margin-bottom: 0=
.1em;">selecting input values for text search inputs that accept keywords,<=
/li><li style=3D"margin-bottom: 0.1em;">identifying inputs which accept onl=
y values of a specific type (e.g., date), and</li><li style=3D"margin-botto=
m: 0.1em;">selecting a small number of input combinations that generate URL=
s suitable for inclusion into the Web search index.</li></ol><p style=3D"ma=
rgin: 0px; line-height: inherit;">In 2008, to facilitate users of<span clas=
s=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.or=
g/wiki/Tor_(anonymity_network)#Hidden_services" title=3D"Tor (anonymity net=
work)" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" t=
arget=3D"_blank">Tor hidden services</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-spac=
e">&nbsp;</span>in their access and search of a hidden<span class=3D"Apple-=
converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/.oni=
on" title=3D".onion" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; backgr=
ound: none;" target=3D"_blank">.onion</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-spa=
ce">&nbsp;</span>suffix,<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>=
<a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aaron_Swartz" title=3D"Aaron Swart=
z" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" targe=
t=3D"_blank">Aaron Swartz</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</=
span>designed<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"=
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tor2web" title=3D"Tor2web" style=3D"text-deco=
ration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">Tor2web<=
/a>=E2=80=94a proxy application able to provide access by means of common w=
eb browsers.<sup id=3D"cite_ref-RELEASE_30-0" class=3D"reference" style=3D"=
line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-weight: norm=
al; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Deep_web_=
(search)#cite_note-RELEASE-30" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b00=
80; white-space: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span=
>30<span>]</span></a></sup><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</sp=
an>Using this application, deep web links appear as a random string of lett=
ers followed by the .onion TLD. For example, http://xmh57jrzrnw6insl.onion =
links to<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https=
://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/TORCH_(search)" title=3D"TORCH (search)" class=3D"=
mw-redirect" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: no=
ne;" target=3D"_blank">TORCH</a>, the Tor search engine web page.</p><h2 st=
yle=3D"color: black; font-weight: normal; margin: 1em 0px 0.25em; overflow:=
 hidden; padding: 0px; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-bottom-style: solid=
; border-bottom-color: #aaaaaa; font-size: 1.5em; font-family: 'Linux Liber=
tine', Georgia, Times, serif; line-height: 1.3; background: none;"><span cl=
ass=3D"mw-headline" id=3D"See_also">See also</span><span class=3D"mw-editse=
ction" style=3D"-webkit-user-select: none; font-size: small; font-weight: n=
ormal; margin-left: 1em; vertical-align: baseline; line-height: 1em; displa=
y: inline-block; white-space: nowrap; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-family: s=
ans-serif;"><span class=3D"mw-editsection-bracket" style=3D"margin-right: 0=
.25em; color: #555555;">[</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index=
.php?title=3DDeep_web_(search)&amp;action=3Dedit&amp;section=3D6" title=3D"=
Edit section: See also" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; bac=
kground: none;" target=3D"_blank">edit</a><span class=3D"mw-editsection-bra=
cket" style=3D"margin-left: 0.25em; color: #555555;">]</span></span></h2><t=
able class=3D"mbox-small plainlinks sistersitebox" style=3D"font-size: 12.3=
2px; clear: right; float: right; margin: 4px 0px 4px 1em; width: 238px; lin=

rder=3D"1"><tbody><tr><td class=3D"mbox-image" style=3D"border: none; paddi=

ass=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><i><b><a href=3D"https://en.wikt=

an>in Wiktionary, the free dictionary.</td></tr></tbody></table><div class=

rtal</a><br data-mce-bogus=3D"1"></td></tr></tbody></table></div><ul style=
=3D"list-style-type: disc; margin: 0.3em 0px 0px 1.6em; padding: 0px;"><li =

rknet" title=3D"Darknet" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; ba=
ckground: none;" target=3D"_blank">Darknet</a><br data-mce-bogus=3D"1"></li=
><li style=3D"margin-bottom: 0.1em;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wi=
ki/Deep_linking" title=3D"Deep linking" style=3D"text-decoration: none; col=
or: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">Deep linking</a><br data-=
mce-bogus=3D"1"></li><li style=3D"margin-bottom: 0.1em;"><a href=3D"https:/=
/en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gopher_protocol" title=3D"Gopher protocol" class=3D"=
mw-redirect" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: no=
ne;" target=3D"_blank">Gopher protocol</a><br data-mce-bogus=3D"1"></li></u=
l><h2 style=3D"color: black; font-weight: normal; margin: 1em 0px 0.25em; o=
verflow: hidden; padding: 0px; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-bottom-styl=
e: solid; border-bottom-color: #aaaaaa; font-size: 1.5em; font-family: 'Lin=
ux Libertine', Georgia, Times, serif; line-height: 1.3; background: none;">=
<span class=3D"mw-headline" id=3D"References">References</span><span class=
=3D"mw-editsection" style=3D"-webkit-user-select: none; font-size: small; f=
ont-weight: normal; margin-left: 1em; vertical-align: baseline; line-height=
: 1em; display: inline-block; white-space: nowrap; unicode-bidi: isolate; f=
ont-family: sans-serif;"><span class=3D"mw-editsection-bracket" style=3D"ma=
rgin-right: 0.25em; color: #555555;">[</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedi=
a.org/w/index.php?title=3DDeep_web_(search)&amp;action=3Dedit&amp;section=
=3D7" title=3D"Edit section: References" style=3D"text-decoration: none; co=
lor: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">edit</a><span class=3D"m=
w-editsection-bracket" style=3D"margin-left: 0.25em; color: #555555;">]</sp=
an></span></h2><div class=3D"reflist references-column-width" style=3D"font=
-size: 12.6px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; -webkit-column-width: 30em; list-style=
-type: decimal;"><ol class=3D"references" style=3D"margin: 0.3em 0px 0.5em =
3.2em; padding: 0px; list-style-image: none; font-size: 12.6px; list-style-=
type: inherit;"><li id=3D"cite_note-nhamilton-1" style=3D"margin-bottom: 0.=
1em;"><span class=3D"mw-cite-backlink" style=3D"-webkit-user-select: none;"=

a; font-size: 1.8em; line-height: 1.3; font-family: 'Linux Libertine', Geor=
gia, Times, serif; background: none;" lang=3D"en">World Wide Web</h1><div i=
d=3D"bodyContent" class=3D"mw-body-content" style=3D"position: relative; li=
ne-height: 1.6; font-size: 0.875em; z-index: 0;"><div id=3D"siteSub" style=

.2em; margin: 0px 0px 1.4em 1em; color: #545454; width: auto;"><br></div><d=
iv id=3D"jump-to-nav" class=3D"mw-jump" style=3D"overflow: hidden; height: =
0px; zoom: 1; -webkit-user-select: none; margin-top: -1.4em; margin-bottom:=
 1.4em;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#mw-head" s=
tyle=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D=
"_blank"></a><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#p-sear=
ch" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" targ=
et=3D"_blank"></a><br></div><div id=3D"mw-content-text" dir=3D"ltr" class=
=3D"mw-content-ltr" style=3D"direction: ltr;" lang=3D"en"><div class=3D"hat=
note" style=3D"font-style: italic; padding-left: 1.6em; margin-bottom: 0.5e=
m;">"WWW" and "The web" redirect here. For other uses of WWW, see<span clas=
s=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.or=
g/wiki/WWW_(disambiguation)" title=3D"WWW (disambiguation)" class=3D"mw-dis=
ambig" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" t=
arget=3D"_blank">WWW (disambiguation)</a>. For other uses of web, see<span =
class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedi=
a.org/wiki/Web_(disambiguation)" title=3D"Web (disambiguation)" class=3D"mw=
-redirect mw-disambig" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; back=
ground: none;" target=3D"_blank">Web (disambiguation)</a>.</div><div class=
=3D"hatnote" style=3D"font-style: italic; padding-left: 1.6em; margin-botto=
m: 0.5em; margin-top: -0.5em;">For the first web software, see<span class=
=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org=
/wiki/WorldWideWeb" title=3D"WorldWideWeb" style=3D"text-decoration: none; =
color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">WorldWideWeb</a>.</div=
><p style=3D"margin: 0px; line-height: inherit;">The<span class=3D"Apple-co=
nverted-space">&nbsp;</span><b>World Wide Web</b><span class=3D"Apple-conve=
rted-space">&nbsp;</span>(<b>WWW</b>) is an<span class=3D"Apple-converted-s=
pace">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Open_source" ti=
tle=3D"Open source" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; backgro=
und: none;" target=3D"_blank">open source</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted=
-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Information_s=
pace" title=3D"Information space" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0=
b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">information space</a><span clas=
s=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>where documents and other<span cla=
ss=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.o=
rg/wiki/Web_resource" title=3D"Web resource" style=3D"text-decoration: none=
; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">web resources</a><sp=
an class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>are identified by<span clas=
s=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.or=
g/wiki/URL" title=3D"URL" class=3D"mw-redirect" style=3D"text-decoration: n=
one; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">URLs</a>, interli=
nked by<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https:=
//en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hypertext" title=3D"Hypertext" style=3D"text-decora=
tion: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">hypertext<=
/a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>links, and can be acc=
essed via the<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"=
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Internet" title=3D"Internet" style=3D"text-de=
coration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">Intern=
et</a>.<sup id=3D"cite_ref-1" class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1; =
unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; font-style: =
normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_note-=
1" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; bac=
kground: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>1<span>]</span></a></sup><s=
pan class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>The World Wide Web was inv=
ented by English scientist<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</spa=
n><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tim_Berners-Lee" title=3D"Tim Be=
rners-Lee" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none=
;" target=3D"_blank">Tim Berners-Lee</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-spac=
e">&nbsp;</span>in 1989. He wrote the first web browser in 1990 while emplo=
yed at<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https:/=
/en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CERN" title=3D"CERN" style=3D"text-decoration: none;=
 color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">CERN</a><span class=
=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>in Switzerland.<sup id=3D"cite_ref-=
2" class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font=
-size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https:/=
/en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_note-2" style=3D"text-decoration=
: none; color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_=
blank"><span>[</span>2<span>]</span></a></sup><sup id=3D"cite_ref-AHT_3-0" =
class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-si=
ze: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en=
.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_note-AHT-3" style=3D"text-decoratio=
n: none; color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"=
_blank"><span>[</span>3<span>]</span></a></sup><br data-mce-bogus=3D"1"></p=
><p style=3D"margin: 0px; line-height: inherit;">It has become known simply=
 as<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><b>the Web</b>. The W=
orld Wide Web was central to the development of the<span class=3D"Apple-con=
verted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Informa=
tion_Age" title=3D"Information Age" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: =
#0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">Information Age</a><span clas=
s=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>and is the primary tool billions o=
f people use to interact on the Internet.<sup id=3D"cite_ref-4" class=3D"re=
ference" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px;=
 font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.=
org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_note-4" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color:=
 #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[=
</span>4<span>]</span></a></sup><sup id=3D"cite_ref-5" class=3D"reference" =
style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-wei=
ght: normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/=
World_Wide_Web#cite_note-5" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080;=
 white-space: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>5<=
span>]</span></a></sup><sup id=3D"cite_ref-6" class=3D"reference" style=3D"=
line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-weight: norm=
al; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wid=
e_Web#cite_note-6" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; white-sp=
ace: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>6<span>]</s=
pan></a></sup><br data-mce-bogus=3D"1"></p><p style=3D"margin: 0px; line-he=
ight: inherit;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Web_page" title=3D=
"Web page" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none=
;" target=3D"_blank">Web pages</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nb=
sp;</span>are primarily<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><=
a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Plain_text" title=3D"Plain text" st=
yle=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"=
_blank">text</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>document=
s formatted and annotated with<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;<=
/span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hypertext_Markup_Language" t=
itle=3D"Hypertext Markup Language" class=3D"mw-redirect" style=3D"text-deco=
ration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">Hypertex=
t Markup Language</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>(HT=
ML). In addition to formatted text, web pages may contain<span class=3D"App=
le-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/I=
mage" title=3D"Image" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; backg=
round: none;" target=3D"_blank">images</a>,<span class=3D"Apple-converted-s=
pace">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Video" title=3D=
"Video" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" =
target=3D"_blank">video</a>, and software components that are rendered in t=
he user's<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"http=
s://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Web_browser" title=3D"Web browser" style=3D"text-=
decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">web =
browser</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>as coherent p=
ages of<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https:=
//en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Multimedia" title=3D"Multimedia" style=3D"text-deco=
ration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">multimed=
ia</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>content. Embedded<=
span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wik=
ipedia.org/wiki/Hyperlink" title=3D"Hyperlink" style=3D"text-decoration: no=
ne; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">hyperlinks</a><spa=
n class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>permit users to<span class=
=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org=
/wiki/Web_navigation" title=3D"Web navigation" style=3D"text-decoration: no=
ne; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">navigate</a><span =
class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>between web pages. Multiple we=
b pages with a common theme, a common<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">=
&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Domain_name" title=3D=
"Domain name" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: n=
one;" target=3D"_blank">domain name</a>, or both, may be called a<span clas=
s=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><i><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia=
.org/wiki/Website" title=3D"Website" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color:=
 #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">website</a></i>. Website con=
tent can largely be provided by the publisher, or interactive where users c=
ontribute content or the content depends upon the user or their actions. We=
bsites may be mostly informative, primarily for entertainment, or largely f=
or commercial purposes.</p><p style=3D"margin: 0px; line-height: inherit;">=
<br></p><div id=3D"toc" class=3D"toc" style=3D"border: 1px solid #aaaaaa; p=
adding: 7px; font-size: 13.3px; display: table; zoom: 1; background-color: =

yle=3D"min-width: 100px; border: 1px solid #cccccc; padding: 3px; font-size=
: 13.16px; text-align: center; overflow: hidden; width: 222px; background-c=
olor: #f9f9f9;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:CERN_web_corr=
idor.jpg" class=3D"image" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; b=
ackground: none;" target=3D"_blank"><img src=3D"https://upload.wikimedia.or=
g/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/67/CERN_web_corridor.jpg/220px-CERN_web_corrido=
r.jpg" alt=3D"" class=3D"thumbimage" style=3D"border: 1px solid #cccccc; ve=
rtical-align: middle; background-color: #ffffff;" width=3D"220" height=3D"2=
93"></a><div class=3D"thumbcaption" style=3D"border: none; line-height: 1.4=
em; padding: 3px; font-size: 12.3704px; text-align: left;"><div class=3D"ma=
gnify" style=3D"float: right; margin-left: 3px; margin-right: 0px;"><a href=
=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:CERN_web_corridor.jpg" class=3D"inte=
rnal" title=3D"Enlarge" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; dis=
play: block; text-indent: 15px; white-space: nowrap; overflow: hidden; widt=
h: 15px; height: 11px; -webkit-user-select: none; background: , ;" target=
=3D"_blank"></a><br></div>The corridor where WWW was born.<span class=3D"Ap=
ple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/=
CERN" title=3D"CERN" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; backgr=
ound: none;" target=3D"_blank">CERN</a>, ground floor of building No.1</div=
></div></div><p style=3D"margin: 0px; line-height: inherit;">Berners-Lee's =
vision of a global hyperlinked information system became a possibility by t=
he second half of the 1980s. By 1985 the global Internet began to prolifera=
te in Europe and in the<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><=
a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Domain_Name_System" title=3D"Domain=
 Name System" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: n=
one;" target=3D"_blank">Domain Name System</a><span class=3D"Apple-converte=
d-space">&nbsp;</span>(which the<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp=
;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Uniform_Resource_Locator" =
title=3D"Uniform Resource Locator" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #=
0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">Uniform Resource Locator</a><s=
pan class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>is built upon) came into b=
eing. In 1988 the first direct IP connection between Europe and North Ameri=
ca was made and Berners-Lee began to openly discuss the possibility of a we=
b-like system at CERN.<sup id=3D"cite_ref-7" class=3D"reference" style=3D"l=
ine-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-weight: norma=
l; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide=
_Web#cite_note-7" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; white-spa=
ce: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>7<span>]</sp=
an></a></sup><br data-mce-bogus=3D"1"></p><p style=3D"margin: 0px; line-hei=
ght: inherit;">In March 1989 Tim Berners-Lee issued a proposal to the manag=
ement at CERN for a system called "Mesh" that referenced<span class=3D"Appl=
e-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/EN=
QUIRE" title=3D"ENQUIRE" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; ba=
ckground: none;" target=3D"_blank">ENQUIRE</a>, a database and software pro=
ject he had built in 1980, which used the term "web" and described a more e=
laborate information management system based on links embedded in readable =
text: "Imagine, then, the references in this document all being associated =
with the network address of the thing to which they referred, so that while=
 reading this document you could skip to them with a click of the mouse." S=
uch a system, he explained, could be referred to using one of the existing =
meanings of the word<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><i><=
a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hypertext" title=3D"Hypertext" styl=
e=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_b=
lank">hypertext</a></i>, a term that he says was coined in the 1950s. There=
 is no reason, the proposal continues, why such hypertext links could not e=
ncompass multimedia documents including graphics, speech and video, so that=
 Berners-Lee goes on to use the term<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&=
nbsp;</span><i><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hypermedia" title=
=3D"Hypermedia" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background:=
 none;" target=3D"_blank">hypermedia</a></i>.<sup id=3D"cite_ref-8" class=
=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 1=
1.2px; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wiki=
pedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_note-8" style=3D"text-decoration: none; =
color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><=
span>[</span>8<span>]</span></a></sup><br data-mce-bogus=3D"1"></p><p style=
=3D"margin: 0px; line-height: inherit;">With help from his colleague and fe=
llow hypertext enthusiast<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span=
><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_Cailliau" title=3D"Robert =
Cailliau" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;=
" target=3D"_blank">Robert Cailliau</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space=
">&nbsp;</span>he published a more formal proposal on 12 November 1990 to b=
uild a "Hypertext project" called "WorldWideWeb" (one word) as a "web" of "=
hypertext documents" to be viewed by "<a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/w=
iki/Web_browser" title=3D"Web browser" style=3D"text-decoration: none; colo=
r: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">browsers</a>" using a<span=
 class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikiped=
ia.org/wiki/Client%E2%80%93server_architecture" title=3D"Client=E2=80=93ser=
ver architecture" class=3D"mw-redirect" style=3D"text-decoration: none; col=
or: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">client=E2=80=93server arc=
hitecture</a>.<sup id=3D"cite_ref-W90_9-0" class=3D"reference" style=3D"lin=
e-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal;=
 font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_W=
eb#cite_note-W90-9" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; white-s=
pace: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>9<span>]</=
span></a></sup><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>At this p=
oint HTML and HTTP had already been in development for about two months and=
 the first Web server was about a month from completing its first successfu=
l test.</p><p style=3D"margin: 0px; line-height: inherit;">This proposal es=
timated that a read-only web would be developed within three months and tha=
t it would take six months to achieve "the creation of new links and new ma=
terial by readers, [so that] authorship becomes universal" as well as "the =
automatic notification of a reader when new material of interest to him/her=
 has become available." While the read-only goal was met, accessible author=
ship of web content took longer to mature, with the<span class=3D"Apple-con=
verted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wiki" t=
itle=3D"Wiki" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: n=
one;" target=3D"_blank">wiki</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp=
;</span>concept,<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=
=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/WebDAV" title=3D"WebDAV" style=3D"text-de=
coration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">WebDAV=
</a>,<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://=
en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Blog" title=3D"Blog" style=3D"text-decoration: none; =
color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">blogs</a>,<span class=
=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org=
/wiki/Web_2.0" title=3D"Web 2.0" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b=
0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">Web 2.0</a><span class=3D"Apple-=
converted-space">&nbsp;</span>and<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbs=
p;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/RSS" title=3D"RSS" style=
=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_bl=
ank">RSS</a>/<a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Atom_(standard)" titl=
e=3D"Atom (standard)" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; backg=
round: none;" target=3D"_blank">Atom</a>.<sup id=3D"cite_ref-10" class=3D"r=
eference" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px=
; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia=
.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_note-10" style=3D"text-decoration: none; colo=
r: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span=
>[</span>10<span>]</span></a></sup><br data-mce-bogus=3D"1"></p><p style=3D=
"margin: 0px; line-height: inherit;">The proposal was modeled after the<spa=
n class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipe=
dia.org/wiki/SGML" title=3D"SGML" class=3D"mw-redirect" style=3D"text-decor=
ation: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">SGML</a><=
span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>reader<span class=3D"Appl=
e-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dy=
natext" title=3D"Dynatext" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; =
background: none;" target=3D"_blank">Dynatext</a><span class=3D"Apple-conve=
rted-space">&nbsp;</span>by Electronic Book Technology, a spin-off from the=
<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wi=
kipedia.org/wiki/Institute_for_Research_in_Information_and_Scholarship" tit=
le=3D"Institute for Research in Information and Scholarship" style=3D"text-=
decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">Inst=
itute for Research in Information and Scholarship</a><span class=3D"Apple-c=
onverted-space">&nbsp;</span>at<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;=
</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brown_University" title=3D"=
Brown University" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; backgroun=
d: none;" target=3D"_blank">Brown University</a>. The Dynatext system, lice=
nsed by CERN, was a key player in the extension of SGML ISO 8879:1986 to Hy=
permedia within<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=
=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HyTime" title=3D"HyTime" style=3D"text-de=
coration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">HyTime=
</a>, but it was considered too expensive and had an inappropriate licensin=
g policy for use in the general high energy physics community, namely a fee=
 for each document and each document alteration.</p><div class=3D"thumb tri=
ght" style=3D"clear: right; float: right; margin: 0.5em 0px 1.3em 1.4em; wi=
dth: auto; background-color: transparent;"><div class=3D"thumbinner" style=
=3D"min-width: 100px; border: 1px solid #cccccc; padding: 3px; font-size: 1=
3.16px; text-align: center; overflow: hidden; width: 222px; background-colo=
r: #f9f9f9;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Cern_datacenter.=
jpg" class=3D"image" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; backgr=
ound: none;" target=3D"_blank"><img src=3D"https://upload.wikimedia.org/wik=
ipedia/commons/thumb/9/98/Cern_datacenter.jpg/220px-Cern_datacenter.jpg" al=
t=3D"" class=3D"thumbimage" style=3D"border: 1px solid #cccccc; vertical-al=
ign: middle; background-color: #ffffff;" width=3D"220" height=3D"147"></a><=
div class=3D"thumbcaption" style=3D"border: none; line-height: 1.4em; paddi=
ng: 3px; font-size: 12.3704px; text-align: left;"><div class=3D"magnify" st=
yle=3D"float: right; margin-left: 3px; margin-right: 0px;"><a href=3D"https=
://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Cern_datacenter.jpg" class=3D"internal" title=

; text-indent: 15px; white-space: nowrap; overflow: hidden; width: 15px; he=
ight: 11px; -webkit-user-select: none; background: , ;" target=3D"_blank"><=
/a><br></div>The CERN<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a =
href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Data_center" title=3D"Data center" st=
yle=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"=
_blank">data center</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>i=
n 2010 housing some WWW servers</div></div></div><p style=3D"margin: 0px; l=
ine-height: inherit;">A<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><=
a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/NeXT_Computer" title=3D"NeXT Comput=
er" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" targ=
et=3D"_blank">NeXT Computer</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;=
</span>was used by Berners-Lee as the world's first<span class=3D"Apple-con=
verted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Web_ser=
ver" title=3D"Web server" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; b=
ackground: none;" target=3D"_blank">web server</a><span class=3D"Apple-conv=
erted-space">&nbsp;</span>and also to write the first<span class=3D"Apple-c=
onverted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Web_b=
rowser" title=3D"Web browser" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b008=
0; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">web browser</a>,<span class=3D"Appl=
e-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wo=
rldWideWeb" title=3D"WorldWideWeb" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #=
0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">WorldWideWeb</a>, in 1990. By =
Christmas 1990, Berners-Lee had built all the tools necessary for a working=
 Web:<sup id=3D"cite_ref-11" class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1; u=
nicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; font-style: n=
ormal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_note-1=
1" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; bac=
kground: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>11<span>]</span></a></sup><=
span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>the<span class=3D"Apple-c=
onverted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World=
WideWeb" title=3D"WorldWideWeb" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0=
080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">first web browser</a><span class=
=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>(which was a web editor as well) an=
d the first web server. The first web site,<sup id=3D"cite_ref-12" class=3D=
"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2=
px; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikiped=
ia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_note-12" style=3D"text-decoration: none; co=
lor: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><sp=
an>[</span>12<span>]</span></a></sup><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">=
&nbsp;</span>which described the project itself, was published on 20 Decemb=
er 1990.<sup id=3D"cite_ref-13" class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1=
; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; font-style=
: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_not=
e-13" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; =
background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>13<span>]</span></a></su=
p><br data-mce-bogus=3D"1"></p><p style=3D"margin: 0px; line-height: inheri=
t;">The first web page may be lost, but<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space=
">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paul_Jones_(compute=
r_technologist)" title=3D"Paul Jones (computer technologist)" style=3D"text=
-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">Pau=
l Jones</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>of<span class=
=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org=
/wiki/UNC-Chapel_Hill" title=3D"UNC-Chapel Hill" class=3D"mw-redirect" styl=
e=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_b=
lank">UNC-Chapel Hill</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span=
>in North Carolina announced in May 2013 that Berners-Lee gave him what he =
says is the oldest known web page during a 1991 visit to UNC. Jones stored =
it on a<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https:=
//en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Magneto-optical_drive" title=3D"Magneto-optical dri=
ve" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" targ=
et=3D"_blank">magneto-optical drive</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space=
">&nbsp;</span>and on his NeXT computer.<sup id=3D"cite_ref-14" class=3D"re=
ference" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px;=
 font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.=
org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_note-14" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color=
: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>=
[</span>14<span>]</span></a></sup><br data-mce-bogus=3D"1"></p><p style=3D"=
margin: 0px; line-height: inherit;">On 6 August 1991, Berners-Lee published=
 a short summary of the World Wide Web project on the<span class=3D"Apple-c=
onverted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Newsg=
roup" title=3D"Newsgroup" class=3D"mw-redirect" style=3D"text-decoration: n=
one; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">newsgroup</a><spa=
n class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><i>alt.hypertext</i>.<sup id=
=3D"cite_ref-15" class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi:=
 isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;"><a h=
ref=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_note-15" style=3D"=
text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; background: non=
e;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>15<span>]</span></a></sup><span class=
=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>This date also marked the debut of =
the Web as a publicly available service on the Internet, although new users=
 only accessed it after 23 August. For this reason this is considered the<s=
pan class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wiki=
pedia.org/wiki/Internaut" title=3D"Internaut" style=3D"text-decoration: non=
e; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">internaut</a>'s day=
. Several newsmedia have reported that the first photo on the Web was publi=
shed by Berners-Lee in 1992, an image of the CERN house band<span class=3D"=
Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wik=
i/Les_Horribles_Cernettes" title=3D"Les Horribles Cernettes" style=3D"text-=
decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">Les =
Horribles Cernettes</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>t=
aken by Silvano de Gennaro; Gennaro has disclaimed this story, writing that=
 media were "totally distorting our words for the sake of cheap sensational=
ism."<sup id=3D"cite_ref-16" class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1; u=
nicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; font-style: n=
ormal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_note-1=
6" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; bac=
kground: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>16<span>]</span></a></sup><=
br data-mce-bogus=3D"1"></p><p style=3D"margin: 0px; line-height: inherit;"=
>The first server outside Europe was installed at the<span class=3D"Apple-c=
onverted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SLAC_=
National_Accelerator_Laboratory" title=3D"SLAC National Accelerator Laborat=
ory" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" tar=
get=3D"_blank">Stanford Linear Accelerator Center</a><span class=3D"Apple-c=
onverted-space">&nbsp;</span>(SLAC) in Palo Alto, California, to host the<s=
pan class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wiki=
pedia.org/wiki/SPIRES" title=3D"SPIRES" class=3D"mw-redirect" style=3D"text=
-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">SPI=
RES-HEP</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>database. Acc=
ounts differ substantially as to the date of this event. The World Wide Web=
 Consortium's timeline says December 1992,<sup id=3D"cite_ref-17" class=3D"=
reference" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2p=
x; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedi=
a.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_note-17" style=3D"text-decoration: none; col=
or: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><spa=
n>[</span>17<span>]</span></a></sup><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&=
nbsp;</span>whereas SLAC itself claims December 1991,<sup id=3D"cite_ref-18=
" class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-=
size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://=
en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_note-18" style=3D"text-decoration=
: none; color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_=
blank"><span>[</span>18<span>]</span></a></sup><sup id=3D"cite_ref-19" clas=
s=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: =
11.2px; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wik=
ipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_note-19" style=3D"text-decoration: none=
; color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"=
><span>[</span>19<span>]</span></a></sup><span class=3D"Apple-converted-spa=
ce">&nbsp;</span>as does a W3C document titled<span class=3D"Apple-converte=
d-space">&nbsp;</span><i>A Little History of the World Wide Web</i>.<sup id=
=3D"cite_ref-20" class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi:=
 isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;"><a h=
ref=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_note-20" style=3D"=
text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; background: non=
e;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>20<span>]</span></a></sup><br data-mce-=
bogus=3D"1"></p><p style=3D"margin: 0px; line-height: inherit;">The underly=
ing concept of hypertext originated in previous projects from the 1960s, su=
ch as the<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"http=
s://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hypertext_Editing_System" title=3D"Hypertext Edit=
ing System" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: non=
e;" target=3D"_blank">Hypertext Editing System</a><span class=3D"Apple-conv=
erted-space">&nbsp;</span>(HES) at Brown University,<span class=3D"Apple-co=
