able-cell; text-decoration: inherit;">14</span><span class=3D"toctext" styl=
e=3D"display: table-cell; text-decoration: inherit;">References</span></a><=
br data-mce-bogus=3D"1"></li></ul></div><p style=3D"margin: 0px; line-heigh=
t: inherit;"><br></p><h2 style=3D"color: black; font-weight: normal; margin=
: 1em 0px 0.25em; overflow: hidden; padding: 0px; border-bottom-width: 1px;=
 border-bottom-style: solid; border-bottom-color: #aaaaaa; font-size: 1.5em=
; font-family: 'Linux Libertine', Georgia, Times, serif; line-height: 1.3; =
background: none;"><span class=3D"mw-headline" id=3D"History">History</span=
><span class=3D"mw-editsection" style=3D"-webkit-user-select: none; font-si=
ze: small; font-weight: normal; margin-left: 1em; vertical-align: baseline;=
 line-height: 1em; display: inline-block; white-space: nowrap; unicode-bidi=
: isolate; font-family: sans-serif;"><span class=3D"mw-editsection-bracket"=
 style=3D"margin-right: 0.25em; color: #555555;">[</span><a href=3D"https:/=
/en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=3DWorld_Wide_Web&amp;action=3Dedit&amp;=
section=3D1" title=3D"Edit section: History" style=3D"text-decoration: none=
; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">edit</a><span class=
=3D"mw-editsection-bracket" style=3D"margin-left: 0.25em; color: #555555;">=
]</span></span></h2><div class=3D"hatnote relarticle mainarticle" style=3D"=
font-style: italic; padding-left: 1.6em; margin-bottom: 0.5em;">Main articl=
e:<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.=
wikipedia.org/wiki/History_of_the_World_Wide_Web" title=3D"History of the W=
orld Wide Web" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: =
none;" target=3D"_blank">History of the World Wide Web</a><br data-mce-bogu=
s=3D"1"></div><div class=3D"thumb tright" style=3D"clear: right; float: rig=
ht; margin: 0.5em 0px 1.3em 1.4em; width: auto; background-color: transpare=
nt;"><div class=3D"thumbinner" style=3D"min-width: 100px; border: 1px solid=
 #cccccc; padding: 3px; font-size: 13.16px; text-align: center; overflow: h=
idden; width: 222px; background-color: #f9f9f9;"><a href=3D"https://en.wiki=
pedia.org/wiki/File:NeXTcube_first_webserver.JPG" class=3D"image" style=3D"=
text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"=
><img src=3D"https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/2f/NeXT=
cube_first_webserver.JPG/220px-NeXTcube_first_webserver.JPG" alt=3D"" class=
=3D"thumbimage" style=3D"border: 1px solid #cccccc; vertical-align: middle;=
 background-color: #ffffff;" width=3D"220" height=3D"145"></a><div class=3D=
"thumbcaption" style=3D"border: none; line-height: 1.4em; padding: 3px; fon=
t-size: 12.3704px; text-align: left;"><div class=3D"magnify" style=3D"float=
: right; margin-left: 3px; margin-right: 0px;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipe=
dia.org/wiki/File:NeXTcube_first_webserver.JPG" class=3D"internal" title=3D=
"Enlarge" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; display: block; t=
ext-indent: 15px; white-space: nowrap; overflow: hidden; width: 15px; heigh=
t: 11px; -webkit-user-select: none; background: , ;" target=3D"_blank"></a>=
<br></div>The NeXT Computer used by<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&n=
bsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tim_Berners-Lee" title=
=3D"Tim Berners-Lee" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; backgr=
ound: none;" target=3D"_blank">Tim Berners-Lee</a><span class=3D"Apple-conv=
erted-space">&nbsp;</span>at<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</s=
pan><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CERN" title=3D"CERN" style=3D"=
text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"=
>CERN</a>.</div></div></div><div class=3D"thumb tright" style=3D"clear: rig=
ht; float: right; margin: 0.5em 0px 1.3em 1.4em; width: auto; background-co=
lor: transparent;"><div class=3D"thumbinner" style=3D"min-width: 100px; bor=
der: 1px solid #cccccc; padding: 3px; font-size: 13.16px; text-align: cente=
r; overflow: hidden; width: 222px; background-color: #f9f9f9;"><a href=3D"h=
ttps://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:CERN_web_corridor.jpg" class=3D"image" st=
yle=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"=
_blank"><img src=3D"https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/=
67/CERN_web_corridor.jpg/220px-CERN_web_corridor.jpg" alt=3D"" class=3D"thu=
mbimage" style=3D"border: 1px solid #cccccc; vertical-align: middle; backgr=
ound-color: #ffffff;" width=3D"220" height=3D"293"></a><div class=3D"thumbc=
aption" style=3D"border: none; line-height: 1.4em; padding: 3px; font-size:=
 12.3704px; text-align: left;"><div class=3D"magnify" style=3D"float: right=
; margin-left: 3px; margin-right: 0px;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org=
/wiki/File:CERN_web_corridor.jpg" class=3D"internal" title=3D"Enlarge" styl=
e=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; display: block; text-indent: 15=
px; white-space: nowrap; overflow: hidden; width: 15px; height: 11px; -webk=
it-user-select: none; background: , ;" target=3D"_blank"></a><br></div>The =
corridor where WWW was born.<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</s=
pan><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CERN" title=3D"CERN" style=3D"=
text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"=
>CERN</a>, ground floor of building No.1</div></div></div><p style=3D"margi=
n: 0px; line-height: inherit;">Berners-Lee's vision of a global hyperlinked=
 information system became a possibility by the second half of the 1980s. B=
y 1985 the global Internet began to proliferate in Europe and in the<span c=
lass=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia=
.org/wiki/Domain_Name_System" title=3D"Domain Name System" style=3D"text-de=
coration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">Domain=
 Name System</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>(which t=
he<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.=
wikipedia.org/wiki/Uniform_Resource_Locator" title=3D"Uniform Resource Loca=
tor" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" tar=
get=3D"_blank">Uniform Resource Locator</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-s=
pace">&nbsp;</span>is built upon) came into being. In 1988 the first direct=
 IP connection between Europe and North America was made and Berners-Lee be=
gan to openly discuss the possibility of a web-like system at CERN.<sup id=
=3D"cite_ref-7" class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: =
isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;"><a hr=
ef=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_note-7" style=3D"te=
xt-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; background: none;=
" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>7<span>]</span></a></sup><br data-mce-bog=
us=3D"1"></p><p style=3D"margin: 0px; line-height: inherit;">In March 1989 =
Tim Berners-Lee issued a proposal to the management at CERN for a system ca=
lled "Mesh" that referenced<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</sp=
an><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ENQUIRE" title=3D"ENQUIRE" styl=
e=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_b=
lank">ENQUIRE</a>, a database and software project he had built in 1980, wh=
ich used the term "web" and described a more elaborate information manageme=
nt system based on links embedded in readable text: "Imagine, then, the ref=
erences in this document all being associated with the network address of t=
he thing to which they referred, so that while reading this document you co=
uld skip to them with a click of the mouse." Such a system, he explained, c=
ould be referred to using one of the existing meanings of the word<span cla=
ss=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><i><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedi=
a.org/wiki/Hypertext" title=3D"Hypertext" style=3D"text-decoration: none; c=
olor: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">hypertext</a></i>, a te=
rm that he says was coined in the 1950s. There is no reason, the proposal c=
ontinues, why such hypertext links could not encompass multimedia documents=
 including graphics, speech and video, so that Berners-Lee goes on to use t=
he term<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><i><a href=3D"htt=
ps://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hypermedia" title=3D"Hypermedia" style=3D"text-d=
ecoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">hyper=
media</a></i>.<sup id=3D"cite_ref-8" class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-heig=
ht: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; font-=
style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cit=
e_note-8" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; white-space: nowr=
ap; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>8<span>]</span></a><=
/sup><br data-mce-bogus=3D"1"></p><p style=3D"margin: 0px; line-height: inh=
erit;">With help from his colleague and fellow hypertext enthusiast<span cl=
ass=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.=
org/wiki/Robert_Cailliau" title=3D"Robert Cailliau" style=3D"text-decoratio=
n: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">Robert Cailli=
au</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>he published a mor=
e formal proposal on 12 November 1990 to build a "Hypertext project" called=
 "WorldWideWeb" (one word) as a "web" of "hypertext documents" to be viewed=
 by "<a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Web_browser" title=3D"Web bro=
wser" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" ta=
rget=3D"_blank">browsers</a>" using a<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">=
&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Client%E2%80%93server=
_architecture" title=3D"Client=E2=80=93server architecture" class=3D"mw-red=
irect" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" t=
arget=3D"_blank">client=E2=80=93server architecture</a>.<sup id=3D"cite_ref=
-W90_9-0" class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolat=
e; font-size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"=
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_note-W90-9" style=3D"text=
-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; background: none;" =
target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>9<span>]</span></a></sup><span class=3D"App=
le-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>At this point HTML and HTTP had already be=
en in development for about two months and the first Web server was about a=
 month from completing its first successful test.</p><p style=3D"margin: 0p=
x; line-height: inherit;">This proposal estimated that a read-only web woul=
d be developed within three months and that it would take six months to ach=
ieve "the creation of new links and new material by readers, [so that] auth=
orship becomes universal" as well as "the automatic notification of a reade=
r when new material of interest to him/her has become available." While the=
 read-only goal was met, accessible authorship of web content took longer t=
o mature, with the<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a hre=
f=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wiki" title=3D"Wiki" style=3D"text-decor=
ation: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">wiki</a><=
span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>concept,<span class=3D"Ap=
ple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/=
WebDAV" title=3D"WebDAV" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; ba=
ckground: none;" target=3D"_blank">WebDAV</a>,<span class=3D"Apple-converte=
d-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Blog" title=
=3D"Blog" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;=
" target=3D"_blank">blogs</a>,<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;<=
/span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Web_2.0" title=3D"Web 2.0" s=
tyle=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D=
"_blank">Web 2.0</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>and<=
span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wik=
ipedia.org/wiki/RSS" title=3D"RSS" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #=
0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">RSS</a>/<a href=3D"https://en.=
wikipedia.org/wiki/Atom_(standard)" title=3D"Atom (standard)" style=3D"text=
-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">Ato=
m</a>.<sup id=3D"cite_ref-10" class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1; =
unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; font-style: =
normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_note-=
10" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; ba=
ckground: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>10<span>]</span></a></sup>=
<br data-mce-bogus=3D"1"></p><p style=3D"margin: 0px; line-height: inherit;=
">The proposal was modeled after the<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&=
nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SGML" title=3D"SGML" c=
lass=3D"mw-redirect" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; backgr=
ound: none;" target=3D"_blank">SGML</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space=
">&nbsp;</span>reader<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a =
href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dynatext" title=3D"Dynatext" style=3D=
"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank=
">Dynatext</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>by Electro=
nic Book Technology, a spin-off from the<span class=3D"Apple-converted-spac=
e">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Institute_for_Rese=
arch_in_Information_and_Scholarship" title=3D"Institute for Research in Inf=
ormation and Scholarship" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; b=
ackground: none;" target=3D"_blank">Institute for Research in Information a=
nd Scholarship</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>at<spa=
n class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipe=
dia.org/wiki/Brown_University" title=3D"Brown University" style=3D"text-dec=
oration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">Brown U=
niversity</a>. The Dynatext system, licensed by CERN, was a key player in t=
he extension of SGML ISO 8879:1986 to Hypermedia within<span class=3D"Apple=
-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HyT=
ime" title=3D"HyTime" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; backg=
round: none;" target=3D"_blank">HyTime</a>, but it was considered too expen=
sive and had an inappropriate licensing policy for use in the general high =
energy physics community, namely a fee for each document and each document =
alteration.</p><div class=3D"thumb tright" style=3D"clear: right; float: ri=
ght; margin: 0.5em 0px 1.3em 1.4em; width: auto; background-color: transpar=
ent;"><div class=3D"thumbinner" style=3D"min-width: 100px; border: 1px soli=
d #cccccc; padding: 3px; font-size: 13.16px; text-align: center; overflow: =
hidden; width: 222px; background-color: #f9f9f9;"><a href=3D"https://en.wik=
ipedia.org/wiki/File:Cern_datacenter.jpg" class=3D"image" style=3D"text-dec=
oration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><img sr=
c=3D"https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/98/Cern_datacen=
ter.jpg/220px-Cern_datacenter.jpg" alt=3D"" class=3D"thumbimage" style=3D"b=
order: 1px solid #cccccc; vertical-align: middle; background-color: #ffffff=
;" width=3D"220" height=3D"147"></a><div class=3D"thumbcaption" style=3D"bo=
rder: none; line-height: 1.4em; padding: 3px; font-size: 12.3704px; text-al=
ign: left;"><div class=3D"magnify" style=3D"float: right; margin-left: 3px;=
 margin-right: 0px;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Cern_dat=
acenter.jpg" class=3D"internal" title=3D"Enlarge" style=3D"text-decoration:=
 none; color: #0b0080; display: block; text-indent: 15px; white-space: nowr=
ap; overflow: hidden; width: 15px; height: 11px; -webkit-user-select: none;=
 background: , ;" target=3D"_blank"></a><br></div>The CERN<span class=3D"Ap=
ple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/=
Data_center" title=3D"Data center" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #=
0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">data center</a><span class=3D"=
Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>in 2010 housing some WWW servers</div><=
/div></div><p style=3D"margin: 0px; line-height: inherit;">A<span class=3D"=
Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wik=
i/NeXT_Computer" title=3D"NeXT Computer" style=3D"text-decoration: none; co=
lor: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">NeXT Computer</a><span c=
lass=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>was used by Berners-Lee as the =
world's first<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"=
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Web_server" title=3D"Web server" style=3D"tex=
t-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">we=
b server</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>and also to =
write the first<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=
=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Web_browser" title=3D"Web browser" style=
=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_bl=
ank">web browser</a>,<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a =
href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/WorldWideWeb" title=3D"WorldWideWeb" =
style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=
=3D"_blank">WorldWideWeb</a>, in 1990. By Christmas 1990, Berners-Lee had b=
uilt all the tools necessary for a working Web:<sup id=3D"cite_ref-11" clas=
s=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: =
11.2px; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wik=
ipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_note-11" style=3D"text-decoration: none=
; color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"=
><span>[</span>11<span>]</span></a></sup><span class=3D"Apple-converted-spa=
ce">&nbsp;</span>the<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a h=
ref=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/WorldWideWeb" title=3D"WorldWideWeb" s=
tyle=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D=
"_blank">first web browser</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;<=
/span>(which was a web editor as well) and the first web server. The first =
web site,<sup id=3D"cite_ref-12" class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: =
1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; font-styl=
e: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_no=
te-12" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap;=
 background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>12<span>]</span></a></s=
up><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>which described the p=
roject itself, was published on 20 December 1990.<sup id=3D"cite_ref-13" cl=
ass=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size=
: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.w=
ikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_note-13" style=3D"text-decoration: no=
ne; color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_blan=
k"><span>[</span>13<span>]</span></a></sup><br data-mce-bogus=3D"1"></p><p =
style=3D"margin: 0px; line-height: inherit;">The first web page may be lost=
, but<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://=
en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paul_Jones_(computer_technologist)" title=3D"Paul Jon=
es (computer technologist)" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080;=
 background: none;" target=3D"_blank">Paul Jones</a><span class=3D"Apple-co=
nverted-space">&nbsp;</span>of<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;<=
/span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UNC-Chapel_Hill" title=3D"UN=
C-Chapel Hill" class=3D"mw-redirect" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color:=
 #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">UNC-Chapel Hill</a><span cla=
ss=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>in North Carolina announced in Ma=
y 2013 that Berners-Lee gave him what he says is the oldest known web page =
during a 1991 visit to UNC. Jones stored it on a<span class=3D"Apple-conver=
ted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Magneto-op=
tical_drive" title=3D"Magneto-optical drive" style=3D"text-decoration: none=
; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">magneto-optical driv=
e</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>and on his NeXT com=
puter.<sup id=3D"cite_ref-14" class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1; =
unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; font-style: =
normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_note-=
14" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; ba=
ckground: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>14<span>]</span></a></sup>=
<br data-mce-bogus=3D"1"></p><p style=3D"margin: 0px; line-height: inherit;=
">On 6 August 1991, Berners-Lee published a short summary of the World Wide=
 Web project on the<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a hr=
ef=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Newsgroup" title=3D"Newsgroup" class=3D=
"mw-redirect" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: n=
one;" target=3D"_blank">newsgroup</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">=
&nbsp;</span><i>alt.hypertext</i>.<sup id=3D"cite_ref-15" class=3D"referenc=
e" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-=
weight: normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wi=
ki/World_Wide_Web#cite_note-15" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0=
080; white-space: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</spa=
n>15<span>]</span></a></sup><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</s=
pan>This date also marked the debut of the Web as a publicly available serv=
ice on the Internet, although new users only accessed it after 23 August. F=
or this reason this is considered the<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">=
&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Internaut" title=3D"I=
nternaut" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;=
" target=3D"_blank">internaut</a>'s day. Several newsmedia have reported th=
at the first photo on the Web was published by Berners-Lee in 1992, an imag=
e of the CERN house band<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>=
<a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Les_Horribles_Cernettes" title=3D"=
Les Horribles Cernettes" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; ba=
ckground: none;" target=3D"_blank">Les Horribles Cernettes</a><span class=
=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>taken by Silvano de Gennaro; Gennar=
o has disclaimed this story, writing that media were "totally distorting ou=
r words for the sake of cheap sensationalism."<sup id=3D"cite_ref-16" class=
=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 1=
1.2px; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wiki=
pedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_note-16" style=3D"text-decoration: none;=
 color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">=
<span>[</span>16<span>]</span></a></sup><br data-mce-bogus=3D"1"></p><p sty=
le=3D"margin: 0px; line-height: inherit;">The first server outside Europe w=
as installed at the<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a hr=
ef=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SLAC_National_Accelerator_Laboratory" t=
itle=3D"SLAC National Accelerator Laboratory" style=3D"text-decoration: non=
e; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">Stanford Linear Acc=
elerator Center</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>(SLAC=
) in Palo Alto, California, to host the<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space=
">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SPIRES" title=3D"SP=
IRES" class=3D"mw-redirect" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080;=
 background: none;" target=3D"_blank">SPIRES-HEP</a><span class=3D"Apple-co=
nverted-space">&nbsp;</span>database. Accounts differ substantially as to t=
he date of this event. The World Wide Web Consortium's timeline says Decemb=
er 1992,<sup id=3D"cite_ref-17" class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1=
; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; font-style=
: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_not=
e-17" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; =
background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>17<span>]</span></a></su=
p><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>whereas SLAC itself cl=
aims December 1991,<sup id=3D"cite_ref-18" class=3D"reference" style=3D"lin=
e-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal;=
 font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_W=
eb#cite_note-18" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; white-spac=
e: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>18<span>]</sp=
an></a></sup><sup id=3D"cite_ref-19" class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-heig=
ht: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; font-=
style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cit=
e_note-19" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; white-space: now=
rap; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>19<span>]</span></a=
></sup><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>as does a W3C doc=
ument titled<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><i>A Little =
History of the World Wide Web</i>.<sup id=3D"cite_ref-20" class=3D"referenc=
e" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-=
weight: normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wi=
ki/World_Wide_Web#cite_note-20" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0=
080; white-space: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</spa=
n>20<span>]</span></a></sup><br data-mce-bogus=3D"1"></p><p style=3D"margin=
: 0px; line-height: inherit;">The underlying concept of hypertext originate=
d in previous projects from the 1960s, such as the<span class=3D"Apple-conv=
erted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hypertex=
t_Editing_System" title=3D"Hypertext Editing System" style=3D"text-decorati=
on: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">Hypertext Ed=
iting System</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>(HES) at=
 Brown University,<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a hre=
f=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ted_Nelson" title=3D"Ted Nelson" style=
=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_bl=
ank">Ted Nelson</a>'s<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a =
href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Project_Xanadu" title=3D"Project Xana=
du" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" targ=
et=3D"_blank">Project Xanadu</a>, and<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">=
&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Douglas_Engelbart" ti=
tle=3D"Douglas Engelbart" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; b=
ackground: none;" target=3D"_blank">Douglas Engelbart</a>'s<span class=3D"A=
pple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki=
/NLS_(computer_system)" title=3D"NLS (computer system)" style=3D"text-decor=
ation: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">oN-Line S=
ystem</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>(NLS). Both Nel=
son and Engelbart were in turn inspired by<span class=3D"Apple-converted-sp=
ace">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vannevar_Bush" t=
itle=3D"Vannevar Bush" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; back=
ground: none;" target=3D"_blank">Vannevar Bush</a>'s<span class=3D"Apple-co=
nverted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Microf=
ilm" title=3D"Microfilm" class=3D"mw-redirect" style=3D"text-decoration: no=
ne; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">microfilm</a>-base=
d<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><i><a href=3D"https://e=
n.wikipedia.org/wiki/Memex" title=3D"Memex" style=3D"text-decoration: none;=
 color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">memex</a></i>, which =
was described in the 1945 essay "<a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A=
s_We_May_Think" title=3D"As We May Think" style=3D"text-decoration: none; c=
olor: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">As We May Think</a>".<s=
up id=3D"cite_ref-Conkling_21-0" class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: =
1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; font-styl=
e: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_no=
te-Conkling-21" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; white-space=
: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>21<span>]</spa=
n></a></sup><br data-mce-bogus=3D"1"></p><p style=3D"margin: 0px; line-heig=
ht: inherit;">Berners-Lee's breakthrough was to marry hypertext to the Inte=
rnet. In his book<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><i><a h=
ref=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Weaving_the_Web:_The_Original_Design_a=
nd_Ultimate_Destiny_of_the_World_Wide_Web_by_its_inventor" title=3D"Weaving=
 the Web: The Original Design and Ultimate Destiny of the World Wide Web by=
 its inventor" class=3D"mw-redirect" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color:=
 #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">Weaving The Web</a></i>, he =
explains that he had repeatedly suggested that a marriage between the two t=
echnologies was possible to members of<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space"=
>&nbsp;</span><i>both</i><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span=
>technical communities, but when no one took up his invitation, he finally =
assumed the project himself. In the process, he developed three essential t=
echnologies:</p><ul style=3D"list-style-type: disc; margin: 0.3em 0px 0px 1=
.6em; padding: 0px;"><li style=3D"margin-bottom: 0.1em;">a system of global=
ly unique identifiers for resources on the Web and elsewhere, the universal=
 document identifier (UDI), later known as<span class=3D"Apple-converted-sp=
ace">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Uniform_resource=
_locator" title=3D"Uniform resource locator" class=3D"mw-redirect" style=3D=
"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank=
">uniform resource locator</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;<=
/span>(URL) and<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=
=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Uniform_resource_identifier" title=3D"Uni=
form resource identifier" class=3D"mw-redirect" style=3D"text-decoration: n=
one; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">uniform resource =
identifier</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>(URI);</li=
><li style=3D"margin-bottom: 0.1em;">the publishing language<span class=3D"=
Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wik=
i/Hypertext_Markup_Language" title=3D"Hypertext Markup Language" class=3D"m=
w-redirect" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: non=
e;" target=3D"_blank">HyperText Markup Language</a><span class=3D"Apple-con=
verted-space">&nbsp;</span>(HTML);</li><li style=3D"margin-bottom: 0.1em;">=
the<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en=
.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hypertext_Transfer_Protocol" title=3D"Hypertext Transfe=
r Protocol" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: non=
e;" target=3D"_blank">Hypertext Transfer Protocol</a><span class=3D"Apple-c=
onverted-space">&nbsp;</span>(HTTP).<sup id=3D"cite_ref-22" class=3D"refere=
nce" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; fon=
t-weight: normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/=
wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_note-22" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0=
b0080; white-space: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</s=
pan>22<span>]</span></a></sup><br data-mce-bogus=3D"1"></li></ul><p style=
=3D"margin: 0px; line-height: inherit;">The World Wide Web had a number of =
differences from other hypertext systems available at the time. The Web req=
uired only unidirectional links rather than bidirectional ones, making it p=
ossible for someone to link to another resource without action by the owner=
 of that resource. It also significantly reduced the difficulty of implemen=
ting web servers and browsers (in comparison to earlier systems), but in tu=
rn presented the chronic problem of<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&n=
bsp;</span><i><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Link_rot" title=3D"L=
ink rot" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;"=
 target=3D"_blank">link rot</a></i>.</p><p style=3D"margin: 0px; line-heigh=
t: inherit;">Unlike predecessors such as<span class=3D"Apple-converted-spac=
e">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HyperCard" title=
=3D"HyperCard" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: =
none;" target=3D"_blank">HyperCard</a>, the World Wide Web was non-propriet=
ary, making it possible to develop servers and clients independently and to=
 add extensions without licensing restrictions. On 30 April 1993, CERN anno=
unced that the World Wide Web would be free to anyone, with no fees due.<su=
p id=3D"cite_ref-23" class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-b=
idi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;">=
<a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_note-23" style=
=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; background:=
 none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>23<span>]</span></a></sup><span cla=
ss=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>Coming two months after the annou=
ncement that the server implementation of the<span class=3D"Apple-converted=
-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gopher_(proto=
col)" title=3D"Gopher (protocol)" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0=
b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">Gopher</a><span class=3D"Apple-=
converted-space">&nbsp;</span>protocol was no longer free to use, this prod=
uced a rapid shift away from Gopher and towards the Web. An early popular w=
eb browser was<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D=
"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ViolaWWW" title=3D"ViolaWWW" style=3D"text-d=
ecoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">Viola=
WWW</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>for<span class=3D=
"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wi=
ki/Unix" title=3D"Unix" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; bac=
kground: none;" target=3D"_blank">Unix</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-sp=
ace">&nbsp;</span>and the<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span=
><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/X_Windowing_System" title=3D"X Wi=
ndowing System" class=3D"mw-redirect" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color=
: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">X Windowing System</a>.</p>=
<div class=3D"thumb tright" style=3D"clear: right; float: right; margin: 0.=
5em 0px 1.3em 1.4em; width: auto; background-color: transparent;"><div clas=
s=3D"thumbinner" style=3D"min-width: 100px; border: 1px solid #cccccc; padd=

arget=3D"_blank"><img src=3D"https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons=

x-Cailliau_Abramatic_Berners-Lee_10_years_WWW_consortium.png" alt=3D"" clas=
s=3D"thumbimage" style=3D"border: 1px solid #cccccc; vertical-align: middle=
; background-color: #ffffff;" width=3D"220" height=3D"164"></a><div class=
=3D"thumbcaption" style=3D"border: none; line-height: 1.4em; padding: 3px; =
font-size: 12.3704px; text-align: left;"><div class=3D"magnify" style=3D"fl=
oat: right; margin-left: 3px; margin-right: 0px;"><a href=3D"https://en.wik=
ipedia.org/wiki/File:Cailliau_Abramatic_Berners-Lee_10_years_WWW_consortium=
.png" class=3D"internal" title=3D"Enlarge" style=3D"text-decoration: none; =
color: #0b0080; display: block; text-indent: 15px; white-space: nowrap; ove=
rflow: hidden; width: 15px; height: 11px; -webkit-user-select: none; backgr=
ound: , ;" target=3D"_blank"></a><br></div><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.=
org/wiki/Robert_Cailliau" title=3D"Robert Cailliau" style=3D"text-decoratio=
n: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">Robert Cailli=
au</a>, Jean-Fran=C3=A7ois Abramatic formerly of<span class=3D"Apple-conver=
ted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/French_Ins=
titute_for_Research_in_Computer_Science_and_Automation" title=3D"French Ins=
titute for Research in Computer Science and Automation" style=3D"text-decor=
ation: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">INRIA</a>=
, and<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://=
en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tim_Berners-Lee" title=3D"Tim Berners-Lee" style=3D"t=
ext-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">=
Tim Berners-Lee</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>at th=
e 10th anniversary of the World Wide Web Consortium.</div></div></div><p st=
yle=3D"margin: 0px; line-height: inherit;">Scholars generally agree that a =
turning point for the World Wide Web began with the introduction<sup id=3D"=
cite_ref-24" class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: iso=
late; font-size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=
=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_note-24" style=3D"tex=
t-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; background: none;"=
 target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>24<span>]</span></a></sup><span class=3D"A=
pple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>of the<span class=3D"Apple-converted-spa=
ce">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mosaic_(web_brows=
er)" title=3D"Mosaic (web browser)" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: =
#0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">Mosaic</a><span class=3D"Appl=
e-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>web browser<sup id=3D"cite_ref-25" class=3D=
"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2=
px; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikiped=
ia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_note-25" style=3D"text-decoration: none; co=
lor: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><sp=
an>[</span>25<span>]</span></a></sup><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">=
&nbsp;</span>in 1993, a graphical browser developed by a team at the<span c=
lass=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia=
.org/wiki/National_Center_for_Supercomputing_Applications" title=3D"Nationa=
l Center for Supercomputing Applications" style=3D"text-decoration: none; c=
olor: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">National Center for Sup=
ercomputing Applications</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</s=
pan>at the<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"htt=
ps://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/University_of_Illinois_at_Urbana-Champaign" titl=
e=3D"University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign" class=3D"mw-redirect" styl=
e=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_b=
lank">University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign</a><span class=3D"Apple-co=
nverted-space">&nbsp;</span>(NCSA-UIUC), led by<span class=3D"Apple-convert=
ed-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marc_Andree=
ssen" title=3D"Marc Andreessen" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0=
080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">Marc Andreessen</a>. Funding for =
Mosaic came from the U.S.<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span=
><i>High-Performance Computing and Communications Initiative</i><span class=
=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>and the<span class=3D"Apple-convert=
ed-space">&nbsp;</span><i><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/High_Per=
formance_Computing_and_Communication_Act_of_1991" title=3D"High Performance=
 Computing and Communication Act of 1991" class=3D"mw-redirect" style=3D"te=
xt-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">H=
igh Performance Computing and Communication Act of 1991</a></i>, one of<spa=
n class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipe=
dia.org/wiki/Al_Gore_and_information_technology" title=3D"Al Gore and infor=
mation technology" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; backgrou=
nd: none;" target=3D"_blank">several computing developments initiated by U.=
S. Senator Al Gore</a>.<sup id=3D"cite_ref-26" class=3D"reference" style=3D=
"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-weight: nor=
mal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wi=
de_Web#cite_note-26" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; white-=
space: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>26<span>]=
</span></a></sup><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>Prior t=
o the release of Mosaic, graphics were not commonly mixed with text in web =
pages and the web's popularity was less than older protocols in use over th=
e Internet, such as<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a hr=
ef=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gopher_(protocol)" title=3D"Gopher (pro=
tocol)" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" =
target=3D"_blank">Gopher</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</s=
pan>and<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https:=
//en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wide_Area_Information_Servers" title=3D"Wide Area I=
nformation Servers" class=3D"mw-redirect" style=3D"text-decoration: none; c=
olor: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">Wide Area Information S=
ervers</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>(WAIS). Mosaic=
's graphical user interface allowed the Web to become, by far, the most pop=
ular Internet protocol.</p><p style=3D"margin: 0px; line-height: inherit;">=
The<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en=
.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web_Consortium" title=3D"World Wide Web Cons=
ortium" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" =
target=3D"_blank">World Wide Web Consortium</a><span class=3D"Apple-convert=
ed-space">&nbsp;</span>(W3C) was founded by Tim Berners-Lee after he left t=
he European Organization for Nuclear Research (CERN) in October 1994. It wa=
s founded at the<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=
=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Massachusetts_Institute_of_Technology" ti=
tle=3D"Massachusetts Institute of Technology" style=3D"text-decoration: non=
e; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">Massachusetts Insti=
tute of Technology</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>La=
boratory for Computer Science (MIT/LCS) with support from the<span class=3D=
"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wi=
ki/Defense_Advanced_Research_Projects_Agency" title=3D"Defense Advanced Res=
earch Projects Agency" class=3D"mw-redirect" style=3D"text-decoration: none=
; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">Defense Advanced Res=
earch Projects Agency</a>(DARPA), which had pioneered the Internet; a year =
later, a second site was founded at<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&n=
bsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/INRIA" title=3D"INRIA" =
class=3D"mw-redirect" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; backg=
round: none;" target=3D"_blank">INRIA</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-spa=
ce">&nbsp;</span>(a French national computer research lab) with support fro=
m the<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://=
en.wikipedia.org/wiki/European_Commission" title=3D"European Commission" st=
yle=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"=
_blank">European Commission</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;=
</span>DG InfSo; and in 1996, a third continental site was created in Japan=
 at<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en=
.wikipedia.org/wiki/Keio_University" title=3D"Keio University" style=3D"tex=
t-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">Ke=
io University</a>. By the end of 1994, the total number of websites was sti=
ll relatively small, but many<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</=
span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_websites_founded_befo=
re_1995" title=3D"List of websites founded before 1995" style=3D"text-decor=
ation: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">notable w=
ebsites</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>were already =
active that foreshadowed or inspired today's most popular services.</p><p s=
tyle=3D"margin: 0px; line-height: inherit;">Connected by the existing Inter=
net, other websites were created around the world, adding international sta=
ndards for<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"htt=
ps://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Domain_name" title=3D"Domain name" style=3D"text=
-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">dom=
ain names</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>and<span cl=
ass=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.=
org/wiki/HTML" title=3D"HTML" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b008=
0; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">HTML</a>. Since then, Berners-Lee h=
as played an active role in guiding the development of web standards (such =
as the<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https:/=
/en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Markup_language" title=3D"Markup language" style=3D"=
text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"=
>markup languages</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>to =
compose web pages in), and has advocated his vision of a<span class=3D"Appl=
e-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Se=
mantic_Web" title=3D"Semantic Web" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #=
0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">Semantic Web</a>. The World Wi=
de Web enabled the spread of information over the Internet through an easy-=
to-use and flexible format. It thus played an important role in popularizin=
g use of the Internet.<sup id=3D"cite_ref-27" class=3D"reference" style=3D"=
line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-weight: norm=
al; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wid=
e_Web#cite_note-27" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; white-s=
pace: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>27<span>]<=
/span></a></sup><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>Although=
 the two terms are sometimes<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</s=
pan><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conflation" title=3D"Conflatio=
n" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" targe=
t=3D"_blank">conflated</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</spa=
n>in popular use,<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><i>Worl=
d Wide Web</i><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>is not<spa=
n class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipe=
dia.org/wiki/Synonym" title=3D"Synonym" style=3D"text-decoration: none; col=
or: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">synonymous</a><span class=
=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>with<span class=3D"Apple-converted-=
space">&nbsp;</span><i>Internet</i>.<sup id=3D"cite_ref-28" class=3D"refere=
nce" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; fon=
t-weight: normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/=
wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_note-28" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0=
b0080; white-space: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</s=
pan>28<span>]</span></a></sup><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;<=
/span>The Web is an<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a hr=
ef=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Information_space" title=3D"Information=
 space" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" =
target=3D"_blank">information space</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space=
">&nbsp;</span>containing hyperlinked documents and other<span class=3D"App=
le-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/W=
eb_resource" title=3D"Web resource" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: =
#0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">resources</a>, identified by =
their URIs.<sup id=3D"cite_ref-29" class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height=
: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; font-st=
yle: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_=
note-29" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; white-space: nowra=
p; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>29<span>]</span></a><=
/sup><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>It is implemented a=
s both client and server software using Internet protocols such as<span cla=
ss=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.o=
rg/wiki/TCP/IP" title=3D"TCP/IP" class=3D"mw-redirect" style=3D"text-decora=
tion: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">TCP/IP</a>=
<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>and<span class=3D"Apple-=
converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HTTP=
" title=3D"HTTP" class=3D"mw-redirect" style=3D"text-decoration: none; colo=
r: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">HTTP</a>.</p><p style=3D"m=
argin: 0px; line-height: inherit;">Tim Berners-Lee was<span class=3D"Apple-=
converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Orde=
r_of_the_British_Empire" title=3D"Order of the British Empire" style=3D"tex=
t-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">kn=
ighted</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>in 2004 by Que=
en<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.=
wikipedia.org/wiki/Elizabeth_II" title=3D"Elizabeth II" style=3D"text-decor=
ation: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">Elizabeth=
 II</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>for "services to =
the global development of the Internet".<sup id=3D"cite_ref-gaz_30-0" class=
=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 1=
1.2px; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wiki=
pedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_note-gaz-30" style=3D"text-decoration: n=
one; color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_bla=
nk"><span>[</span>30<span>]</span></a></sup><sup id=3D"cite_ref-31" class=
=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 1=
1.2px; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wiki=
pedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_note-31" style=3D"text-decoration: none;=
 color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">=
<span>[</span>31<span>]</span></a></sup><br data-mce-bogus=3D"1"></p><h2 st=
yle=3D"color: black; font-weight: normal; margin: 1em 0px 0.25em; overflow:=
 hidden; padding: 0px; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-bottom-style: solid=
; border-bottom-color: #aaaaaa; font-size: 1.5em; font-family: 'Linux Liber=
tine', Georgia, Times, serif; line-height: 1.3; background: none;"><span cl=
ass=3D"mw-headline" id=3D"Function">Function</span><span class=3D"mw-editse=
ction" style=3D"-webkit-user-select: none; font-size: small; font-weight: n=
ormal; margin-left: 1em; vertical-align: baseline; line-height: 1em; displa=
y: inline-block; white-space: nowrap; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-family: s=
ans-serif;"><span class=3D"mw-editsection-bracket" style=3D"margin-right: 0=
.25em; color: #555555;">[</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index=
.php?title=3DWorld_Wide_Web&amp;action=3Dedit&amp;section=3D2" title=3D"Edi=
t section: Function" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; backgr=
ound: none;" target=3D"_blank">edit</a><span class=3D"mw-editsection-bracke=
t" style=3D"margin-left: 0.25em; color: #555555;">]</span></span></h2><div =
class=3D"thumb tright" style=3D"clear: right; float: right; margin: 0.5em 0=
px 1.3em 1.4em; width: auto; background-color: transparent;"><div class=3D"=
thumbinner" style=3D"min-width: 100px; border: 1px solid #cccccc; padding: =
3px; font-size: 13.16px; text-align: center; overflow: hidden; width: 222px=
; background-color: #f9f9f9;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File=
:Internet_Key_Layers.png" class=3D"image" style=3D"text-decoration: none; c=
olor: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><img src=3D"https://upl=
oad.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/39/Internet_Key_Layers.png/220p=
x-Internet_Key_Layers.png" alt=3D"" class=3D"thumbimage" style=3D"border: 1=
px solid #cccccc; vertical-align: middle; background-color: #ffffff;" width=
=3D"220" height=3D"154"></a><div class=3D"thumbcaption" style=3D"border: no=
ne; line-height: 1.4em; padding: 3px; font-size: 12.3704px; text-align: lef=
t;"><div class=3D"magnify" style=3D"float: right; margin-left: 3px; margin-=
right: 0px;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Internet_Key_Lay=
ers.png" class=3D"internal" title=3D"Enlarge" style=3D"text-decoration: non=
e; color: #0b0080; display: block; text-indent: 15px; white-space: nowrap; =
overflow: hidden; width: 15px; height: 11px; -webkit-user-select: none; bac=
kground: , ;" target=3D"_blank"></a><br></div>The World Wide Web functions =
as a layer on top of the Internet, helping to make it more functional. The =
advent of the<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"=
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mosaic_(web_browser)" title=3D"Mosaic (web br=
owser)" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" =
target=3D"_blank">Mosaic</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</s=
pan>web browser helped to make the web much more usable.</div></div></div><=
p style=3D"margin: 0px; line-height: inherit;">The terms<span class=3D"Appl=
e-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><i>Internet</i><span class=3D"Apple-convert=
ed-space">&nbsp;</span>and<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</spa=
n><i>World Wide Web</i><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>a=
re often used without much distinction. However, the two are not the same. =
The Internet is a global system of interconnected<a href=3D"https://en.wiki=
pedia.org/wiki/Computer_networks" title=3D"Computer networks" class=3D"mw-r=
edirect" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;"=
 target=3D"_blank">computer networks</a>. In contrast, the World Wide Web i=
s one of the services transferred over these networks. It is a collection o=
f text documents and other resources, linked by hyperlinks and URLs, usuall=
y accessed by<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"=
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Web_browser" title=3D"Web browser" style=3D"t=
ext-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">=
web browsers</a>, from web servers.<sup id=3D"cite_ref-32" class=3D"referen=
ce" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font=
-weight: normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/w=
iki/World_Wide_Web#cite_note-32" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b=
0080; white-space: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</sp=
an>32<span>]</span></a></sup><br data-mce-bogus=3D"1"></p><p style=3D"margi=
n: 0px; line-height: inherit;">Viewing a<span class=3D"Apple-converted-spac=
e">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Web_page" title=3D=
"Web page" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none=
;" target=3D"_blank">web page</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbs=
p;</span>on the World Wide Web normally begins either by typing the<span cl=
ass=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.=
org/wiki/Uniform_resource_locator" title=3D"Uniform resource locator" class=
=3D"mw-redirect" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background=
: none;" target=3D"_blank">URL</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nb=
sp;</span>of the page into a web browser, or by following a hyperlink to th=
at page or resource. The web browser then initiates a series of background =
communication messages to fetch and display the requested page. In the 1990=
s, using a browser to view web pages=E2=80=94and to move from one web page =
to another through hyperlinks=E2=80=94came to be known as 'browsing,' 'web =
surfing' (after<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=
=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Channel_surfing" title=3D"Channel surfing=
" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=
=3D"_blank">channel surfing</a>), or 'navigating the Web'. Early studies of=
 this new behavior investigated user patterns in using web browsers. One st=
udy, for example, found five user patterns: exploratory surfing, window sur=
fing, evolved surfing, bounded navigation and targeted navigation.<sup id=
=3D"cite_ref-33" class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi:=
 isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;"><a h=
ref=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_note-33" style=3D"=
text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; background: non=
e;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>33<span>]</span></a></sup><br data-mce-=
bogus=3D"1"></p><p style=3D"margin: 0px; line-height: inherit;">The followi=
ng example demonstrates the functioning of a web browser when accessing a p=
age at the URL<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><code styl=
e=3D"font-family: monospace, Courier; color: black; border: 1px solid #dddd=
dd; border-radius: 2px; padding: 1px 4px; background-color: #f9f9f9;">http:=
//www.example.org/home.html</code>. The browser resolves the server name of=
 the URL (<code style=3D"font-family: monospace, Courier; color: black; bor=
der: 1px solid #dddddd; border-radius: 2px; padding: 1px 4px; background-co=
lor: #f9f9f9;">www.example.org</code>) into an<span class=3D"Apple-converte=
d-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IP_address" =
title=3D"IP address" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; backgr=
ound: none;" target=3D"_blank">Internet Protocol address</a><span class=3D"=
Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>using the globally distributed<span cla=
ss=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.o=
rg/wiki/Domain_Name_System" title=3D"Domain Name System" style=3D"text-deco=
ration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">Domain N=
ame System</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>(DNS). Thi=
s lookup returns an IP address such as<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space"=
>&nbsp;</span><i>203.0.113.4</i>. The browser then requests the resource by=
 sending an<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"ht=
tps://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hypertext_Transfer_Protocol" title=3D"Hypertext=
 Transfer Protocol" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; backgro=
und: none;" target=3D"_blank">HTTP</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space"=
>&nbsp;</span>request across the Internet to the computer at that address. =
It requests service from a specific TCP port number that is well known for =
the HTTP service, so that the receiving host can distinguish an HTTP reques=
t from other network protocols it may be servicing. The HTTP protocol norma=
lly uses<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https=
://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_TCP_and_UDP_port_numbers" title=3D"List of=
 TCP and UDP port numbers" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; =
background: none;" target=3D"_blank">port number 80</a>. The content of the=
 HTTP request can be as simple as two lines of text:</p><div class=3D"mw-hi=
ghlight mw-content-ltr" dir=3D"ltr" style=3D"direction: ltr; unicode-bidi: =
embed; background: #f8f8f8;"><pre style=3D"font-family: monospace, Courier;=
 color: black; border: 1px solid #dddddd; padding: 1em; white-space: pre-wr=
ap; line-height: 1.3em; tab-size: 4; background-color: #f9f9f9;"><span clas=
s=3D"nf" style=3D"color: #0000ff;">GET</span> <span class=3D"nn" style=3D"c=
olor: #0000ff; font-weight: bold;">/home.html</span> <span class=3D"kr" sty=
le=3D"color: #008000; font-weight: bold;">HTTP</span><span class=3D"o" styl=
e=3D"color: #666666;">/</span><span class=3D"m" style=3D"color: #666666;">1=
.1</span>
<span class=3D"na" style=3D"color: #7d9029;">Host</span><span class=3D"o" s=
tyle=3D"color: #666666;">:</span> <span class=3D"l">www.example.org</span>
</pre></div><p style=3D"margin: 0px; line-height: inherit;">The computer re=
ceiving the HTTP request delivers it to web server software listening for r=
equests on port 80. If the web server can fulfill the request it sends an H=
TTP response back to the browser indicating success:</p><div class=3D"mw-hi=
ghlight mw-content-ltr" dir=3D"ltr" style=3D"direction: ltr; unicode-bidi: =
embed; background: #f8f8f8;"><pre style=3D"font-family: monospace, Courier;=
 color: black; border: 1px solid #dddddd; padding: 1em; white-space: pre-wr=
ap; line-height: 1.3em; tab-size: 4; background-color: #f9f9f9;"><span clas=
s=3D"kr" style=3D"color: #008000; font-weight: bold;">HTTP</span><span clas=
s=3D"o" style=3D"color: #666666;">/</span><span class=3D"m" style=3D"color:=
 #666666;">1.0</span> <span class=3D"m" style=3D"color: #666666;">200</span=
> <span class=3D"ne" style=3D"color: #d2413a; font-weight: bold;">OK</span>
<span class=3D"na" style=3D"color: #7d9029;">Content-Type</span><span class=
=3D"o" style=3D"color: #666666;">:</span> <span class=3D"l">text/html; char=
set=3DUTF-8</span>
</pre></div><p style=3D"margin: 0px; line-height: inherit;">followed by the=
 content of the requested page. HyperText Markup Language (<a href=3D"https=
://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HTML" title=3D"HTML" style=3D"text-decoration: non=
e; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">HTML</a>) for a bas=
ic web page might look like this:</p><div class=3D"mw-highlight mw-content-=
ltr" dir=3D"ltr" style=3D"direction: ltr; unicode-bidi: embed; background: =
#f8f8f8;"><pre style=3D"font-family: monospace, Courier; color: black; bord=
er: 1px solid #dddddd; padding: 1em; white-space: pre-wrap; line-height: 1.=
3em; tab-size: 4; background-color: #f9f9f9;"><span class=3D"nt" style=3D"c=
olor: #008000; font-weight: bold;">&lt;html&gt;</span>
  <span class=3D"nt" style=3D"color: #008000; font-weight: bold;">&lt;head&=
gt;</span>
    <span class=3D"nt" style=3D"color: #008000; font-weight: bold;">&lt;tit=
le&gt;</span>Example.org =E2=80=93 The World Wide Web<span class=3D"nt" sty=
le=3D"color: #008000; font-weight: bold;">&lt;/title&gt;</span>
  <span class=3D"nt" style=3D"color: #008000; font-weight: bold;">&lt;/head=
&gt;</span>
  <span class=3D"nt" style=3D"color: #008000; font-weight: bold;">&lt;body&=
gt;</span>
    <span class=3D"nt" style=3D"color: #008000; font-weight: bold;">&lt;p&g=
t;</span>The World Wide Web, abbreviated as WWW and commonly known ...<span=
 class=3D"nt" style=3D"color: #008000; font-weight: bold;">&lt;/p&gt;</span=
>
  <span class=3D"nt" style=3D"color: #008000; font-weight: bold;">&lt;/body=
&gt;</span>
<span class=3D"nt" style=3D"color: #008000; font-weight: bold;">&lt;/html&g=
t;</span>
</pre></div><p style=3D"margin: 0px; line-height: inherit;">The web browser=
<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wi=
kipedia.org/wiki/Parsing" title=3D"Parsing" style=3D"text-decoration: none;=
 color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">parses</a><span class=
=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>the HTML and interprets the markup =
(<code class=3D"mw-highlight" dir=3D"ltr" style=3D"font-family: monospace, =
Courier; color: black; border: 1px solid #dddddd; border-radius: 2px; paddi=
ng: 1px 4px; direction: ltr; unicode-bidi: embed; background: #f8f8f8;"><sp=
an class=3D"nt" style=3D"color: #008000; font-weight: bold;">&lt;title&gt;<=
/span></code>,<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><code clas=
s=3D"mw-highlight" dir=3D"ltr" style=3D"font-family: monospace, Courier; co=
lor: black; border: 1px solid #dddddd; border-radius: 2px; padding: 1px 4px=
; direction: ltr; unicode-bidi: embed; background: #f8f8f8;"><span class=3D=
"nt" style=3D"color: #008000; font-weight: bold;">&lt;p&gt;</span></code><s=
pan class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>for paragraph, and such) t=
hat surrounds the words to format the text on the screen. Many web pages us=
e HTML to reference the URLs of other resources such as images, other embed=
ded media,<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"htt=
ps://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Client-side_scripting" title=3D"Client-side scri=
pting" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" t=
arget=3D"_blank">scripts</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</s=
pan>that affect page behavior, and<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nb=
sp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cascading_Style_Sheets" =
title=3D"Cascading Style Sheets" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b=
0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">Cascading Style Sheets</a><span =
class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>that affect page layout. The b=
rowser makes additional HTTP requests to the web server for these other<spa=
n class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipe=
dia.org/wiki/Internet_media_type" title=3D"Internet media type" class=3D"mw=
-redirect" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none=
;" target=3D"_blank">Internet media types</a>. As it receives their content=
 from the web server, the browser progressively<span class=3D"Apple-convert=
ed-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Layout_engi=
ne" title=3D"Layout engine" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080;=
 background: none;" target=3D"_blank">renders</a><span class=3D"Apple-conve=
rted-space">&nbsp;</span>the page onto the screen as specified by its HTML =
and these additional resources.</p><h3 style=3D"color: black; font-weight: =
bold; margin: 0.3em 0px 0px; overflow: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-=
bottom: 0px; border-bottom-style: none; font-size: 1.2em; line-height: 1.6;=
 background: none;"><span class=3D"mw-headline" id=3D"Linking">Linking</spa=
n><span class=3D"mw-editsection" style=3D"-webkit-user-select: none; font-s=
ize: small; font-weight: normal; margin-left: 1em; vertical-align: baseline=
; line-height: 1em; display: inline-block; white-space: nowrap; unicode-bid=
i: isolate; font-family: sans-serif;"><span class=3D"mw-editsection-bracket=
" style=3D"margin-right: 0.25em; color: #555555;">[</span><a href=3D"https:=
//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=3DWorld_Wide_Web&amp;action=3Dedit&amp=
;section=3D3" title=3D"Edit section: Linking" style=3D"text-decoration: non=
e; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">edit</a><span class=
=3D"mw-editsection-bracket" style=3D"margin-left: 0.25em; color: #555555;">=
]</span></span></h3><p style=3D"margin: 0px; line-height: inherit;">Most we=
b pages contain hyperlinks to other related pages and perhaps to downloadab=
le files, source documents, definitions and other web resources. In the und=
erlying HTML, a hyperlink looks like this:<span class=3D"Apple-converted-sp=
ace">&nbsp;</span><code class=3D"mw-highlight" dir=3D"ltr" style=3D"font-fa=
mily: monospace, Courier; color: black; border: 1px solid #dddddd; border-r=
adius: 2px; padding: 1px 4px; direction: ltr; unicode-bidi: embed; backgrou=
nd: #f8f8f8;"><span class=3D"p">&lt;</span><span class=3D"nt" style=3D"colo=
r: #008000; font-weight: bold;">a</span><span class=3D"na" style=3D"color: =
#7d9029;">href</span><span class=3D"o" style=3D"color: #666666;">=3D</span>=
<span class=3D"s" style=3D"color: #ba2121;">"http://www.example.org/home.ht=
ml"</span><span class=3D"p">&gt;</span>Example.org Homepage<span class=3D"p=
">&lt;/</span><span class=3D"nt" style=3D"color: #008000; font-weight: bold=
;">a</span><span class=3D"p">&gt;</span></code></p><div class=3D"thumb trig=
ht" style=3D"clear: right; float: right; margin: 0.5em 0px 1.3em 1.4em; wid=
th: auto; background-color: transparent;"><div class=3D"thumbinner" style=
=3D"min-width: 100px; border: 1px solid #cccccc; padding: 3px; font-size: 1=
3.16px; text-align: center; overflow: hidden; width: 222px; background-colo=
r: #f9f9f9;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:WorldWideWebArou=
ndWikipedia.png" class=3D"image" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b=
0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><img src=3D"https://upload.wikim=
edia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b9/WorldWideWebAroundWikipedia.png/220px=
-WorldWideWebAroundWikipedia.png" alt=3D"" class=3D"thumbimage" style=3D"bo=
rder: 1px solid #cccccc; vertical-align: middle; background-color: #ffffff;=
" width=3D"220" height=3D"158"></a><div class=3D"thumbcaption" style=3D"bor=
der: none; line-height: 1.4em; padding: 3px; font-size: 12.3704px; text-ali=
gn: left;"><div class=3D"magnify" style=3D"float: right; margin-left: 3px; =
margin-right: 0px;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:WorldWide=
WebAroundWikipedia.png" class=3D"internal" title=3D"Enlarge" style=3D"text-=
decoration: none; color: #0b0080; display: block; text-indent: 15px; white-=
space: nowrap; overflow: hidden; width: 15px; height: 11px; -webkit-user-se=
lect: none; background: , ;" target=3D"_blank"></a><br></div>Graphic repres=
entation of a minute fraction of the WWW, demonstrating<a href=3D"https://e=
n.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hyperlink" title=3D"Hyperlink" style=3D"text-decoratio=
n: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">hyperlinks</a=
><br data-mce-bogus=3D"1"></div></div></div><p style=3D"margin: 0px; line-h=
eight: inherit;">Such a collection of useful, related resources, interconne=
cted via hypertext links is dubbed a<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&=
nbsp;</span><i>web</i><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>of=
 information. Publication on the Internet created what Tim Berners-Lee firs=
t called the<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><i>WorldWide=
Web</i><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>(in its original<=
span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wik=
ipedia.org/wiki/CamelCase" title=3D"CamelCase" style=3D"text-decoration: no=
ne; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">CamelCase</a>, whi=
ch was subsequently discarded) in November 1990.<sup id=3D"cite_ref-W90_9-1=
" class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-=
size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://=
en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_note-W90-9" style=3D"text-decorat=
ion: none; color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; background: none;" target=
=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>9<span>]</span></a></sup><br data-mce-bogus=3D"1"=
></p><p style=3D"margin: 0px; line-height: inherit;">The hyperlink structur=
e of the WWW is described by the<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp=
;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Webgraph" title=3D"Webgrap=
h" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" targe=
t=3D"_blank">webgraph</a>: the nodes of the webgraph correspond to the web =
pages (or URLs) the directed edges between them to the hyperlinks.</p><p st=
yle=3D"margin: 0px; line-height: inherit;">Over time, many web resources po=
inted to by hyperlinks disappear, relocate, or are replaced with different =
content. This makes hyperlinks obsolete, a phenomenon referred to in some c=
ircles as link rot, and the hyperlinks affected by it are often called<span=
 class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikiped=
ia.org/wiki/Dead_link" title=3D"Dead link" class=3D"mw-redirect" style=3D"t=
ext-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">=
dead links</a>. The ephemeral nature of the Web has prompted many efforts t=
o archive web sites. The<a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Internet_A=
rchive" title=3D"Internet Archive" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #=
0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">Internet Archive</a>, active s=
ince 1996, is the best known of such efforts.</p><h3 style=3D"color: black;=
 font-weight: bold; margin: 0.3em 0px 0px; overflow: hidden; padding-top: 0=
.5em; padding-bottom: 0px; border-bottom-style: none; font-size: 1.2em; lin=
e-height: 1.6; background: none;"><span class=3D"mw-headline" id=3D"Dynamic=
_updates_of_web_pages">Dynamic updates of web pages</span><span class=3D"mw=
-editsection" style=3D"-webkit-user-select: none; font-size: small; font-we=
ight: normal; margin-left: 1em; vertical-align: baseline; line-height: 1em;=
 display: inline-block; white-space: nowrap; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-fa=
mily: sans-serif;"><span class=3D"mw-editsection-bracket" style=3D"margin-r=
ight: 0.25em; color: #555555;">[</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/=
w/index.php?title=3DWorld_Wide_Web&amp;action=3Dedit&amp;section=3D4" title=
=3D"Edit section: Dynamic updates of web pages" style=3D"text-decoration: n=
one; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">edit</a><span cla=
ss=3D"mw-editsection-bracket" style=3D"margin-left: 0.25em; color: #555555;=
">]</span></span></h3><div class=3D"hatnote relarticle mainarticle" style=
=3D"font-style: italic; padding-left: 1.6em; margin-bottom: 0.5em;">Main ar=
ticle:<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https:/=
/en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ajax_(programming)" title=3D"Ajax (programming)" sty=
le=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_=
blank">Ajax (programming)</a><br data-mce-bogus=3D"1"></div><p style=3D"mar=
gin: 0px; line-height: inherit;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J=
avaScript" title=3D"JavaScript" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0=
080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">JavaScript</a><span class=3D"Appl=
e-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>is a<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&=
nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scripting_programming_=
language" title=3D"Scripting programming language" class=3D"mw-redirect" st=
yle=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"=
_blank">scripting language</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;<=
/span>that was initially developed in 1995 by<span class=3D"Apple-converted=
-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brendan_Eich"=
 title=3D"Brendan Eich" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; bac=
kground: none;" target=3D"_blank">Brendan Eich</a>, then of<span class=3D"A=
pple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki=
/Netscape" title=3D"Netscape" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b008=
0; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">Netscape</a>, for use within web pa=
ges.<sup id=3D"cite_ref-Hamilton_34-0" class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-he=
ight: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; fon=
t-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#c=
ite_note-Hamilton-34" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; white=
-space: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>34<span>=
]</span></a></sup><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>The st=
andardised version is<a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ECMAScript" t=
itle=3D"ECMAScript" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; backgro=
und: none;" target=3D"_blank">ECMAScript</a>.<sup id=3D"cite_ref-Hamilton_3=
4-1" class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; fo=
nt-size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https=
://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_note-Hamilton-34" style=3D"tex=
t-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; background: none;"=
 target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>34<span>]</span></a></sup><span class=3D"A=
pple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>To make web pages more interactive, some=
 web applications also use JavaScript techniques such as<span class=3D"Appl=
e-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aj=
ax_(programming)" title=3D"Ajax (programming)" style=3D"text-decoration: no=
ne; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">Ajax</a><span clas=
s=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>(<a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.o=
rg/wiki/Asynchronous_I/O" title=3D"Asynchronous I/O" style=3D"text-decorati=
on: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">asynchronous=
</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>JavaScript and<span =
class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedi=
a.org/wiki/XML" title=3D"XML" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b008=
0; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">XML</a>).<span class=3D"Apple-conve=
rted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Client-si=
de_scripting" title=3D"Client-side scripting" style=3D"text-decoration: non=
e; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">Client-side script<=
/a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>is delivered with the=
 page that can make additional HTTP requests to the server, either in respo=
nse to user actions such as mouse movements or clicks, or based on elapsed =
time. The server's responses are used to modify the current page rather tha=
n creating a new page with each response, so the server needs only to provi=
de limited, incremental information. Multiple Ajax requests can be handled =
at the same time, and users can interact with the page while data is retrie=
ved. Web pages may also regularly<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbs=
p;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Polling_(computer_science=
)" title=3D"Polling (computer science)" style=3D"text-decoration: none; col=
or: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">poll</a><span class=3D"Ap=
ple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>the server to check whether new informati=
on is available.<sup id=3D"cite_ref-35" class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-h=
eight: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; fo=
nt-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#=
cite_note-35" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; white-space: =
nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>35<span>]</span>=
</a></sup><br data-mce-bogus=3D"1"></p><h3 style=3D"color: black; font-weig=
ht: bold; margin: 0.3em 0px 0px; overflow: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padd=
ing-bottom: 0px; border-bottom-style: none; font-size: 1.2em; line-height: =
1.6; background: none;"><span class=3D"mw-headline" id=3D"WWW_prefix">WWW p=
refix</span><span class=3D"mw-editsection" style=3D"-webkit-user-select: no=
ne; font-size: small; font-weight: normal; margin-left: 1em; vertical-align=
: baseline; line-height: 1em; display: inline-block; white-space: nowrap; u=
