</span></a></sup><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>On 25 J=
uly 2008, Google software engineers Jesse Alpert and Nissan Hajaj announced=
 that<a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Google_Search" title=3D"Googl=
e Search" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;=
" target=3D"_blank">Google Search</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">=
&nbsp;</span>had discovered one trillion unique URLs.<sup id=3D"cite_ref-74=
" class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-=
size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://=
en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_note-74" style=3D"text-decoration=
: none; color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_=
blank"><span>[</span>74<span>]</span></a></sup><span class=3D"Apple-convert=
ed-space">&nbsp;</span>As of May 2009, over 109.5 million domains operated.=
<sup id=3D"cite_ref-NI_75-0" class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1; u=
nicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; font-style: n=
ormal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_note-N=
I-75" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; =
background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>75<span>]</span></a></su=
p><sup class=3D"noprint Inline-Template" style=3D"line-height: 1; font-size=
: 11.2px; white-space: nowrap;">[<i><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wik=
i/Wikipedia:Verifiability" title=3D"Wikipedia:Verifiability" style=3D"text-=
decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><spa=
n title=3D"The material near this tag failed verification of its source cit=
ation(s). (November 2011)">not in citation given</span></a></i>]</sup><span=
 class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>Of these, 74% were commercial=
 or other domains operating in the<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nb=
sp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Generic_top-level_domain=
" title=3D"Generic top-level domain" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color:=
 #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">generic top-level domain</a>=
<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><i>com</i>.<sup id=3D"ci=
te_ref-NI_75-1" class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: =
isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;"><a hr=
ef=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_note-NI-75" style=
=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; background:=
 none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>75<span>]</span></a></sup><br data-=
mce-bogus=3D"1"></p><p style=3D"margin: 0px; line-height: inherit;">Statist=
ics measuring a website's popularity are usually based either on the number=
 of<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en=
.wikipedia.org/wiki/Page_view" title=3D"Page view" style=3D"text-decoration=
: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">page views</a>=
<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>or on associated server =
'<a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hit_(internet)" title=3D"Hit (int=
ernet)" class=3D"mw-redirect" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b008=
0; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">hits</a>' (file requests) that it r=
eceives.</p><h2 style=3D"color: black; font-weight: normal; margin: 1em 0px=
 0.25em; overflow: hidden; padding: 0px; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-b=
ottom-style: solid; border-bottom-color: #aaaaaa; font-size: 1.5em; font-fa=
mily: 'Linux Libertine', Georgia, Times, serif; line-height: 1.3; backgroun=
d: none;"><span class=3D"mw-headline" id=3D"Speed_issues">Speed issues</spa=
n><span class=3D"mw-editsection" style=3D"-webkit-user-select: none; font-s=
ize: small; font-weight: normal; margin-left: 1em; vertical-align: baseline=
; line-height: 1em; display: inline-block; white-space: nowrap; unicode-bid=
i: isolate; font-family: sans-serif;"><span class=3D"mw-editsection-bracket=
" style=3D"margin-right: 0.25em; color: #555555;">[</span><a href=3D"https:=
//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=3DWorld_Wide_Web&amp;action=3Dedit&amp=
;section=3D13" title=3D"Edit section: Speed issues" style=3D"text-decoratio=
n: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">edit</a><span=
 class=3D"mw-editsection-bracket" style=3D"margin-left: 0.25em; color: #555=
555;">]</span></span></h2><p style=3D"margin: 0px; line-height: inherit;">F=
rustration over<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=
=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Network_congestion" title=3D"Network cong=
estion" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" =
target=3D"_blank">congestion</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp=
;</span>issues in the Internet infrastructure and the high<span class=3D"Ap=
ple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/=
Latency_(engineering)" title=3D"Latency (engineering)" style=3D"text-decora=
tion: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">latency</a=
><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>that results in slow br=
owsing has led to a pejorative name for the World Wide Web: the<span class=
=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><i>World Wide Wait</i>.<sup id=3D"c=
ite_ref-76" class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isol=
ate; font-size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=
=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_note-76" style=3D"tex=
t-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; background: none;"=
 target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>76<span>]</span></a></sup><span class=3D"A=
pple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>Speeding up the Internet is an ongoing d=
iscussion over the use of<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span=
><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Peering" title=3D"Peering" style=
=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_bl=
ank">peering</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>and<span=
 class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikiped=
ia.org/wiki/Quality_of_service" title=3D"Quality of service" style=3D"text-=
decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">QoS<=
/a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>technologies. Other s=
olutions to reduce the congestion can be found at<span class=3D"Apple-conve=
rted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/W3C" titl=
e=3D"W3C" class=3D"mw-redirect" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0=
080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">W3C</a>.<sup id=3D"cite_ref-77" c=
lass=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-siz=
e: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.=
wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_note-77" style=3D"text-decoration: n=
one; color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_bla=
nk"><span>[</span>77<span>]</span></a></sup><span class=3D"Apple-converted-=
space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guideline" tit=
le=3D"Guideline" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background=
: none;" target=3D"_blank">Guidelines</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-spa=
ce">&nbsp;</span>for web response times are:<sup id=3D"cite_ref-78" class=
=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 1=
1.2px; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wiki=
pedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_note-78" style=3D"text-decoration: none;=
 color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">=
<span>[</span>78<span>]</span></a></sup><br data-mce-bogus=3D"1"></p><ul st=
yle=3D"list-style-type: disc; margin: 0.3em 0px 0px 1.6em; padding: 0px;"><=
li style=3D"margin-bottom: 0.1em;">0.1 second (one tenth of a second). Idea=
l response time. The user does not sense any interruption.</li><li style=3D=
"margin-bottom: 0.1em;">1 second. Highest acceptable response time. Downloa=
d times above 1 second interrupt the user experience.</li><li style=3D"marg=
in-bottom: 0.1em;">10 seconds. Unacceptable response time. The user experie=
nce is interrupted and the user is likely to leave the site or system.</li>=
</ul><h2 style=3D"color: black; font-weight: normal; margin: 1em 0px 0.25em=
; overflow: hidden; padding: 0px; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-bottom-s=
tyle: solid; border-bottom-color: #aaaaaa; font-size: 1.5em; font-family: '=
Linux Libertine', Georgia, Times, serif; line-height: 1.3; background: none=
;"><span class=3D"mw-headline" id=3D"Web_caching">Web caching</span><span c=
lass=3D"mw-editsection" style=3D"-webkit-user-select: none; font-size: smal=
l; font-weight: normal; margin-left: 1em; vertical-align: baseline; line-he=
ight: 1em; display: inline-block; white-space: nowrap; unicode-bidi: isolat=
e; font-family: sans-serif;"><span class=3D"mw-editsection-bracket" style=
=3D"margin-right: 0.25em; color: #555555;">[</span><a href=3D"https://en.wi=
kipedia.org/w/index.php?title=3DWorld_Wide_Web&amp;action=3Dedit&amp;sectio=
n=3D14" title=3D"Edit section: Web caching" style=3D"text-decoration: none;=
 color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">edit</a><span class=
=3D"mw-editsection-bracket" style=3D"margin-left: 0.25em; color: #555555;">=
]</span></span></h2><p style=3D"margin: 0px; line-height: inherit;">A<span =
class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedi=
a.org/wiki/Web_cache" title=3D"Web cache" style=3D"text-decoration: none; c=
olor: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">web cache</a><span clas=
s=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>is a server computer located eithe=
r on the public Internet, or within an enterprise that stores recently acce=
ssed web pages to improve response time for users when the same content is =
requested within a certain time after the original request.</p><p style=3D"=
margin: 0px; line-height: inherit;">Most web browsers also implement a<span=
 class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikiped=
ia.org/wiki/Browser_cache" title=3D"Browser cache" class=3D"mw-redirect" st=
yle=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"=
_blank">browser cache</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span=
>for recently obtained data, usually on the local disk drive. HTTP requests=
 by a browser may ask only for data that has changed since the last access.=
 Web pages and resources may contain expiration information to control cach=
ing to secure sensitive data, such as in<span class=3D"Apple-converted-spac=
e">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Online_banking" ti=
tle=3D"Online banking" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; back=
ground: none;" target=3D"_blank">online banking</a>, or to facilitate frequ=
ently updated sites, such as news media. Even sites with highly dynamic con=
tent may permit basic resources to be refreshed only occasionally. Web site=
 designers find it worthwhile to collate resources such as CSS data and Jav=
aScript into a few site-wide files so that they can be cached efficiently.<=
/p><p style=3D"margin: 0px; line-height: inherit;">Enterprise<span class=3D=
"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wi=
ki/Firewall_(networking)" title=3D"Firewall (networking)" class=3D"mw-redir=
ect" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" tar=
get=3D"_blank">firewalls</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</s=
pan>often cache Web resources requested by one user for the benefit of many=
. Some<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https:/=
/en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Search_engines" title=3D"Search engines" class=3D"mw=
-redirect" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none=
;" target=3D"_blank">search engines</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space=
">&nbsp;</span>store cached content of frequently accessed websites.</p><h2=
 style=3D"color: black; font-weight: normal; margin: 1em 0px 0.25em; overfl=
ow: hidden; padding: 0px; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-bottom-style: so=
lid; border-bottom-color: #aaaaaa; font-size: 1.5em; font-family: 'Linux Li=
bertine', Georgia, Times, serif; line-height: 1.3; background: none;"><span=
 class=3D"mw-headline" id=3D"See_also">See also</span><span class=3D"mw-edi=
tsection" style=3D"-webkit-user-select: none; font-size: small; font-weight=
: normal; margin-left: 1em; vertical-align: baseline; line-height: 1em; dis=
play: inline-block; white-space: nowrap; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-family=
: sans-serif;"><span class=3D"mw-editsection-bracket" style=3D"margin-right=
: 0.25em; color: #555555;">[</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/w/in=
dex.php?title=3DWorld_Wide_Web&amp;action=3Dedit&amp;section=3D15" title=3D=
"Edit section: See also" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; ba=
ckground: none;" target=3D"_blank">edit</a><span class=3D"mw-editsection-br=
acket" style=3D"margin-left: 0.25em; color: #555555;">]</span></span></h2><=
div class=3D"noprint portal tright" style=3D"clear: right; float: right; ma=

ir=3D"ltr" class=3D"mw-content-ltr" style=3D"direction: ltr;" lang=3D"en"><=
div class=3D"hatnote" style=3D"font-style: italic; padding-left: 1.6em; mar=
gin-bottom: 0.5em;">"WWW" and "The web" redirect here. For other uses of WW=
W, see<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https:/=
/en.wikipedia.org/wiki/WWW_(disambiguation)" title=3D"WWW (disambiguation)"=

ground: none;" target=3D"_blank">WWW (disambiguation)</a>. For other uses o=
f web, see<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"htt=
ps://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Web_(disambiguation)" title=3D"Web (disambiguati=
on)" class=3D"mw-redirect mw-disambig" style=3D"text-decoration: none; colo=
r: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">Web (disambiguation)</a>.<=
/div><div class=3D"hatnote" style=3D"font-style: italic; padding-left: 1.6e=
m; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-top: -0.5em;">For the first web software, s=
ee<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.=
wikipedia.org/wiki/WorldWideWeb" title=3D"WorldWideWeb" style=3D"text-decor=
ation: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">WorldWide=
Web</a>.</div><p style=3D"margin: 0px; line-height: inherit;">The<span clas=
s=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><b>World Wide Web</b><span class=
=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>(<b>WWW</b>) is an<span class=3D"Ap=
ple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/=
Open_source" title=3D"Open source" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #=
0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">open source</a><span class=3D"=
Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wik=
i/Information_space" title=3D"Information space" style=3D"text-decoration: =
none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">information spac=
e</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>where documents and=
 other<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https:/=
/en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Web_resource" title=3D"Web resource" style=3D"text-d=
ecoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">web r=
esources</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>are identifi=
ed by<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://=
en.wikipedia.org/wiki/URL" title=3D"URL" class=3D"mw-redirect" style=3D"tex=
t-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">UR=
Ls</a>, interlinked by<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a=
 href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hypertext" title=3D"Hypertext" style=
=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_bl=
ank">hypertext</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>links,=
 and can be accessed via the<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</s=
pan><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Internet" title=3D"Internet" s=
tyle=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D=
"_blank">Internet</a>.<sup id=3D"cite_ref-1" class=3D"reference" style=3D"l=
ine-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-weight: norma=
l; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide=
_Web#cite_note-1" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; white-spa=
ce: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>1<span>]</sp=
an></a></sup><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>The World W=
ide Web was invented by English scientist<span class=3D"Apple-converted-spa=
ce">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tim_Berners-Lee" =
title=3D"Tim Berners-Lee" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; b=
ackground: none;" target=3D"_blank">Tim Berners-Lee</a><span class=3D"Apple=
-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>in 1989. He wrote the first web browser in 1=
990 while employed at<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a =
href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CERN" title=3D"CERN" style=3D"text-de=
coration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">CERN</=
a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>in Switzerland.<sup id=
=3D"cite_ref-2" class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: =
isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;"><a hr=
ef=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_note-2" style=3D"te=
xt-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; background: none;=
" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>2<span>]</span></a></sup><sup id=3D"cite_=
ref-AHT_3-0" class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: iso=
late; font-size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=
=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_note-AHT-3" style=3D"=
text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; background: non=
e;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>3<span>]</span></a></sup><br data-mce-b=
ogus=3D"1"></p><p style=3D"margin: 0px; line-height: inherit;">It has becom=
e known simply as<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><b>the =
Web</b>. The World Wide Web was central to the development of the<span clas=
s=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.or=
g/wiki/Information_Age" title=3D"Information Age" style=3D"text-decoration:=
 none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">Information Age=
</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>and is the primary t=
ool billions of people use to interact on the Internet.<sup id=3D"cite_ref-=
4" class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font=
-size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https:/=
/en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_note-4" style=3D"text-decoration=
: none; color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_=
blank"><span>[</span>4<span>]</span></a></sup><sup id=3D"cite_ref-5" class=
=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 1=
1.2px; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wiki=
pedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_note-5" style=3D"text-decoration: none; =
color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><=
span>[</span>5<span>]</span></a></sup><sup id=3D"cite_ref-6" class=3D"refer=
ence" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; fo=
nt-weight: normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org=
/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_note-6" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0=
b0080; white-space: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</s=
pan>6<span>]</span></a></sup><br data-mce-bogus=3D"1"></p><p style=3D"margi=
n: 0px; line-height: inherit;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Web=
_page" title=3D"Web page" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; b=
ackground: none;" target=3D"_blank">Web pages</a><span class=3D"Apple-conve=
rted-space">&nbsp;</span>are primarily<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space"=
>&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Plain_text" title=3D=
"Plain text" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: no=
ne;" target=3D"_blank">text</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;=
</span>documents formatted and annotated with<span class=3D"Apple-converted=
-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hypertext_Mar=
kup_Language" title=3D"Hypertext Markup Language" class=3D"mw-redirect" sty=
le=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_=
blank">Hypertext Markup Language</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&=
nbsp;</span>(HTML). In addition to formatted text, web pages may contain<sp=
an class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikip=
edia.org/wiki/Image" title=3D"Image" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color:=
 #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">images</a>,<span class=3D"Ap=
ple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/=
Video" title=3D"Video" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; back=
ground: none;" target=3D"_blank">video</a>, and software components that ar=
e rendered in the user's<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>=
<a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Web_browser" title=3D"Web browser"=
 style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=
=3D"_blank">web browser</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</sp=
an>as coherent pages of<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><=
a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Multimedia" title=3D"Multimedia" st=
yle=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"=
_blank">multimedia</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>co=
ntent. Embedded<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=
=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hyperlink" title=3D"Hyperlink" style=3D"t=
ext-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">=
hyperlinks</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>permit use=
rs to<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://=
en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Web_navigation" title=3D"Web navigation" style=3D"tex=
t-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">na=
vigate</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>between web pa=
ges. Multiple web pages with a common theme, a common<span class=3D"Apple-c=
onverted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Domai=
n_name" title=3D"Domain name" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b008=
0; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">domain name</a>, or both, may be ca=
lled a<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><i><a href=3D"http=
s://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Website" title=3D"Website" style=3D"text-decorati=
on: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">website</a><=
/i>. Website content can largely be provided by the publisher, or interacti=
ve where users contribute content or the content depends upon the user or t=
heir actions. Websites may be mostly informative, primarily for entertainme=
nt, or largely for commercial purposes.</p><p style=3D"margin: 0px; line-he=
ight: inherit;"><br></p><div id=3D"toc" class=3D"toc" style=3D"border: 1px =
solid #aaaaaa; padding: 7px; font-size: 13.3px; display: table; zoom: 1; ba=
ckground-color: #f9f9f9;"><div id=3D"toctitle" style=3D"direction: ltr; tex=

y<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.w=

lass=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia=
.org/wiki/CERN" title=3D"CERN" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b00=
80; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">CERN</a>.</div></div></div><div cl=
ass=3D"thumb tright" style=3D"clear: right; float: right; margin: 0.5em 0px=
 1.3em 1.4em; width: auto; background-color: transparent;"><div class=3D"th=
umbinner" style=3D"min-width: 100px; border: 1px solid #cccccc; padding: 3p=
x; font-size: 13.16px; text-align: center; overflow: hidden; width: 222px; =
background-color: #f9f9f9;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:C=
ERN_web_corridor.jpg" class=3D"image" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color=
: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><img src=3D"https://upload.=
wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/67/CERN_web_corridor.jpg/220px-CERN=
_web_corridor.jpg" alt=3D"" class=3D"thumbimage" style=3D"border: 1px solid=
 #cccccc; vertical-align: middle; background-color: #ffffff;" width=3D"220"=
 height=3D"293"></a><div class=3D"thumbcaption" style=3D"border: none; line=
-height: 1.4em; padding: 3px; font-size: 12.3704px; text-align: left;"><div=
 class=3D"magnify" style=3D"float: right; margin-left: 3px; margin-right: 0=
px;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:CERN_web_corridor.jpg" c=
lass=3D"internal" title=3D"Enlarge" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: =
#0b0080; display: block; text-indent: 15px; white-space: nowrap; overflow: =
hidden; width: 15px; height: 11px; -webkit-user-select: none; background: ,=
 ;" target=3D"_blank"></a><br></div>The corridor where WWW was born.<span c=
lass=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia=
.org/wiki/CERN" title=3D"CERN" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b00=
80; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">CERN</a>, ground floor of building=
 No.1</div></div></div><p style=3D"margin: 0px; line-height: inherit;">Bern=
ers-Lee's vision of a global hyperlinked information system became a possib=
ility by the second half of the 1980s. By 1985 the global Internet began to=
 proliferate in Europe and in the<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbs=
p;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Domain_Name_System" title=
=3D"Domain Name System" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; bac=
kground: none;" target=3D"_blank">Domain Name System</a><span class=3D"Appl=
e-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>(which the<span class=3D"Apple-converted-sp=
ace">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Uniform_Resource=
_Locator" title=3D"Uniform Resource Locator" style=3D"text-decoration: none=
; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">Uniform Resource Loc=
ator</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>is built upon) c=
ame into being. In 1988 the first direct IP connection between Europe and N=
orth America was made and Berners-Lee began to openly discuss the possibili=
ty of a web-like system at CERN.<sup id=3D"cite_ref-7" class=3D"reference" =
style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-wei=
ght: normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/=
World_Wide_Web#cite_note-7" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080;=
 white-space: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>7<=
span>]</span></a></sup><br data-mce-bogus=3D"1"></p><p style=3D"margin: 0px=
; line-height: inherit;">In March 1989 Tim Berners-Lee issued a proposal to=
 the management at CERN for a system called "Mesh" that referenced<span cla=
ss=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.o=
rg/wiki/ENQUIRE" title=3D"ENQUIRE" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #=
0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">ENQUIRE</a>, a database and so=
ftware project he had built in 1980, which used the term "web" and describe=
d a more elaborate information management system based on links embedded in=
 readable text: "Imagine, then, the references in this document all being a=
ssociated with the network address of the thing to which they referred, so =
that while reading this document you could skip to them with a click of the=
 mouse." Such a system, he explained, could be referred to using one of the=
 existing meanings of the word<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;<=
/span><i><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hypertext" title=3D"Hyper=
text" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" ta=
rget=3D"_blank">hypertext</a></i>, a term that he says was coined in the 19=
50s. There is no reason, the proposal continues, why such hypertext links c=
ould not encompass multimedia documents including graphics, speech and vide=
o, so that Berners-Lee goes on to use the term<span class=3D"Apple-converte=
d-space">&nbsp;</span><i><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hypermedi=
a" title=3D"Hypermedia" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; bac=
kground: none;" target=3D"_blank">hypermedia</a></i>.<sup id=3D"cite_ref-8"=
 class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-s=
ize: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://e=
n.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_note-8" style=3D"text-decoration: =
none; color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_bl=
ank"><span>[</span>8<span>]</span></a></sup><br data-mce-bogus=3D"1"></p><p=
 style=3D"margin: 0px; line-height: inherit;">With help from his colleague =
and fellow hypertext enthusiast<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;=
</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_Cailliau" title=3D"R=
obert Cailliau" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background:=
 none;" target=3D"_blank">Robert Cailliau</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted=
-space">&nbsp;</span>he published a more formal proposal on 12 November 199=
0 to build a "Hypertext project" called "WorldWideWeb" (one word) as a "web=
" of "hypertext documents" to be viewed by "<a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia=
.org/wiki/Web_browser" title=3D"Web browser" style=3D"text-decoration: none=
; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">browsers</a>" using =
a<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.w=
ikipedia.org/wiki/Client%E2%80%93server_architecture" title=3D"Client=E2=80=
=93server architecture" class=3D"mw-redirect" style=3D"text-decoration: non=
e; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">client=E2=80=93serv=
er architecture</a>.<sup id=3D"cite_ref-W90_9-0" class=3D"reference" style=
=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-weight: =
normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World=
_Wide_Web#cite_note-W90-9" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; =
white-space: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>9<s=
pan>]</span></a></sup><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>At=
 this point HTML and HTTP had already been in development for about two mon=
ths and the first Web server was about a month from completing its first su=
ccessful test.</p><p style=3D"margin: 0px; line-height: inherit;">This prop=
osal estimated that a read-only web would be developed within three months =
and that it would take six months to achieve "the creation of new links and=
 new material by readers, [so that] authorship becomes universal" as well a=
s "the automatic notification of a reader when new material of interest to =
him/her has become available." While the read-only goal was met, accessible=
 authorship of web content took longer to mature, with the<span class=3D"Ap=
ple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/=
Wiki" title=3D"Wiki" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; backgr=
ound: none;" target=3D"_blank">wiki</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space=
">&nbsp;</span>concept,<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><=
a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/WebDAV" title=3D"WebDAV" style=3D"t=
ext-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">=
WebDAV</a>,<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"ht=
tps://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Blog" title=3D"Blog" style=3D"text-decoration: =
none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">blogs</a>,<span =
class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedi=
a.org/wiki/Web_2.0" title=3D"Web 2.0" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color=
: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">Web 2.0</a><span class=3D"A=
pple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>and<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space"=
>&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/RSS" title=3D"RSS" s=
tyle=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D=
"_blank">RSS</a>/<a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Atom_(standard)" =
title=3D"Atom (standard)" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; b=
ackground: none;" target=3D"_blank">Atom</a>.<sup id=3D"cite_ref-10" class=
=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 1=
1.2px; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wiki=
pedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_note-10" style=3D"text-decoration: none;=
 color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">=
<span>[</span>10<span>]</span></a></sup><br data-mce-bogus=3D"1"></p><p sty=
le=3D"margin: 0px; line-height: inherit;">The proposal was modeled after th=
e<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.w=
ikipedia.org/wiki/SGML" title=3D"SGML" class=3D"mw-redirect" style=3D"text-=
decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">SGML=
</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>reader<span class=3D=
"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wi=
ki/Dynatext" title=3D"Dynatext" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0=
080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">Dynatext</a><span class=3D"Apple-=
converted-space">&nbsp;</span>by Electronic Book Technology, a spin-off fro=
m the<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://=
en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Institute_for_Research_in_Information_and_Scholarship=
" title=3D"Institute for Research in Information and Scholarship" style=3D"=
text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"=
>Institute for Research in Information and Scholarship</a><span class=3D"Ap=
ple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>at<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&=
nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brown_University" titl=
e=3D"Brown University" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; back=
ground: none;" target=3D"_blank">Brown University</a>. The Dynatext system,=
 licensed by CERN, was a key player in the extension of SGML ISO 8879:1986 =
to Hypermedia within<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a h=
ref=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HyTime" title=3D"HyTime" style=3D"text=
-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">HyT=
ime</a>, but it was considered too expensive and had an inappropriate licen=
sing policy for use in the general high energy physics community, namely a =
fee for each document and each document alteration.</p><div class=3D"thumb =
tright" style=3D"clear: right; float: right; margin: 0.5em 0px 1.3em 1.4em;=
 width: auto; background-color: transparent;"><div class=3D"thumbinner" sty=
le=3D"min-width: 100px; border: 1px solid #cccccc; padding: 3px; font-size:=
 13.16px; text-align: center; overflow: hidden; width: 222px; background-co=
lor: #f9f9f9;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Cern_datacente=
r.jpg" class=3D"image" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; back=
ground: none;" target=3D"_blank"><img src=3D"https://upload.wikimedia.org/w=
ikipedia/commons/thumb/9/98/Cern_datacenter.jpg/220px-Cern_datacenter.jpg" =
alt=3D"" class=3D"thumbimage" style=3D"border: 1px solid #cccccc; vertical-=
align: middle; background-color: #ffffff;" width=3D"220" height=3D"147"></a=
><div class=3D"thumbcaption" style=3D"border: none; line-height: 1.4em; pad=
ding: 3px; font-size: 12.3704px; text-align: left;"><div class=3D"magnify" =
style=3D"float: right; margin-left: 3px; margin-right: 0px;"><a href=3D"htt=
ps://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Cern_datacenter.jpg" class=3D"internal" tit=
le=3D"Enlarge" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; display: blo=
ck; text-indent: 15px; white-space: nowrap; overflow: hidden; width: 15px; =
height: 11px; -webkit-user-select: none; background: , ;" target=3D"_blank"=
></a><br></div>The CERN<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><=
a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Data_center" title=3D"Data center" =
style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=
=3D"_blank">data center</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</sp=
an>in 2010 housing some WWW servers</div></div></div><p style=3D"margin: 0p=
x; line-height: inherit;">A<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</sp=
an><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/NeXT_Computer" title=3D"NeXT Co=
mputer" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" =
target=3D"_blank">NeXT Computer</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&n=
bsp;</span>was used by Berners-Lee as the world's first<span class=3D"Apple=
-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Web=
_server" title=3D"Web server" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b008=
0; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">web server</a><span class=3D"Apple-=
converted-space">&nbsp;</span>and also to write the first<span class=3D"App=
le-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/W=
eb_browser" title=3D"Web browser" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0=
b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">web browser</a>,<span class=3D"=
Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wik=
i/WorldWideWeb" title=3D"WorldWideWeb" style=3D"text-decoration: none; colo=
r: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">WorldWideWeb</a>, in 1990.=
 By Christmas 1990, Berners-Lee had built all the tools necessary for a wor=
king Web:<sup id=3D"cite_ref-11" class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: =
1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; font-styl=
e: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_no=
te-11" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap;=
 background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>11<span>]</span></a></s=
up><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>the<span class=3D"App=
le-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/W=
orldWideWeb" title=3D"WorldWideWeb" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: =
#0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">first web browser</a><span cl=
ass=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>(which was a web editor as well)=
 and the first web server. The first web site,<sup id=3D"cite_ref-12" class=
=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 1=
1.2px; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wiki=
pedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_note-12" style=3D"text-decoration: none;=
 color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">=
<span>[</span>12<span>]</span></a></sup><span class=3D"Apple-converted-spac=
e">&nbsp;</span>which described the project itself, was published on 20 Dec=
ember 1990.<sup id=3D"cite_ref-13" class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height=
: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; font-st=
yle: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_=
note-13" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; white-space: nowra=
p; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>13<span>]</span></a><=
/sup><br data-mce-bogus=3D"1"></p><p style=3D"margin: 0px; line-height: inh=
erit;">The first web page may be lost, but<span class=3D"Apple-converted-sp=
ace">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paul_Jones_(comp=
uter_technologist)" title=3D"Paul Jones (computer technologist)" style=3D"t=
ext-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">=
Paul Jones</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>of<span cl=
ass=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.=
org/wiki/UNC-Chapel_Hill" title=3D"UNC-Chapel Hill" class=3D"mw-redirect" s=
tyle=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D=
"_blank">UNC-Chapel Hill</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</s=
pan>in North Carolina announced in May 2013 that Berners-Lee gave him what =
he says is the oldest known web page during a 1991 visit to UNC. Jones stor=
ed it on a<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"htt=
ps://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Magneto-optical_drive" title=3D"Magneto-optical =
drive" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" t=
arget=3D"_blank">magneto-optical drive</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-sp=
ace">&nbsp;</span>and on his NeXT computer.<sup id=3D"cite_ref-14" class=3D=
"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2=
px; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikiped=
ia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_note-14" style=3D"text-decoration: none; co=
lor: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><sp=
an>[</span>14<span>]</span></a></sup><br data-mce-bogus=3D"1"></p><p style=
=3D"margin: 0px; line-height: inherit;">On 6 August 1991, Berners-Lee publi=
shed a short summary of the World Wide Web project on the<span class=3D"App=
le-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/N=
ewsgroup" title=3D"Newsgroup" class=3D"mw-redirect" style=3D"text-decoratio=
n: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">newsgroup</a>=
<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><i>alt.hypertext</i>.<su=
p id=3D"cite_ref-15" class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-b=
idi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;">=
<a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_note-15" style=
=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; background:=
 none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>15<span>]</span></a></sup><span cla=
ss=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>This date also marked the debut o=
f the Web as a publicly available service on the Internet, although new use=
rs only accessed it after 23 August. For this reason this is considered the=
<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wi=
kipedia.org/wiki/Internaut" title=3D"Internaut" style=3D"text-decoration: n=
one; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">internaut</a>'s d=
ay. Several newsmedia have reported that the first photo on the Web was pub=
lished by Berners-Lee in 1992, an image of the CERN house band<span class=
=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org=
/wiki/Les_Horribles_Cernettes" title=3D"Les Horribles Cernettes" style=3D"t=
ext-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">=
Les Horribles Cernettes</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</sp=
an>taken by Silvano de Gennaro; Gennaro has disclaimed this story, writing =
that media were "totally distorting our words for the sake of cheap sensati=
onalism."<sup id=3D"cite_ref-16" class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: =
1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; font-styl=
e: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_no=
te-16" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap;=
 background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>16<span>]</span></a></s=
up><br data-mce-bogus=3D"1"></p><p style=3D"margin: 0px; line-height: inher=
it;">The first server outside Europe was installed at the<span class=3D"App=
le-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/S=
LAC_National_Accelerator_Laboratory" title=3D"SLAC National Accelerator Lab=
oratory" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;"=
 target=3D"_blank">Stanford Linear Accelerator Center</a><span class=3D"App=
le-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>(SLAC) in Palo Alto, California, to host t=
he<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.=
wikipedia.org/wiki/SPIRES" title=3D"SPIRES" class=3D"mw-redirect" style=3D"=
text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"=
>SPIRES-HEP</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>database.=
 Accounts differ substantially as to the date of this event. The World Wide=
 Web Consortium's timeline says December 1992,<sup id=3D"cite_ref-17" class=
=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 1=
1.2px; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wiki=
pedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_note-17" style=3D"text-decoration: none;=
 color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">=
<span>[</span>17<span>]</span></a></sup><span class=3D"Apple-converted-spac=
e">&nbsp;</span>whereas SLAC itself claims December 1991,<sup id=3D"cite_re=
f-18" class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; f=
ont-size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"http=
s://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_note-18" style=3D"text-decora=
tion: none; color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; background: none;" target=
=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>18<span>]</span></a></sup><sup id=3D"cite_ref-19"=
 class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-s=
ize: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://e=
n.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_note-19" style=3D"text-decoration:=
 none; color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_b=
lank"><span>[</span>19<span>]</span></a></sup><span class=3D"Apple-converte=
d-space">&nbsp;</span>as does a W3C document titled<span class=3D"Apple-con=
verted-space">&nbsp;</span><i>A Little History of the World Wide Web</i>.<s=
up id=3D"cite_ref-20" class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-=
bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;"=
><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_note-20" styl=
e=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; background=
: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>20<span>]</span></a></sup><br data=
-mce-bogus=3D"1"></p><p style=3D"margin: 0px; line-height: inherit;">The un=
derlying concept of hypertext originated in previous projects from the 1960=
s, such as the<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D=
"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hypertext_Editing_System" title=3D"Hypertext=
 Editing System" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background=
: none;" target=3D"_blank">Hypertext Editing System</a><span class=3D"Apple=
-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>(HES) at Brown University,<span class=3D"App=
le-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/T=
ed_Nelson" title=3D"Ted Nelson" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0=
080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">Ted Nelson</a>'s<span class=3D"Ap=
ple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/=
Project_Xanadu" title=3D"Project Xanadu" style=3D"text-decoration: none; co=
lor: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">Project Xanadu</a>, and<=
span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wik=
ipedia.org/wiki/Douglas_Engelbart" title=3D"Douglas Engelbart" style=3D"tex=
t-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">Do=
uglas Engelbart</a>'s<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a =
href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/NLS_(computer_system)" title=3D"NLS (=
computer system)" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; backgroun=
d: none;" target=3D"_blank">oN-Line System</a><span class=3D"Apple-converte=
d-space">&nbsp;</span>(NLS). Both Nelson and Engelbart were in turn inspire=
d by<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://e=
n.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vannevar_Bush" title=3D"Vannevar Bush" style=3D"text-d=
ecoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">Vanne=
var Bush</a>'s<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D=
"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Microfilm" title=3D"Microfilm" class=3D"mw-r=
edirect" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;"=
 target=3D"_blank">microfilm</a>-based<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space"=
>&nbsp;</span><i><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Memex" title=3D"M=
emex" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" ta=
rget=3D"_blank">memex</a></i>, which was described in the 1945 essay "<a hr=
ef=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/As_We_May_Think" title=3D"As We May Thi=
nk" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" targ=
et=3D"_blank">As We May Think</a>".<sup id=3D"cite_ref-Conkling_21-0" class=
=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 1=
1.2px; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wiki=
pedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_note-Conkling-21" style=3D"text-decorati=
on: none; color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D=
"_blank"><span>[</span>21<span>]</span></a></sup><br data-mce-bogus=3D"1"><=
/p><p style=3D"margin: 0px; line-height: inherit;">Berners-Lee's breakthrou=
gh was to marry hypertext to the Internet. In his book<span class=3D"Apple-=
converted-space">&nbsp;</span><i><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/W=
eaving_the_Web:_The_Original_Design_and_Ultimate_Destiny_of_the_World_Wide_=
Web_by_its_inventor" title=3D"Weaving the Web: The Original Design and Ulti=
mate Destiny of the World Wide Web by its inventor" class=3D"mw-redirect" s=
tyle=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D=
"_blank">Weaving The Web</a></i>, he explains that he had repeatedly sugges=
ted that a marriage between the two technologies was possible to members of=
<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><i>both</i><span class=
=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>technical communities, but when no =
one took up his invitation, he finally assumed the project himself. In the =
process, he developed three essential technologies:</p><ul style=3D"list-st=
yle-type: disc; margin: 0.3em 0px 0px 1.6em; padding: 0px;"><li style=3D"ma=
rgin-bottom: 0.1em;">a system of globally unique identifiers for resources =
on the Web and elsewhere, the universal document identifier (UDI), later kn=
own as<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https:/=
/en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Uniform_resource_locator" title=3D"Uniform resource =
locator" class=3D"mw-redirect" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b00=
80; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">uniform resource locator</a><span =
class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>(URL) and<span class=3D"Apple-=
converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unif=
orm_resource_identifier" title=3D"Uniform resource identifier" class=3D"mw-=
redirect" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;=
" target=3D"_blank">uniform resource identifier</a><span class=3D"Apple-con=
verted-space">&nbsp;</span>(URI);</li><li style=3D"margin-bottom: 0.1em;">t=
he publishing language<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a=
 href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hypertext_Markup_Language" title=3D"=
Hypertext Markup Language" class=3D"mw-redirect" style=3D"text-decoration: =
none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">HyperText Markup=
 Language</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>(HTML);</li=
><li style=3D"margin-bottom: 0.1em;">the<span class=3D"Apple-converted-spac=
e">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hypertext_Transfer=
_Protocol" title=3D"Hypertext Transfer Protocol" style=3D"text-decoration: =
none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">Hypertext Transf=
er Protocol</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>(HTTP).<s=
up id=3D"cite_ref-22" class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-=
bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;"=
><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_note-22" styl=
e=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; background=
: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>22<span>]</span></a></sup><br data=
-mce-bogus=3D"1"></li></ul><p style=3D"margin: 0px; line-height: inherit;">=
The World Wide Web had a number of differences from other hypertext systems=
 available at the time. The Web required only unidirectional links rather t=
han bidirectional ones, making it possible for someone to link to another r=
esource without action by the owner of that resource. It also significantly=
 reduced the difficulty of implementing web servers and browsers (in compar=
ison to earlier systems), but in turn presented the chronic problem of<span=
 class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><i><a href=3D"https://en.wiki=
pedia.org/wiki/Link_rot" title=3D"Link rot" style=3D"text-decoration: none;=
 color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">link rot</a></i>.</p>=
<p style=3D"margin: 0px; line-height: inherit;">Unlike predecessors such as=
<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wi=
kipedia.org/wiki/HyperCard" title=3D"HyperCard" style=3D"text-decoration: n=
one; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">HyperCard</a>, th=
e World Wide Web was non-proprietary, making it possible to develop servers=
 and clients independently and to add extensions without licensing restrict=
ions. On 30 April 1993, CERN announced that the World Wide Web would be fre=
e to anyone, with no fees due.<sup id=3D"cite_ref-23" class=3D"reference" s=
tyle=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-weig=
ht: normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/W=
orld_Wide_Web#cite_note-23" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080;=
 white-space: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>23=
<span>]</span></a></sup><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>=
Coming two months after the announcement that the server implementation of =
the<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en=
.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gopher_(protocol)" title=3D"Gopher (protocol)" style=3D=
"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank=
">Gopher</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>protocol was=
 no longer free to use, this produced a rapid shift away from Gopher and to=
wards the Web. An early popular web browser was<span class=3D"Apple-convert=
ed-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ViolaWWW" t=
itle=3D"ViolaWWW" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; backgroun=
d: none;" target=3D"_blank">ViolaWWW</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-spac=
e">&nbsp;</span>for<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a hr=
ef=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unix" title=3D"Unix" style=3D"text-deco=
ration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">Unix</a>=
<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>and the<span class=3D"Ap=
ple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/=
X_Windowing_System" title=3D"X Windowing System" class=3D"mw-redirect" styl=
e=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_b=
lank">X Windowing System</a>.</p><div class=3D"thumb tright" style=3D"clear=
: right; float: right; margin: 0.5em 0px 1.3em 1.4em; width: auto; backgrou=
nd-color: transparent;"><div class=3D"thumbinner" style=3D"min-width: 100px=
; border: 1px solid #cccccc; padding: 3px; font-size: 13.16px; text-align: =
center; overflow: hidden; width: 222px; background-color: #f9f9f9;"><a href=
=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Cailliau_Abramatic_Berners-Lee_10_ye=
ars_WWW_consortium.png" class=3D"image" style=3D"text-decoration: none; col=
or: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><img src=3D"https://uploa=
d.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d3/Cailliau_Abramatic_Berners-Lee=
_10_years_WWW_consortium.png/220px-Cailliau_Abramatic_Berners-Lee_10_years_=
WWW_consortium.png" alt=3D"" class=3D"thumbimage" style=3D"border: 1px soli=
d #cccccc; vertical-align: middle; background-color: #ffffff;" width=3D"220=
" height=3D"164"></a><div class=3D"thumbcaption" style=3D"border: none; lin=
e-height: 1.4em; padding: 3px; font-size: 12.3704px; text-align: left;"><di=
v class=3D"magnify" style=3D"float: right; margin-left: 3px; margin-right: =
0px;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Cailliau_Abramatic_Bern=
ers-Lee_10_years_WWW_consortium.png" class=3D"internal" title=3D"Enlarge" s=
tyle=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; display: block; text-indent:=
 15px; white-space: nowrap; overflow: hidden; width: 15px; height: 11px; -w=
ebkit-user-select: none; background: , ;" target=3D"_blank"></a><br></div><=
a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_Cailliau" title=3D"Robert Ca=
illiau" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" =
target=3D"_blank">Robert Cailliau</a>, Jean-Fran=C3=A7ois Abramatic formerl=
y of<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://e=
n.wikipedia.org/wiki/French_Institute_for_Research_in_Computer_Science_and_=
Automation" title=3D"French Institute for Research in Computer Science and =
Automation" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: non=
e;" target=3D"_blank">INRIA</a>, and<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&=
nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tim_Berners-Lee" title=
=3D"Tim Berners-Lee" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; backgr=
ound: none;" target=3D"_blank">Tim Berners-Lee</a><span class=3D"Apple-conv=
erted-space">&nbsp;</span>at the 10th anniversary of the World Wide Web Con=
sortium.</div></div></div><p style=3D"margin: 0px; line-height: inherit;">S=
cholars generally agree that a turning point for the World Wide Web began w=
ith the introduction<sup id=3D"cite_ref-24" class=3D"reference" style=3D"li=
ne-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal=
; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_=
Web#cite_note-24" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; white-spa=
ce: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>24<span>]</s=
pan></a></sup><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>of the<spa=
n class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipe=
dia.org/wiki/Mosaic_(web_browser)" title=3D"Mosaic (web browser)" style=3D"=
text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"=
>Mosaic</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>web browser<s=
up id=3D"cite_ref-25" class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-=
bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;"=
><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_note-25" styl=
e=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; background=
: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>25<span>]</span></a></sup><span cl=
ass=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>in 1993, a graphical browser dev=
eloped by a team at the<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><=
a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_Center_for_Supercomputing_=
Applications" title=3D"National Center for Supercomputing Applications" sty=
le=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_=
blank">National Center for Supercomputing Applications</a><span class=3D"Ap=
ple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>at the<span class=3D"Apple-converted-spac=
e">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/University_of_Illi=
nois_at_Urbana-Champaign" title=3D"University of Illinois at Urbana-Champai=
gn" class=3D"mw-redirect" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; b=
ackground: none;" target=3D"_blank">University of Illinois at Urbana-Champa=
ign</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>(NCSA-UIUC), led =
by<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.=
wikipedia.org/wiki/Marc_Andreessen" title=3D"Marc Andreessen" style=3D"text=
-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">Mar=
c Andreessen</a>. Funding for Mosaic came from the U.S.<span class=3D"Apple=
-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><i>High-Performance Computing and Communicat=
ions Initiative</i><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>and t=
he<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><i><a href=3D"https://=
en.wikipedia.org/wiki/High_Performance_Computing_and_Communication_Act_of_1=
991" title=3D"High Performance Computing and Communication Act of 1991" cla=
ss=3D"mw-redirect" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; backgrou=
nd: none;" target=3D"_blank">High Performance Computing and Communication A=
ct of 1991</a></i>, one of<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</spa=
n><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Al_Gore_and_information_technolo=
gy" title=3D"Al Gore and information technology" style=3D"text-decoration: =
none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">several computin=
g developments initiated by U.S. Senator Al Gore</a>.<sup id=3D"cite_ref-26=
" class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-=
size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://=
en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_note-26" style=3D"text-decoration=
: none; color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_=
blank"><span>[</span>26<span>]</span></a></sup><span class=3D"Apple-convert=
ed-space">&nbsp;</span>Prior to the release of Mosaic, graphics were not co=
mmonly mixed with text in web pages and the web's popularity was less than =
older protocols in use over the Internet, such as<span class=3D"Apple-conve=
rted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gopher_(p=
rotocol)" title=3D"Gopher (protocol)" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color=
: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">Gopher</a><span class=3D"Ap=
ple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>and<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">=
&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wide_Area_Information=
_Servers" title=3D"Wide Area Information Servers" class=3D"mw-redirect" sty=
le=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_=
blank">Wide Area Information Servers</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-spac=
e">&nbsp;</span>(WAIS). Mosaic's graphical user interface allowed the Web t=
o become, by far, the most popular Internet protocol.</p><p style=3D"margin=
: 0px; line-height: inherit;">The<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbs=
p;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web_Consortium=
" title=3D"World Wide Web Consortium" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color=
: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">World Wide Web Consortium</=
a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>(W3C) was founded by T=
im Berners-Lee after he left the European Organization for Nuclear Research=
 (CERN) in October 1994. It was founded at the<span class=3D"Apple-converte=
d-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Massachusett=
s_Institute_of_Technology" title=3D"Massachusetts Institute of Technology" =
style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=
=3D"_blank">Massachusetts Institute of Technology</a><span class=3D"Apple-c=
onverted-space">&nbsp;</span>Laboratory for Computer Science (MIT/LCS) with=
 support from the<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=
=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Defense_Advanced_Research_Projects_Agency=
" title=3D"Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency" class=3D"mw-redirect"=
 style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=
=3D"_blank">Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency</a>(DARPA), which had=
 pioneered the Internet; a year later, a second site was founded at<span cl=
ass=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.=
org/wiki/INRIA" title=3D"INRIA" class=3D"mw-redirect" style=3D"text-decorat=
ion: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">INRIA</a><s=
pan class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>(a French national compute=
r research lab) with support from the<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">=
&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/European_Commission" =
title=3D"European Commission" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b008=
0; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">European Commission</a><span class=
=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>DG InfSo; and in 1996, a third cont=
inental site was created in Japan at<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&=
nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Keio_University" title=
=3D"Keio University" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; backgr=
ound: none;" target=3D"_blank">Keio University</a>. By the end of 1994, the=
 total number of websites was still relatively small, but many<span class=
=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org=
/wiki/List_of_websites_founded_before_1995" title=3D"List of websites found=
ed before 1995" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background:=
 none;" target=3D"_blank">notable websites</a><span class=3D"Apple-converte=
d-space">&nbsp;</span>were already active that foreshadowed or inspired tod=
ay's most popular services.</p><p style=3D"margin: 0px; line-height: inheri=
t;">Connected by the existing Internet, other websites were created around =
the world, adding international standards for<span class=3D"Apple-converted=
-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Domain_name" =
title=3D"Domain name" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; backg=
round: none;" target=3D"_blank">domain names</a><span class=3D"Apple-conver=
ted-space">&nbsp;</span>and<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</sp=
an><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HTML" title=3D"HTML" style=3D"t=
ext-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">=
HTML</a>. Since then, Berners-Lee has played an active role in guiding the =
development of web standards (such as the<span class=3D"Apple-converted-spa=
ce">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Markup_language" =
title=3D"Markup language" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; b=
ackground: none;" target=3D"_blank">markup languages</a><span class=3D"Appl=
e-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>to compose web pages in), and has advocated=
 his vision of a<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=
=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Semantic_Web" title=3D"Semantic Web" styl=
e=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_b=
lank">Semantic Web</a>. The World Wide Web enabled the spread of informatio=
n over the Internet through an easy-to-use and flexible format. It thus pla=
yed an important role in popularizing use of the Internet.<sup id=3D"cite_r=
ef-27" class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; =
font-size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"htt=
ps://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_note-27" style=3D"text-decor=
ation: none; color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; background: none;" target=
=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>27<span>]</span></a></sup><span class=3D"Apple-co=
nverted-space">&nbsp;</span>Although the two terms are sometimes<span class=
=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org=
/wiki/Conflation" title=3D"Conflation" style=3D"text-decoration: none; colo=
r: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">conflated</a><span class=
=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>in popular use,<span class=3D"Apple=
-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><i>World Wide Web</i><span class=3D"Apple-co=
nverted-space">&nbsp;</span>is not<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nb=
sp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Synonym" title=3D"Synony=
m" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" targe=
t=3D"_blank">synonymous</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</sp=
an>with<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><i>Internet</i>.<=
sup id=3D"cite_ref-28" class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode=
-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;=
"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_note-28" sty=
le=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; backgroun=
d: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>28<span>]</span></a></sup><span c=
lass=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>The Web is an<span class=3D"App=
le-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/I=
nformation_space" title=3D"Information space" style=3D"text-decoration: non=
e; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">information space</=
a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>containing hyperlinked=
 documents and other<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a h=
ref=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Web_resource" title=3D"Web resource" s=
tyle=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D=
"_blank">resources</a>, identified by their URIs.<sup id=3D"cite_ref-29" cl=
ass=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size=
: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.w=
ikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_note-29" style=3D"text-decoration: no=
ne; color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_blan=
k"><span>[</span>29<span>]</span></a></sup><span class=3D"Apple-converted-s=
pace">&nbsp;</span>It is implemented as both client and server software usi=
ng Internet protocols such as<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</=
span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/TCP/IP" title=3D"TCP/IP" clas=
s=3D"mw-redirect" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; backgroun=
d: none;" target=3D"_blank">TCP/IP</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space"=
>&nbsp;</span>and<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=
=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HTTP" title=3D"HTTP" class=3D"mw-redirect=
" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=
=3D"_blank">HTTP</a>.</p><p style=3D"margin: 0px; line-height: inherit;">Ti=
m Berners-Lee was<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=
=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Order_of_the_British_Empire" title=3D"Ord=
er of the British Empire" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; b=
ackground: none;" target=3D"_blank">knighted</a><span class=3D"Apple-conver=
ted-space">&nbsp;</span>in 2004 by Queen<span class=3D"Apple-converted-spac=
e">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elizabeth_II" titl=
e=3D"Elizabeth II" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; backgrou=
nd: none;" target=3D"_blank">Elizabeth II</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted=
-space">&nbsp;</span>for "services to the global development of the Interne=
t".<sup id=3D"cite_ref-gaz_30-0" class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: =
1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; font-styl=
e: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_no=
te-gaz-30" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; white-space: now=
rap; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>30<span>]</span></a=
></sup><sup id=3D"cite_ref-31" class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1;=
 unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; font-style:=
 normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_note=
-31" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; b=
ackground: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>31<span>]</span></a></sup=
><br data-mce-bogus=3D"1"></p><h2 style=3D"color: black; font-weight: norma=
l; margin: 1em 0px 0.25em; overflow: hidden; padding: 0px; border-bottom-wi=
dth: 1px; border-bottom-style: solid; border-bottom-color: #aaaaaa; font-si=
ze: 1.5em; font-family: 'Linux Libertine', Georgia, Times, serif; line-heig=
ht: 1.3; background: none;"><span class=3D"mw-headline" id=3D"Function">Fun=
ction</span><span class=3D"mw-editsection" style=3D"-webkit-user-select: no=
ne; font-size: small; font-weight: normal; margin-left: 1em; vertical-align=
: baseline; line-height: 1em; display: inline-block; white-space: nowrap; u=
nicode-bidi: isolate; font-family: sans-serif;"><span class=3D"mw-editsecti=
on-bracket" style=3D"margin-right: 0.25em; color: #555555;">[</span><a href=
=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=3DWorld_Wide_Web&amp;action=
=3Dedit&amp;section=3D2" title=3D"Edit section: Function" style=3D"text-dec=
oration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">edit</a=
><span class=3D"mw-editsection-bracket" style=3D"margin-left: 0.25em; color=
: #555555;">]</span></span></h2><div class=3D"thumb tright" style=3D"clear:=
 right; float: right; margin: 0.5em 0px 1.3em 1.4em; width: auto; backgroun=
d-color: transparent;"><div class=3D"thumbinner" style=3D"min-width: 100px;=
 border: 1px solid #cccccc; padding: 3px; font-size: 13.16px; text-align: c=
enter; overflow: hidden; width: 222px; background-color: #f9f9f9;"><a href=
=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Internet_Key_Layers.png" class=3D"im=
age" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" tar=
get=3D"_blank"><img src=3D"https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/t=
humb/3/39/Internet_Key_Layers.png/220px-Internet_Key_Layers.png" alt=3D"" c=
lass=3D"thumbimage" style=3D"border: 1px solid #cccccc; vertical-align: mid=
dle; background-color: #ffffff;" width=3D"220" height=3D"154"></a><div clas=
s=3D"thumbcaption" style=3D"border: none; line-height: 1.4em; padding: 3px;=
 font-size: 12.3704px; text-align: left;"><div class=3D"magnify" style=3D"f=
loat: right; margin-left: 3px; margin-right: 0px;"><a href=3D"https://en.wi=
kipedia.org/wiki/File:Internet_Key_Layers.png" class=3D"internal" title=3D"=
Enlarge" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; display: block; te=
xt-indent: 15px; white-space: nowrap; overflow: hidden; width: 15px; height=
: 11px; -webkit-user-select: none; background: , ;" target=3D"_blank"></a><=
br></div>The World Wide Web functions as a layer on top of the Internet, he=
lping to make it more functional. The advent of the<span class=3D"Apple-con=
verted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mosaic_=
(web_browser)" title=3D"Mosaic (web browser)" style=3D"text-decoration: non=
e; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">Mosaic</a><span cla=
ss=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>web browser helped to make the we=
b much more usable.</div></div></div><p style=3D"margin: 0px; line-height: =
inherit;">The terms<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><i>In=
ternet</i><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>and<span class=
=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><i>World Wide Web</i><span class=3D=
"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>are often used without much distinctio=
n. However, the two are not the same. The Internet is a global system of in=
terconnected<a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Computer_networks" tit=
le=3D"Computer networks" class=3D"mw-redirect" style=3D"text-decoration: no=
ne; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">computer networks<=
/a>. In contrast, the World Wide Web is one of the services transferred ove=
r these networks. It is a collection of text documents and other resources,=
 linked by hyperlinks and URLs, usually accessed by<span class=3D"Apple-con=
verted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Web_bro=
wser" title=3D"Web browser" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080;=
 background: none;" target=3D"_blank">web browsers</a>, from web servers.<s=
up id=3D"cite_ref-32" class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-=
bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;"=
><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_note-32" styl=
e=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; background=
: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>32<span>]</span></a></sup><br data=
-mce-bogus=3D"1"></p><p style=3D"margin: 0px; line-height: inherit;">Viewin=
g a<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en=
.wikipedia.org/wiki/Web_page" title=3D"Web page" style=3D"text-decoration: =
none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">web page</a><spa=
n class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>on the World Wide Web normal=
ly begins either by typing the<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;<=
/span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Uniform_resource_locator" ti=
tle=3D"Uniform resource locator" class=3D"mw-redirect" style=3D"text-decora=
tion: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">URL</a><sp=
an class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>of the page into a web brow=
ser, or by following a hyperlink to that page or resource. The web browser =
then initiates a series of background communication messages to fetch and d=
isplay the requested page. In the 1990s, using a browser to view web pages=
=E2=80=94and to move from one web page to another through hyperlinks=E2=80=
=94came to be known as 'browsing,' 'web surfing' (after<span class=3D"Apple=
-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cha=
nnel_surfing" title=3D"Channel surfing" style=3D"text-decoration: none; col=
or: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">channel surfing</a>), or =
'navigating the Web'. Early studies of this new behavior investigated user =
patterns in using web browsers. One study, for example, found five user pat=
terns: exploratory surfing, window surfing, evolved surfing, bounded naviga=
tion and targeted navigation.<sup id=3D"cite_ref-33" class=3D"reference" st=
yle=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-weigh=
t: normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wo=
rld_Wide_Web#cite_note-33" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; =
white-space: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>33<=
span>]</span></a></sup><br data-mce-bogus=3D"1"></p><p style=3D"margin: 0px=
; line-height: inherit;">The following example demonstrates the functioning=
 of a web browser when accessing a page at the URL<span class=3D"Apple-conv=
erted-space">&nbsp;</span><code style=3D"font-family: monospace, Courier; c=
olor: black; border: 1px solid #dddddd; border-radius: 2px; padding: 1px 4p=
x; background-color: #f9f9f9;">http://www.example.org/home.html</code>. The=
 browser resolves the server name of the URL (<code style=3D"font-family: m=
onospace, Courier; color: black; border: 1px solid #dddddd; border-radius: =
2px; padding: 1px 4px; background-color: #f9f9f9;">www.example.org</code>) =
into an<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https:=
//en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IP_address" title=3D"IP address" style=3D"text-deco=
ration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">Internet=
 Protocol address</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>usi=
ng the globally distributed<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</sp=
an><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Domain_Name_System" title=3D"Do=
