main Name System" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; backgroun=
d: none;" target=3D"_blank">Domain Name System</a><span class=3D"Apple-conv=
erted-space">&nbsp;</span>(DNS). This lookup returns an IP address such as<=
span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><i>203.0.113.4</i>. The b=
rowser then requests the resource by sending an<span class=3D"Apple-convert=
ed-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hypertext_T=
ransfer_Protocol" title=3D"Hypertext Transfer Protocol" style=3D"text-decor=
ation: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">HTTP</a><=
span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>request across the Intern=
et to the computer at that address. It requests service from a specific TCP=
 port number that is well known for the HTTP service, so that the receiving=
 host can distinguish an HTTP request from other network protocols it may b=
e servicing. The HTTP protocol normally uses<span class=3D"Apple-converted-=
space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_TCP_an=
d_UDP_port_numbers" title=3D"List of TCP and UDP port numbers" style=3D"tex=
t-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">po=
rt number 80</a>. The content of the HTTP request can be as simple as two l=
ines of text:</p><div class=3D"mw-highlight mw-content-ltr" dir=3D"ltr" sty=
le=3D"direction: ltr; unicode-bidi: embed; background: #f8f8f8;"><pre style=
=3D"font-family: monospace, Courier; color: black; border: 1px solid #ddddd=
d; padding: 1em; white-space: pre-wrap; line-height: 1.3em; tab-size: 4; ba=
ckground-color: #f9f9f9;"><span class=3D"nf" style=3D"color: #0000ff;">GET<=
/span> <span class=3D"nn" style=3D"color: #0000ff; font-weight: bold;">/hom=
e.html</span> <span class=3D"kr" style=3D"color: #008000; font-weight: bold=
;">HTTP</span><span class=3D"o" style=3D"color: #666666;">/</span><span cla=
ss=3D"m" style=3D"color: #666666;">1.1</span>
<span class=3D"na" style=3D"color: #7d9029;">Host</span><span class=3D"o" s=
tyle=3D"color: #666666;">:</span> <span class=3D"l">www.example.org</span>
</pre></div><p style=3D"margin: 0px; line-height: inherit;">The computer re=
ceiving the HTTP request delivers it to web server software listening for r=
equests on port 80. If the web server can fulfill the request it sends an H=
TTP response back to the browser indicating success:</p><div class=3D"mw-hi=
ghlight mw-content-ltr" dir=3D"ltr" style=3D"direction: ltr; unicode-bidi: =
embed; background: #f8f8f8;"><pre style=3D"font-family: monospace, Courier;=
 color: black; border: 1px solid #dddddd; padding: 1em; white-space: pre-wr=
ap; line-height: 1.3em; tab-size: 4; background-color: #f9f9f9;"><span clas=
s=3D"kr" style=3D"color: #008000; font-weight: bold;">HTTP</span><span clas=
s=3D"o" style=3D"color: #666666;">/</span><span class=3D"m" style=3D"color:=
 #666666;">1.0</span> <span class=3D"m" style=3D"color: #666666;">200</span=
> <span class=3D"ne" style=3D"color: #d2413a; font-weight: bold;">OK</span>
<span class=3D"na" style=3D"color: #7d9029;">Content-Type</span><span class=
=3D"o" style=3D"color: #666666;">:</span> <span class=3D"l">text/html; char=
set=3DUTF-8</span>
</pre></div><p style=3D"margin: 0px; line-height: inherit;">followed by the=
 content of the requested page. HyperText Markup Language (<a href=3D"https=
://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HTML" title=3D"HTML" style=3D"text-decoration: non=
e; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">HTML</a>) for a bas=
ic web page might look like this:</p><div class=3D"mw-highlight mw-content-=
ltr" dir=3D"ltr" style=3D"direction: ltr; unicode-bidi: embed; background: =
#f8f8f8;"><pre style=3D"font-family: monospace, Courier; color: black; bord=
er: 1px solid #dddddd; padding: 1em; white-space: pre-wrap; line-height: 1.=
3em; tab-size: 4; background-color: #f9f9f9;"><span class=3D"nt" style=3D"c=
olor: #008000; font-weight: bold;">&lt;html&gt;</span>
  <span class=3D"nt" style=3D"color: #008000; font-weight: bold;">&lt;head&=
gt;</span>
    <span class=3D"nt" style=3D"color: #008000; font-weight: bold;">&lt;tit=
le&gt;</span>Example.org =E2=80=93 The World Wide Web<span class=3D"nt" sty=
le=3D"color: #008000; font-weight: bold;">&lt;/title&gt;</span>
  <span class=3D"nt" style=3D"color: #008000; font-weight: bold;">&lt;/head=
&gt;</span>
  <span class=3D"nt" style=3D"color: #008000; font-weight: bold;">&lt;body&=
gt;</span>
    <span class=3D"nt" style=3D"color: #008000; font-weight: bold;">&lt;p&g=
t;</span>The World Wide Web, abbreviated as WWW and commonly known ...<span=
 class=3D"nt" style=3D"color: #008000; font-weight: bold;">&lt;/p&gt;</span=
>
  <span class=3D"nt" style=3D"color: #008000; font-weight: bold;">&lt;/body=
&gt;</span>
<span class=3D"nt" style=3D"color: #008000; font-weight: bold;">&lt;/html&g=
t;</span>
</pre></div><p style=3D"margin: 0px; line-height: inherit;">The web browser=
<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wi=
kipedia.org/wiki/Parsing" title=3D"Parsing" style=3D"text-decoration: none;=
 color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">parses</a><span class=
=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>the HTML and interprets the markup =
(<code class=3D"mw-highlight" dir=3D"ltr" style=3D"font-family: monospace, =
Courier; color: black; border: 1px solid #dddddd; border-radius: 2px; paddi=
ng: 1px 4px; direction: ltr; unicode-bidi: embed; background: #f8f8f8;"><sp=
an class=3D"nt" style=3D"color: #008000; font-weight: bold;">&lt;title&gt;<=
/span></code>,<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><code clas=
s=3D"mw-highlight" dir=3D"ltr" style=3D"font-family: monospace, Courier; co=
lor: black; border: 1px solid #dddddd; border-radius: 2px; padding: 1px 4px=
; direction: ltr; unicode-bidi: embed; background: #f8f8f8;"><span class=3D=
"nt" style=3D"color: #008000; font-weight: bold;">&lt;p&gt;</span></code><s=
pan class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>for paragraph, and such) t=
hat surrounds the words to format the text on the screen. Many web pages us=
e HTML to reference the URLs of other resources such as images, other embed=
ded media,<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"htt=
ps://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Client-side_scripting" title=3D"Client-side scri=
pting" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" t=
arget=3D"_blank">scripts</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</s=
pan>that affect page behavior, and<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nb=
sp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cascading_Style_Sheets" =
title=3D"Cascading Style Sheets" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b=
0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">Cascading Style Sheets</a><span =
class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>that affect page layout. The b=
rowser makes additional HTTP requests to the web server for these other<spa=
n class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipe=
dia.org/wiki/Internet_media_type" title=3D"Internet media type" class=3D"mw=
-redirect" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none=
;" target=3D"_blank">Internet media types</a>. As it receives their content=
 from the web server, the browser progressively<span class=3D"Apple-convert=
ed-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Layout_engi=
ne" title=3D"Layout engine" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080;=
 background: none;" target=3D"_blank">renders</a><span class=3D"Apple-conve=
rted-space">&nbsp;</span>the page onto the screen as specified by its HTML =
and these additional resources.</p><h3 style=3D"color: black; font-weight: =
bold; margin: 0.3em 0px 0px; overflow: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padding-=
bottom: 0px; border-bottom-style: none; font-size: 1.2em; line-height: 1.6;=
 background: none;"><span class=3D"mw-headline" id=3D"Linking">Linking</spa=
n><span class=3D"mw-editsection" style=3D"-webkit-user-select: none; font-s=
ize: small; font-weight: normal; margin-left: 1em; vertical-align: baseline=
; line-height: 1em; display: inline-block; white-space: nowrap; unicode-bid=
i: isolate; font-family: sans-serif;"><span class=3D"mw-editsection-bracket=
" style=3D"margin-right: 0.25em; color: #555555;">[</span><a href=3D"https:=
//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=3DWorld_Wide_Web&amp;action=3Dedit&amp=
;section=3D3" title=3D"Edit section: Linking" style=3D"text-decoration: non=
e; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">edit</a><span class=
=3D"mw-editsection-bracket" style=3D"margin-left: 0.25em; color: #555555;">=
]</span></span></h3><p style=3D"margin: 0px; line-height: inherit;">Most we=
b pages contain hyperlinks to other related pages and perhaps to downloadab=
le files, source documents, definitions and other web resources. In the und=
erlying HTML, a hyperlink looks like this:<span class=3D"Apple-converted-sp=
ace">&nbsp;</span><code class=3D"mw-highlight" dir=3D"ltr" style=3D"font-fa=
mily: monospace, Courier; color: black; border: 1px solid #dddddd; border-r=
adius: 2px; padding: 1px 4px; direction: ltr; unicode-bidi: embed; backgrou=
nd: #f8f8f8;"><span class=3D"p">&lt;</span><span class=3D"nt" style=3D"colo=
r: #008000; font-weight: bold;">a</span><span class=3D"na" style=3D"color: =
#7d9029;">href</span><span class=3D"o" style=3D"color: #666666;">=3D</span>=
<span class=3D"s" style=3D"color: #ba2121;">"http://www.example.org/home.ht=
ml"</span><span class=3D"p">&gt;</span>Example.org Homepage<span class=3D"p=
">&lt;/</span><span class=3D"nt" style=3D"color: #008000; font-weight: bold=
;">a</span><span class=3D"p">&gt;</span></code></p><div class=3D"thumb trig=
ht" style=3D"clear: right; float: right; margin: 0.5em 0px 1.3em 1.4em; wid=
th: auto; background-color: transparent;"><div class=3D"thumbinner" style=
=3D"min-width: 100px; border: 1px solid #cccccc; padding: 3px; font-size: 1=
3.16px; text-align: center; overflow: hidden; width: 222px; background-colo=
r: #f9f9f9;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:WorldWideWebArou=
ndWikipedia.png" class=3D"image" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b=
0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><img src=3D"https://upload.wikim=
edia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b9/WorldWideWebAroundWikipedia.png/220px=
-WorldWideWebAroundWikipedia.png" alt=3D"" class=3D"thumbimage" style=3D"bo=
rder: 1px solid #cccccc; vertical-align: middle; background-color: #ffffff;=
" width=3D"220" height=3D"158"></a><div class=3D"thumbcaption" style=3D"bor=
der: none; line-height: 1.4em; padding: 3px; font-size: 12.3704px; text-ali=
gn: left;"><div class=3D"magnify" style=3D"float: right; margin-left: 3px; =
margin-right: 0px;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:WorldWide=
WebAroundWikipedia.png" class=3D"internal" title=3D"Enlarge" style=3D"text-=
decoration: none; color: #0b0080; display: block; text-indent: 15px; white-=
space: nowrap; overflow: hidden; width: 15px; height: 11px; -webkit-user-se=
lect: none; background: , ;" target=3D"_blank"></a><br></div>Graphic repres=
entation of a minute fraction of the WWW, demonstrating<a href=3D"https://e=
n.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hyperlink" title=3D"Hyperlink" style=3D"text-decoratio=
n: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">hyperlinks</a=
><br data-mce-bogus=3D"1"></div></div></div><p style=3D"margin: 0px; line-h=
eight: inherit;">Such a collection of useful, related resources, interconne=
cted via hypertext links is dubbed a<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&=
nbsp;</span><i>web</i><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>of=
 information. Publication on the Internet created what Tim Berners-Lee firs=
t called the<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><i>WorldWide=
Web</i><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>(in its original<=
span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wik=
ipedia.org/wiki/CamelCase" title=3D"CamelCase" style=3D"text-decoration: no=
ne; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">CamelCase</a>, whi=
ch was subsequently discarded) in November 1990.<sup id=3D"cite_ref-W90_9-1=
" class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-=
size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://=
en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_note-W90-9" style=3D"text-decorat=
ion: none; color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; background: none;" target=
=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>9<span>]</span></a></sup><br data-mce-bogus=3D"1"=
></p><p style=3D"margin: 0px; line-height: inherit;">The hyperlink structur=
e of the WWW is described by the<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp=
;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Webgraph" title=3D"Webgrap=
h" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" targe=
t=3D"_blank">webgraph</a>: the nodes of the webgraph correspond to the web =
pages (or URLs) the directed edges between them to the hyperlinks.</p><p st=
yle=3D"margin: 0px; line-height: inherit;">Over time, many web resources po=
inted to by hyperlinks disappear, relocate, or are replaced with different =
content. This makes hyperlinks obsolete, a phenomenon referred to in some c=
ircles as link rot, and the hyperlinks affected by it are often called<span=
 class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikiped=
ia.org/wiki/Dead_link" title=3D"Dead link" class=3D"mw-redirect" style=3D"t=
ext-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">=
dead links</a>. The ephemeral nature of the Web has prompted many efforts t=
o archive web sites. The<a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Internet_A=
rchive" title=3D"Internet Archive" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #=
0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">Internet Archive</a>, active s=
ince 1996, is the best known of such efforts.</p><h3 style=3D"color: black;=
 font-weight: bold; margin: 0.3em 0px 0px; overflow: hidden; padding-top: 0=
.5em; padding-bottom: 0px; border-bottom-style: none; font-size: 1.2em; lin=
e-height: 1.6; background: none;"><span class=3D"mw-headline" id=3D"Dynamic=
_updates_of_web_pages">Dynamic updates of web pages</span><span class=3D"mw=
-editsection" style=3D"-webkit-user-select: none; font-size: small; font-we=
ight: normal; margin-left: 1em; vertical-align: baseline; line-height: 1em;=
 display: inline-block; white-space: nowrap; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-fa=
mily: sans-serif;"><span class=3D"mw-editsection-bracket" style=3D"margin-r=
ight: 0.25em; color: #555555;">[</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/=
w/index.php?title=3DWorld_Wide_Web&amp;action=3Dedit&amp;section=3D4" title=
=3D"Edit section: Dynamic updates of web pages" style=3D"text-decoration: n=
one; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">edit</a><span cla=
ss=3D"mw-editsection-bracket" style=3D"margin-left: 0.25em; color: #555555;=
">]</span></span></h3><div class=3D"hatnote relarticle mainarticle" style=
=3D"font-style: italic; padding-left: 1.6em; margin-bottom: 0.5em;">Main ar=
ticle:<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https:/=
/en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ajax_(programming)" title=3D"Ajax (programming)" sty=
le=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_=
blank">Ajax (programming)</a><br data-mce-bogus=3D"1"></div><p style=3D"mar=
gin: 0px; line-height: inherit;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J=
avaScript" title=3D"JavaScript" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0=
080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">JavaScript</a><span class=3D"Appl=
e-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>is a<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&=
nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scripting_programming_=
language" title=3D"Scripting programming language" class=3D"mw-redirect" st=
yle=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"=
_blank">scripting language</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;<=
/span>that was initially developed in 1995 by<span class=3D"Apple-converted=
-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brendan_Eich"=
 title=3D"Brendan Eich" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; bac=
kground: none;" target=3D"_blank">Brendan Eich</a>, then of<span class=3D"A=
pple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki=
/Netscape" title=3D"Netscape" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b008=
0; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">Netscape</a>, for use within web pa=
ges.<sup id=3D"cite_ref-Hamilton_34-0" class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-he=
ight: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; fon=
t-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#c=
ite_note-Hamilton-34" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; white=
-space: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>34<span>=
]</span></a></sup><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>The st=
andardised version is<a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ECMAScript" t=
itle=3D"ECMAScript" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; backgro=
und: none;" target=3D"_blank">ECMAScript</a>.<sup id=3D"cite_ref-Hamilton_3=
4-1" class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; fo=
nt-size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https=
://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_note-Hamilton-34" style=3D"tex=
t-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; background: none;"=
 target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>34<span>]</span></a></sup><span class=3D"A=
pple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>To make web pages more interactive, some=
 web applications also use JavaScript techniques such as<span class=3D"Appl=
e-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aj=
ax_(programming)" title=3D"Ajax (programming)" style=3D"text-decoration: no=
ne; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">Ajax</a><span clas=
s=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>(<a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.o=
rg/wiki/Asynchronous_I/O" title=3D"Asynchronous I/O" style=3D"text-decorati=
on: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">asynchronous=
</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>JavaScript and<span =
class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedi=
a.org/wiki/XML" title=3D"XML" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b008=
0; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">XML</a>).<span class=3D"Apple-conve=
rted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Client-si=
de_scripting" title=3D"Client-side scripting" style=3D"text-decoration: non=
e; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">Client-side script<=
/a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>is delivered with the=
 page that can make additional HTTP requests to the server, either in respo=
nse to user actions such as mouse movements or clicks, or based on elapsed =
time. The server's responses are used to modify the current page rather tha=
n creating a new page with each response, so the server needs only to provi=
de limited, incremental information. Multiple Ajax requests can be handled =
at the same time, and users can interact with the page while data is retrie=
ved. Web pages may also regularly<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbs=
p;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Polling_(computer_science=
)" title=3D"Polling (computer science)" style=3D"text-decoration: none; col=
or: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">poll</a><span class=3D"Ap=
ple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>the server to check whether new informati=
on is available.<sup id=3D"cite_ref-35" class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-h=
eight: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; fo=
nt-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#=
cite_note-35" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; white-space: =
nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>35<span>]</span>=
</a></sup><br data-mce-bogus=3D"1"></p><h3 style=3D"color: black; font-weig=
ht: bold; margin: 0.3em 0px 0px; overflow: hidden; padding-top: 0.5em; padd=
ing-bottom: 0px; border-bottom-style: none; font-size: 1.2em; line-height: =
1.6; background: none;"><span class=3D"mw-headline" id=3D"WWW_prefix">WWW p=
refix</span><span class=3D"mw-editsection" style=3D"-webkit-user-select: no=
ne; font-size: small; font-weight: normal; margin-left: 1em; vertical-align=
: baseline; line-height: 1em; display: inline-block; white-space: nowrap; u=
nicode-bidi: isolate; font-family: sans-serif;"><span class=3D"mw-editsecti=
on-bracket" style=3D"margin-right: 0.25em; color: #555555;">[</span><a href=
=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=3DWorld_Wide_Web&amp;action=
=3Dedit&amp;section=3D5" title=3D"Edit section: WWW prefix" style=3D"text-d=
ecoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">edit<=
/a><span class=3D"mw-editsection-bracket" style=3D"margin-left: 0.25em; col=
or: #555555;">]</span></span></h3><p style=3D"margin: 0px; line-height: inh=
erit;">Many hostnames used for the World Wide Web begin with<span class=3D"=
Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><i>www</i><span class=3D"Apple-converte=
d-space">&nbsp;</span>because of the long-standing practice of naming Inter=
net hosts according to the services they provide. The<span class=3D"Apple-c=
onverted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hostn=
ame" title=3D"Hostname" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; bac=
kground: none;" target=3D"_blank">hostname</a><span class=3D"Apple-converte=
d-space">&nbsp;</span>of a<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</spa=
n><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Web_server" title=3D"Web server"=
 style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=
=3D"_blank">web server</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</spa=
n>is often<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><i>www</i>, in=
 the same way that it may be<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</s=
pan><i>ftp</i><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>for an<spa=
n class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipe=
dia.org/wiki/FTP_server" title=3D"FTP server" class=3D"mw-redirect" style=
=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_bl=
ank">FTP server</a>, and<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>=
<i>news</i><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>or<span class=
=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><i>nntp</i><span class=3D"Apple-con=
verted-space">&nbsp;</span>for a<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp=
;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USENET" title=3D"USENET" c=
lass=3D"mw-redirect" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; backgr=
ound: none;" target=3D"_blank">USENET</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-spa=
ce">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/News_server" titl=
e=3D"News server" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; backgroun=
d: none;" target=3D"_blank">news server</a>. These host names appear as Dom=
ain Name System (DNS) or<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>=
<a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Subdomain" title=3D"Subdomain" sty=
le=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_=
blank">subdomain</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>name=
s, as in<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><i>www.example.c=
om</i>. The use of<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><i>www=
</i><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>is not required by a=
ny technical or policy standard and many web sites do not use it; indeed, t=
he first ever web server was called<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&n=
bsp;</span><i>nxoc01.cern.ch</i>.<sup id=3D"cite_ref-36" class=3D"reference=
" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-w=
eight: normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wik=
i/World_Wide_Web#cite_note-36" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b00=
80; white-space: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span=
>36<span>]</span></a></sup><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</sp=
an>According to Paolo Palazzi,<sup id=3D"cite_ref-37" class=3D"reference" s=
tyle=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-weig=
ht: normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/W=
orld_Wide_Web#cite_note-37" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080;=
 white-space: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>37=
<span>]</span></a></sup><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>=
who worked at CERN along with Tim Berners-Lee, the popular use of<span clas=
s=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><i>www</i><span class=3D"Apple-con=
verted-space">&nbsp;</span>as subdomain was accidental; the World Wide Web =
project page was intended to be published at www.cern.ch while info.cern.ch=
 was intended to be the CERN home page, however the DNS records were never =
switched, and the practice of prepending<span class=3D"Apple-converted-spac=
e">&nbsp;</span><i>www</i><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</spa=
n>to an institution's website domain name was subsequently copied. Many est=
ablished websites still use the prefix, or they employ other subdomain name=
s such as<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><i>www2</i>,<sp=
an class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><i>secure</i><span class=3D=
"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>or<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space=
">&nbsp;</span><i>en</i><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>=
for special purposes. Many such web servers are set up so that both the mai=
n domain name (e.g., testdomain.com) and the<span class=3D"Apple-converted-spa=
ce">&nbsp;</span><i>www</i><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</sp=
an>subdomain (e.g., www.testdomain.com) refer to the same site; others require=
 one form or the other, or they may map to different web sites.</p><p style=
=3D"margin: 0px; line-height: inherit;">The use of a subdomain name is usef=
ul for<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https:/=
/en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Load_balancing_(computing)" title=3D"Load balancing =
(computing)" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: no=
ne;" target=3D"_blank">load balancing</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-spa=
ce">&nbsp;</span>incoming web traffic by creating a<span class=3D"Apple-con=
verted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CNAME_r=
ecord" title=3D"CNAME record" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b008=
0; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">CNAME record</a><span class=3D"Appl=
e-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>that points to a cluster of web servers. Si=
nce, currently, only a subdomain can be used in a CNAME, the same result ca=
nnot be achieved by using the bare domain root.<sup class=3D"noprint Inline=
-Template Template-Fact" style=3D"line-height: 1; font-size: 11.2px; white-=
space: nowrap;">[<i><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Cita=
tion_needed" title=3D"Wikipedia:Citation needed" style=3D"text-decoration: =
none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span title=3D"T=
his claim needs references to reliable sources. (September 2013)">citation =
needed</span></a></i>]</sup></p><p style=3D"margin: 0px; line-height: inher=
it;">When a user submits an incomplete domain name to a web browser in its =
address bar input field, some web browsers automatically try adding the pre=
fix "www" to the beginning of it and possibly ".com", ".org" and ".net" at =
the end, depending on what might be missing. For example, entering 'microso=
ft' may be transformed to<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span=
><i>http://www.microsoft.com/</i><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbs=
p;</span>and 'openoffice' to<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</s=
pan><i>http://www.openoffice.org</i>. This feature started appearing in ear=
ly versions of Mozilla<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a=
 href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Firefox" title=3D"Firefox" style=3D"=
text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"=
>Firefox</a>, when it still had the working title 'Firebird' in early 2003,=
 from an earlier practice in browsers such as<span class=3D"Apple-converted=
-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lynx_(web_bro=
wser)" title=3D"Lynx (web browser)" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: =
#0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">Lynx</a>.<sup id=3D"cite_ref-=
38" class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; fon=
t-size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https:=
//en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_note-38" style=3D"text-decorati=
on: none; color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D=
"_blank"><span>[</span>38<span>]</span></a></sup><span class=3D"Apple-conve=
rted-space">&nbsp;</span>It is reported that Microsoft was granted a US pat=
ent for the same idea in 2008, but only for mobile devices.<sup id=3D"cite_=
ref-39" class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate;=
 font-size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"ht=
tps://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_note-39" style=3D"text-deco=
ration: none; color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; background: none;" targe=
t=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>39<span>]</span></a></sup><br data-mce-bogus=3D"=
1"></p><p style=3D"margin: 0px; line-height: inherit;">In English,<span cla=
ss=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.o=
rg/wiki/Pronunciation_of_%22www%22" title=3D"Pronunciation of &quot;www&quo=
t;" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" targ=
et=3D"_blank"><i>www</i><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>=
is usually read as</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><i=
>double-u double-u double-u</i>.<sup id=3D"cite_ref-40" class=3D"reference"=
 style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-we=
ight: normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki=
/World_Wide_Web#cite_note-40" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b008=
0; white-space: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>=
40<span>]</span></a></sup><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</spa=
n>Some users pronounce it<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span=
><i>dub-dub-dub</i>, particularly in New Zealand. Stephen Fry, in his "Podg=
rammes" series of podcasts, pronounces it<span class=3D"Apple-converted-spa=
ce">&nbsp;</span><i>wuh wuh wuh</i>.<sup class=3D"noprint Inline-Template T=
emplate-Fact" style=3D"line-height: 1; font-size: 11.2px; white-space: nowr=
ap;">[<i><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Citation_needed=
" title=3D"Wikipedia:Citation needed" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color=
: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span title=3D"This claim n=
eeds references to reliable sources. (September 2013)">citation needed</spa=
n></a></i>]</sup><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>The Eng=
lish writer<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"ht=
tps://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Douglas_Adams" title=3D"Douglas Adams" style=3D=
"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank=
">Douglas Adams</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>once =
quipped in<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"htt=
ps://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Independent" title=3D"The Independent" style=
=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_bl=
ank">The Independent on Sunday</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nb=
sp;</span>(1999): "The World Wide Web is the only thing I know of whose sho=
rtened form takes three times longer to say than what it's short for".<sup =
id=3D"cite_ref-Sim_41-0" class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1; unico=
de-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; font-style: norma=
l;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_note-Sim-4=
1" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; bac=
kground: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>41<span>]</span></a></sup><=
span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>In Mandarin Chinese,<span=
 class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><i>World Wide Web</i><span cl=
ass=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>is commonly translated via a<spa=
n class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipe=
dia.org/wiki/Phono-semantic_matching" title=3D"Phono-semantic matching" sty=
le=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_=
blank">phono-semantic matching</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nb=
sp;</span>to<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><i>w=C3=A0n =
w=C3=A9i w=C7=8Eng</i><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>(<=
span xml:lang=3D"zh" lang=3D"zh"><a href=3D"https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/=
%E4%B8%87%E7%BB%B4%E7%BD%91" class=3D"extiw" title=3D"wikt:=E4=B8=87=E7=BB=
=B4=E7=BD=91" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #663366; background: n=
one;" target=3D"_blank">=E4=B8=87=E7=BB=B4=E7=BD=91</a></span>), which sati=
sfies<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><i>www</i><span cla=
ss=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>and literally means "myriad dimen=
sional net",<sup id=3D"cite_ref-42" class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-heigh=
t: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; font-s=
tyle: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite=
_note-42" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; white-space: nowr=
ap; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>42<span>]</span></a>=
</sup><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>a translation that=
 reflects the design concept and proliferation of the World Wide Web. Tim B=
erners-Lee's web-space states that<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nb=
sp;</span><i>World Wide Web</i><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;=
</span>is officially spelled as three separate words, each capitalised, wit=
h no intervening hyphens.<sup id=3D"cite_ref-43" class=3D"reference" style=
=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-weight: =
normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World=
_Wide_Web#cite_note-43" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; whi=
te-space: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>43<spa=
n>]</span></a></sup><br data-mce-bogus=3D"1"></p><p style=3D"margin: 0px; l=
ine-height: inherit;">Use of the www prefix is declining as<span class=3D"A=
pple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki=
/Web_2.0" title=3D"Web 2.0" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080;=
 background: none;" target=3D"_blank">Web 2.0</a><span class=3D"Apple-conve=
rted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Web_appli=
cation" title=3D"Web application" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0=
b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">web applications</a><span class=
=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>seek to brand their domain names an=
d make them easily pronounceable.<sup id=3D"cite_ref-cas_44-0" class=3D"ref=
erence" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; =
font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.o=
rg/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_note-cas-44" style=3D"text-decoration: none; co=
lor: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><sp=
an>[</span>44<span>]</span></a></sup><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">=
&nbsp;</span>As the<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a hr=
ef=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mobile_web" title=3D"Mobile web" class=
=3D"mw-redirect" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background=
: none;" target=3D"_blank">mobile web</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-spa=
ce">&nbsp;</span>grows in popularity, services like<span class=3D"Apple-con=
verted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Google_=
Mail" title=3D"Google Mail" class=3D"mw-redirect" style=3D"text-decoration:=
 none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">Gmail</a>.com,<=
a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Outlook.com" title=3D"Outlook.com" =
style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=
=3D"_blank">Outlook.com</a>,<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</s=
pan><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MySpace" title=3D"MySpace" cla=
ss=3D"mw-redirect" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; backgrou=
nd: none;" target=3D"_blank">MySpace</a>.com,<span class=3D"Apple-converted=
-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Facebook" tit=
le=3D"Facebook" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background:=
 none;" target=3D"_blank">Facebook</a>.com and<span class=3D"Apple-converte=
d-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Twitter" tit=
le=3D"Twitter" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: =
none;" target=3D"_blank">Twitter</a>.com are most often mentioned without a=
dding "www." (or, indeed, ".com") to the domain.</p><h3 style=3D"color: bla=
ck; font-weight: bold; margin: 0.3em 0px 0px; overflow: hidden; padding-top=
: 0.5em; padding-bottom: 0px; border-bottom-style: none; font-size: 1.2em; =
line-height: 1.6; background: none;"><span class=3D"mw-headline" id=3D"Sche=
me_specifiers">Scheme specifiers</span><span class=3D"mw-editsection" style=
=3D"-webkit-user-select: none; font-size: small; font-weight: normal; margi=
n-left: 1em; vertical-align: baseline; line-height: 1em; display: inline-bl=
ock; white-space: nowrap; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-family: sans-serif;">=
<span class=3D"mw-editsection-bracket" style=3D"margin-right: 0.25em; color=
: #555555;">[</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=
=3DWorld_Wide_Web&amp;action=3Dedit&amp;section=3D6" title=3D"Edit section:=
 Scheme specifiers" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; backgro=
und: none;" target=3D"_blank">edit</a><span class=3D"mw-editsection-bracket=
" style=3D"margin-left: 0.25em; color: #555555;">]</span></span></h3><p sty=
le=3D"margin: 0px; line-height: inherit;">The scheme specifiers<span class=
=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><i>http://</i><span class=3D"Apple-=
converted-space">&nbsp;</span>and<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbs=
p;</span><i>https://</i><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>=
at the start of a web<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a =
href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Uniform_Resource_Identifier" title=3D=
"Uniform Resource Identifier" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b008=
0; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">URI</a><span class=3D"Apple-convert=
ed-space">&nbsp;</span>refer to<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;=
</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hypertext_Transfer_Protocol=
" title=3D"Hypertext Transfer Protocol" style=3D"text-decoration: none; col=
or: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">Hypertext Transfer Protoc=
ol</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>or<span class=3D"A=
pple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki=
/HTTP_Secure" title=3D"HTTP Secure" class=3D"mw-redirect" style=3D"text-dec=
oration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">HTTP Se=
cure</a>, respectively. They specify the communication protocol to use for =
the request and response. The HTTP protocol is fundamental to the operation=
 of the World Wide Web, and the added encryption layer in HTTPS is essentia=
l when browsers send or retrieve confidential data, such as passwords or ba=
nking information. Web browsers usually automatically prepend http:// to us=
er-entered URIs, if omitted.</p><h2 style=3D"color: black; font-weight: nor=
mal; margin: 1em 0px 0.25em; overflow: hidden; padding: 0px; border-bottom-=
width: 1px; border-bottom-style: solid; border-bottom-color: #aaaaaa; font-=
size: 1.5em; font-family: 'Linux Libertine', Georgia, Times, serif; line-he=
ight: 1.3; background: none;"><span class=3D"mw-headline" id=3D"Web_securit=
y">Web security</span><span class=3D"mw-editsection" style=3D"-webkit-user-=
select: none; font-size: small; font-weight: normal; margin-left: 1em; vert=
ical-align: baseline; line-height: 1em; display: inline-block; white-space:=
 nowrap; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-family: sans-serif;"><span class=3D"mw=
-editsection-bracket" style=3D"margin-right: 0.25em; color: #555555;">[</sp=
an><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=3DWorld_Wide_Web&a=
mp;action=3Dedit&amp;section=3D7" title=3D"Edit section: Web security" styl=
e=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_b=
lank">edit</a><span class=3D"mw-editsection-bracket" style=3D"margin-left: =
0.25em; color: #555555;">]</span></span></h2><p style=3D"margin: 0px; line-=
height: inherit;">For<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a =
href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Criminal" title=3D"Criminal" class=3D=
"mw-redirect" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: n=
one;" target=3D"_blank">criminals</a>, the web has become the preferred way=
 to spread<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"htt=
ps://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Malware" title=3D"Malware" style=3D"text-decorat=
ion: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">malware</a>=
.<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.w=
ikipedia.org/wiki/Cybercrime" title=3D"Cybercrime" style=3D"text-decoration=
: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">Cybercrime</a>=
<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>on the web can include<s=
pan class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wiki=
pedia.org/wiki/Identity_theft" title=3D"Identity theft" style=3D"text-decor=
ation: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">identity =
theft</a>,<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"htt=
ps://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fraud" title=3D"Fraud" style=3D"text-decoration:=
 none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">fraud</a>,<span=
 class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikiped=
ia.org/wiki/Espionage" title=3D"Espionage" style=3D"text-decoration: none; =
color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">espionage</a><span cla=
ss=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>and<span class=3D"Apple-converted=
-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Intelligence_=
gathering" title=3D"Intelligence gathering" class=3D"mw-redirect" style=3D"=
text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"=
>intelligence gathering</a>.<sup id=3D"cite_ref-Ben-Itzhak_45-0" class=3D"r=
eference" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px=
; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia=
.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_note-Ben-Itzhak-45" style=3D"text-decoration:=
 none; color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_b=
lank"><span>[</span>45<span>]</span></a></sup><span class=3D"Apple-converte=
d-space">&nbsp;</span>Web-based<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;=
</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vulnerability_(computing)" =
title=3D"Vulnerability (computing)" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: =
#0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">vulnerabilities</a><span clas=
s=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>now outnumber traditional computer=
 security concerns,<sup id=3D"cite_ref-46" class=3D"reference" style=3D"lin=

 font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_W=
eb#cite_note-46" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; white-spac=
e: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>46<span>]</sp=
an></a></sup><sup id=3D"cite_ref-47" class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-heig=
ht: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; font-=
style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cit=
e_note-47" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; white-space: now=
rap; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>47<span>]</span></a=
></sup><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>and as measured b=
y<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.w=
ikipedia.org/wiki/Google" title=3D"Google" style=3D"text-decoration: none; =
color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">Google</a>, about one =
in ten web pages may contain malicious code.<sup id=3D"cite_ref-48" class=
=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 1=
1.2px; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wiki=
pedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_note-48" style=3D"text-decoration: none;=
 color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">=
<span>[</span>48<span>]</span></a></sup><span class=3D"Apple-converted-spac=
e">&nbsp;</span>Most web-based<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;<=
/span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Attack_(computing)" title=3D=
"Attack (computing)" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; backgr=
ound: none;" target=3D"_blank">attacks</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-sp=
ace">&nbsp;</span>take place on legitimate websites, and most, as measured =
by<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.=
wikipedia.org/wiki/Sophos" title=3D"Sophos" style=3D"text-decoration: none;=
 color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">Sophos</a>, are hoste=
d in the United States, China and Russia.<sup id=3D"cite_ref-Sophos-Q1-2008=
_49-0" class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; =
font-size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"htt=
ps://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_note-Sophos-Q1-2008-49" styl=
e=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; background=
: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>49<span>]</span></a></sup><span cl=
ass=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>The most common of all malware<s=
pan class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wiki=
pedia.org/wiki/Threat_(computer)" title=3D"Threat (computer)" style=3D"text=

eats</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>is<span class=3D=
"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wi=
ki/SQL_injection" title=3D"SQL injection" style=3D"text-decoration: none; c=
olor: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">SQL injection</a><span =
class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>attacks against websites.<sup =
id=3D"cite_ref-50" class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bid=
i: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;"><a=
 href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_note-50" style=
=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; background:=
 none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>50<span>]</span></a></sup><span cla=
ss=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>Through HTML and URIs, the Web wa=
s vulnerable to attacks like<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</s=
pan><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cross-site_scripting" title=3D=
"Cross-site scripting" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; back=
ground: none;" target=3D"_blank">cross-site scripting</a><span class=3D"App=
le-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>(XSS) that came with the introduction of J=
avaScript<sup id=3D"cite_ref-FGHR_51-0" class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-h=
eight: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; fo=
nt-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#=
cite_note-FGHR-51" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; white-sp=
ace: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>51<span>]</=
span></a></sup><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>and were =
exacerbated to some degree by<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</=
span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Web_2.0" title=3D"Web 2.0" st=
yle=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"=
_blank">Web 2.0</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>and A=
jax<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en=
.wikipedia.org/wiki/Web_design" title=3D"Web design" style=3D"text-decorati=
on: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">web design</=
a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>that favors the use of=
 scripts.<sup id=3D"cite_ref-52" class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: =
1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; font-styl=
e: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_no=
te-52" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap;=
 background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>52<span>]</span></a></s=
up><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>Today by one estimate=
, 70% of all websites are open to XSS attacks on their users.<sup id=3D"cit=
e_ref-53" class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolat=
e; font-size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"=
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_note-53" style=3D"text-de=
coration: none; color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; background: none;" tar=
get=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>53<span>]</span></a></sup><span class=3D"Apple=
-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Phi=
shing" title=3D"Phishing" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; b=
ackground: none;" target=3D"_blank">phishing</a><span class=3D"Apple-conver=
ted-space">&nbsp;</span>is another common threat to the Web. "SA, the Secur=
ity Division of EMC, today announced the findings of its January 2013 Fraud=
 Report, estimating the global losses from phishing at $1.5 Billion in 2012=
".<sup id=3D"cite_ref-First_Post_54-0" class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-he=
ight: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; fon=
t-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#c=
ite_note-First_Post-54" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; whi=
te-space: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>54<spa=
n>]</span></a></sup><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>Two =
of the well-known phishing methods are Covert Redirect and Open Redirect.</=
p><p style=3D"margin: 0px; line-height: inherit;">Proposed solutions vary t=
o extremes. Large security vendors like<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space=
">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/McAfee" title=3D"Mc=
Afee" class=3D"mw-redirect" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080;=
 background: none;" target=3D"_blank">McAfee</a><span class=3D"Apple-conver=
ted-space">&nbsp;</span>already design governance and compliance suites to =
meet post-9/11 regulations,<sup id=3D"cite_ref-55" class=3D"reference" styl=
e=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-weight:=
 normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Worl=
d_Wide_Web#cite_note-55" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; wh=
ite-space: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>55<sp=
an>]</span></a></sup><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>and=
 some, like<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"ht=
tps://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Finjan" title=3D"Finjan" style=3D"text-decorati=
on: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">Finjan</a><s=
pan class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>have recommended active re=
al-time inspection of code and all content regardless of its source.<sup id=
=3D"cite_ref-Ben-Itzhak_45-1" class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1; =
unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; font-style: =
normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_note-=
Ben-Itzhak-45" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; white-space:=
 nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>45<span>]</span=
></a></sup><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>Some have arg=
ued that for enterprise to see security as a business opportunity rather th=
an a cost center,<sup id=3D"cite_ref-56" class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-=
height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; f=
ont-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web=
#cite_note-56" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; white-space:=
 nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>56<span>]</span=
></a></sup><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>"ubiquitous, =
always-on digital rights management" enforced in the infrastructure by a ha=
ndful of organizations must replace the hundreds of companies that today se=
cure data and networks.<sup id=3D"cite_ref-57" class=3D"reference" style=3D=
"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-weight: nor=
mal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wi=
de_Web#cite_note-57" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; white-=
space: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>57<span>]=
</span></a></sup><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=
=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jonathan_Zittrain" title=3D"Jonathan Zitt=
rain" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" ta=
rget=3D"_blank">Jonathan Zittrain</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">=
&nbsp;</span>has said users sharing responsibility for computing safety is =
far preferable to locking down the Internet.<sup id=3D"cite_ref-58" class=
=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 1=
1.2px; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wiki=
pedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_note-58" style=3D"text-decoration: none;=
 color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">=
<span>[</span>58<span>]</span></a></sup><br data-mce-bogus=3D"1"></p><h2 st=
yle=3D"color: black; font-weight: normal; margin: 1em 0px 0.25em; overflow:=
 hidden; padding: 0px; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-bottom-style: solid=
; border-bottom-color: #aaaaaa; font-size: 1.5em; font-family: 'Linux Liber=
tine', Georgia, Times, serif; line-height: 1.3; background: none;"><span cl=
ass=3D"mw-headline" id=3D"Privacy">Privacy</span><span class=3D"mw-editsect=
ion" style=3D"-webkit-user-select: none; font-size: small; font-weight: nor=
mal; margin-left: 1em; vertical-align: baseline; line-height: 1em; display:=
 inline-block; white-space: nowrap; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-family: san=
s-serif;"><span class=3D"mw-editsection-bracket" style=3D"margin-right: 0.2=
5em; color: #555555;">[</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.p=
hp?title=3DWorld_Wide_Web&amp;action=3Dedit&amp;section=3D8" title=3D"Edit =
section: Privacy" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; backgroun=
d: none;" target=3D"_blank">edit</a><span class=3D"mw-editsection-bracket" =
style=3D"margin-left: 0.25em; color: #555555;">]</span></span></h2><div cla=
ss=3D"hatnote relarticle mainarticle" style=3D"font-style: italic; padding-=
left: 1.6em; margin-bottom: 0.5em;">Main article:<span class=3D"Apple-conve=
rted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Internet_=
privacy" title=3D"Internet privacy" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: =
#0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">Internet privacy</a><br data-=
mce-bogus=3D"1"></div><p style=3D"margin: 0px; line-height: inherit;">Every=
 time a client requests a web page, the server can identify the request's I=
P address and usually logs it. Also, unless set not to do so, most web brow=
sers record requested web pages in a viewable<span class=3D"Apple-converted=
-space">&nbsp;</span><i>history</i>feature, and usually<span class=3D"Apple=
-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Web=
_cache" title=3D"Web cache" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080;=
 background: none;" target=3D"_blank">cache</a><span class=3D"Apple-convert=
ed-space">&nbsp;</span>much of the content locally. Unless the server-brows=
er communication uses HTTPS encryption, web requests and responses travel i=
n plain text across the Internet and can be viewed, recorded, and cached by=
 intermediate systems.</p><p style=3D"margin: 0px; line-height: inherit;">W=
hen a web page asks for, and the user supplies,<span class=3D"Apple-convert=
ed-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Personally_=
identifiable_information" title=3D"Personally identifiable information" sty=
le=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_=
blank">personally identifiable information</a>=E2=80=94such as their real n=
ame, address, e-mail address, etc.=E2=80=94web-based entities can associate=
 current web traffic with that individual. If the website uses<span class=
=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org=
/wiki/HTTP_cookie" title=3D"HTTP cookie" style=3D"text-decoration: none; co=
lor: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">HTTP cookies</a>, userna=
me and password authentication, or other tracking techniques, it can relate=
 other web visits, before and after, to the identifiable information provid=
ed. In this way it is possible for a web-based organisation to develop and =
build a profile of the individual people who use its site or sites. It may =
be able to build a record for an individual that includes information about=
 their leisure activities, their shopping interests, their profession, and =
other aspects of their<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a=
 href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Demographic_profile" title=3D"Demogr=
aphic profile" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: =
none;" target=3D"_blank">demographic profile</a>. These profiles are obviou=
sly of potential interest to marketeers, advertisers and others. Depending =
on the website's<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=
=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Terms_and_conditions" title=3D"Terms and =
conditions" class=3D"mw-redirect" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0=
b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">terms and conditions</a><span c=
lass=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>and the local laws that apply i=
nformation from these profiles may be sold, shared, or passed to other orga=
nisations without the user being informed. For many ordinary people, this m=
eans little more than some unexpected e-mails in their in-box, or some unca=
nnily relevant advertising on a future web page. For others, it can mean th=
at time spent indulging an unusual interest can result in a deluge of furth=
er targeted marketing that may be unwelcome. Law enforcement, counter terro=
rism and espionage agencies can also identify, target and track individuals=
 based on their interests or proclivities on the Web.</p><p style=3D"margin=
: 0px; line-height: inherit;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Soci=
al_networking" title=3D"Social networking" class=3D"mw-redirect" style=3D"t=
ext-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">=
Social networking</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>sit=
es try to get users to use their real names, interests, and locations. They=
 believe this makes the social networking experience more realistic, and th=
erefore more engaging for all their users. On the other hand, uploaded phot=
ographs or unguarded statements can be identified to an individual, who may=
 regret this exposure. Employers, schools, parents, and other relatives may=
 be influenced by aspects of social networking profiles that the posting in=
dividual did not intend for these audiences.<span class=3D"Apple-converted-=
space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cyberbullying"=
 title=3D"Cyberbullying" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; ba=
ckground: none;" target=3D"_blank">On-line bullies</a><span class=3D"Apple-=
converted-space">&nbsp;</span>may make use of personal information to haras=
s or<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://e=
n.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cyberstalking" title=3D"Cyberstalking" style=3D"text-d=
ecoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">stalk=
</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>users. Modern social=
 networking websites allow fine grained control of the privacy settings for=
 each individual posting, but these can be complex and not easy to find or =
use, especially for beginners.<sup id=3D"cite_ref-59" class=3D"reference" s=
tyle=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-weig=
ht: normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/W=
orld_Wide_Web#cite_note-59" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080;=
 white-space: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>59=
<span>]</span></a></sup><br data-mce-bogus=3D"1"></p><p style=3D"margin: 0p=
x; line-height: inherit;">Photographs and videos posted onto websites have =
caused particular problems, as they can add a person's face to an on-line p=
rofile. With modern and potential<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbs=
p;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Facial_recognition_system=
" title=3D"Facial recognition system" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color=
: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">facial recognition technolo=
gy</a>, it may then be possible to relate that face with other, previously =
anonymous, images, events and scenarios that have been imaged elsewhere. Be=
cause of image caching, mirroring and copying, it is difficult to remove an=
 image from the World Wide Web.</p><h2 style=3D"color: black; font-weight: =
normal; margin: 1em 0px 0.25em; overflow: hidden; padding: 0px; border-bott=
om-width: 1px; border-bottom-style: solid; border-bottom-color: #aaaaaa; fo=
nt-size: 1.5em; font-family: 'Linux Libertine', Georgia, Times, serif; line=
-height: 1.3; background: none;"><span class=3D"mw-headline" id=3D"Standard=
s">Standards</span><span class=3D"mw-editsection" style=3D"-webkit-user-sel=
ect: none; font-size: small; font-weight: normal; margin-left: 1em; vertica=
l-align: baseline; line-height: 1em; display: inline-block; white-space: no=
wrap; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-family: sans-serif;"><span class=3D"mw-ed=
itsection-bracket" style=3D"margin-right: 0.25em; color: #555555;">[</span>=
<a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=3DWorld_Wide_Web&amp;=
action=3Dedit&amp;section=3D9" title=3D"Edit section: Standards" style=3D"t=
ext-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">=
edit</a><span class=3D"mw-editsection-bracket" style=3D"margin-left: 0.25em=
; color: #555555;">]</span></span></h2><div class=3D"hatnote relarticle mai=
narticle" style=3D"font-style: italic; padding-left: 1.6em; margin-bottom: =
0.5em;">Main article:<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a =
href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Web_standards" title=3D"Web standards=
" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=
=3D"_blank">Web standards</a><br data-mce-bogus=3D"1"></div><p style=3D"mar=
gin: 0px; line-height: inherit;">Many formal standards and other technical =
specifications and software define the operation of different aspects of th=
e World Wide Web, the Internet, and computer information exchange. Many of =
the documents are the work of the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C), headed b=
y Berners-Lee, but some are produced by the<span class=3D"Apple-converted-s=
pace">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Internet_Engine=
ering_Task_Force" title=3D"Internet Engineering Task Force" style=3D"text-d=
ecoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">Inter=
net Engineering Task Force</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;<=
/span>(IETF) and other organizations.</p><p style=3D"margin: 0px; line-heig=
ht: inherit;">Usually, when web standards are discussed, the following publ=
ications are seen as foundational:</p><ul style=3D"list-style-type: disc; m=
argin: 0.3em 0px 0px 1.6em; padding: 0px;"><li style=3D"margin-bottom: 0.1e=
m;">Recommendations for<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><=
a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Markup_languages" title=3D"Markup l=
anguages" class=3D"mw-redirect" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0=
080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">markup languages</a>, especially<=
span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wik=
ipedia.org/wiki/HTML" title=3D"HTML" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color:=
 #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">HTML</a><span class=3D"Apple=
-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>and<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nb=
sp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/XHTML" title=3D"XHTML" s=
tyle=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D=
"_blank">XHTML</a>, from the W3C. These define the structure and interpreta=
tion of hypertext documents.</li><li style=3D"margin-bottom: 0.1em;">Recomm=
endations for<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"=
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Style_sheet_(web_development)" title=3D"Style=
 sheet (web development)" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; b=
ackground: none;" target=3D"_blank">stylesheets</a>, especially<span class=
=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org=
/wiki/Cascading_Style_Sheets" title=3D"Cascading Style Sheets" style=3D"tex=
t-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">CS=
S</a>, from the W3C.</li><li style=3D"margin-bottom: 0.1em;">Standards for =
ECMAScript (usually in the form of JavaScript), from<span class=3D"Apple-co=
nverted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ecma_I=
nternational" title=3D"Ecma International" style=3D"text-decoration: none; =
color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">Ecma International</a>=
.</li><li style=3D"margin-bottom: 0.1em;">Recommendations for the<span clas=
s=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.or=
g/wiki/Document_Object_Model" title=3D"Document Object Model" style=3D"text=
-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">Doc=
ument Object Model</a>, from W3C.</li></ul><p style=3D"margin: 0px; line-he=
ight: inherit;">Additional publications provide definitions of other essent=
ial technologies for the World Wide Web, including, but not limited to, the=
 following:</p><ul style=3D"list-style-type: disc; margin: 0.3em 0px 0px 1.=
6em; padding: 0px;"><li style=3D"margin-bottom: 0.1em;"><i>Uniform Resource=
 Identifier</i><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>(URI), wh=
ich is a universal system for referencing resources on the Internet, such a=
s hypertext documents and images. URIs, often called URLs, are defined by t=
he IETF's<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a class=3D"ext=
ernal mw-magiclink-rfc" rel=3D"nofollow" href=3D"https://tools.ietf.org/htm=
l/rfc3986" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #663366; padding-right: 1=
3px; background:  100% 50% no-repeat,  100% 50%;" target=3D"_blank">RFC 398=
6</a>/ STD 66:<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><i>Uniform=
 Resource Identifier (URI): Generic Syntax</i>, as well as its predecessors=
 and numerous<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"=
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/URI_scheme" title=3D"URI scheme" class=3D"mw-=
redirect" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;=
" target=3D"_blank">URI scheme</a>-defining<span class=3D"Apple-converted-s=
pace">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Request_For_Com=
ments" title=3D"Request For Comments" class=3D"mw-redirect" style=3D"text-d=
ecoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">RFCs<=
/a>;</li><li style=3D"margin-bottom: 0.1em;"><i>HyperText Transfer Protocol=
 (HTTP)</i>, especially as defined by<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">=
&nbsp;</span><a class=3D"external mw-magiclink-rfc" rel=3D"nofollow" href=
=3D"https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2616" style=3D"text-decoration: none; co=
lor: #663366; padding-right: 13px; background:  100% 50% no-repeat,  100% 5=
0%;" target=3D"_blank">RFC 2616</a>:<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&=
nbsp;</span><i>HTTP/1.1</i><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</sp=
an>and<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a class=3D"extern=
al mw-magiclink-rfc" rel=3D"nofollow" href=3D"https://tools.ietf.org/html/r=
fc2617" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #663366; padding-right: 13px=
; background:  100% 50% no-repeat,  100% 50%;" target=3D"_blank">RFC 2617</=
a>:<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><i>HTTP Authenticatio=
n</i>, which specify how the browser and server authenticate each other.</l=
i></ul><h2 style=3D"color: black; font-weight: normal; margin: 1em 0px 0.25=
em; overflow: hidden; padding: 0px; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-bottom=
-style: solid; border-bottom-color: #aaaaaa; font-size: 1.5em; font-family:=
 'Linux Libertine', Georgia, Times, serif; line-height: 1.3; background: no=
ne;"><span class=3D"mw-headline" id=3D"Accessibility">Accessibility</span><=
span class=3D"mw-editsection" style=3D"-webkit-user-select: none; font-size=
: small; font-weight: normal; margin-left: 1em; vertical-align: baseline; l=
ine-height: 1em; display: inline-block; white-space: nowrap; unicode-bidi: =
isolate; font-family: sans-serif;"><span class=3D"mw-editsection-bracket" s=
tyle=3D"margin-right: 0.25em; color: #555555;">[</span><a href=3D"https://e=
n.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=3DWorld_Wide_Web&amp;action=3Dedit&amp;se=
ction=3D10" title=3D"Edit section: Accessibility" style=3D"text-decoration:=
 none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">edit</a><span c=
lass=3D"mw-editsection-bracket" style=3D"margin-left: 0.25em; color: #55555=
5;">]</span></span></h2><div class=3D"hatnote relarticle mainarticle" style=
=3D"font-style: italic; padding-left: 1.6em; margin-bottom: 0.5em;">Main ar=
ticle:<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https:/=
/en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Web_accessibility" title=3D"Web accessibility" style=
=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_bl=
ank">Web accessibility</a><br data-mce-bogus=3D"1"></div><p style=3D"margin=
: 0px; line-height: inherit;">There are methods for accessing the Web in al=
ternative mediums and formats to facilitate use by individuals with disabil=
ities. These disabilities may be visual, auditory, physical, speech related=
, cognitive, neurological, or some combination. Accessibility features also=
 help people with temporary disabilities, like a broken arm, or aging users=
 as their abilities change.<sup id=3D"cite_ref-WAI_60-0" class=3D"reference=
" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-w=
eight: normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wik=
i/World_Wide_Web#cite_note-WAI-60" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #=
0b0080; white-space: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</=
span>60<span>]</span></a></sup><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;=
</span>The Web receives information as well as providing information and in=
teracting with society. The World Wide Web Consortium claims it essential t=
hat the Web be accessible, so it can provide equal access and<span class=3D=
"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wi=
ki/Equal_opportunity" title=3D"Equal opportunity" style=3D"text-decoration:=
 none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">equal opportuni=
ty</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>to people with dis=
abilities.<sup id=3D"cite_ref-61" class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height:=
 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; font-sty=
le: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_n=
ote-61" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap=
; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>61<span>]</span></a></=
sup><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>Tim Berners-Lee once=
 noted, "The power of the Web is in its universality. Access by everyone re=
gardless of disability is an essential aspect."<sup id=3D"cite_ref-WAI_60-1=
" class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-=
size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://=
en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_note-WAI-60" style=3D"text-decora=
tion: none; color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; background: none;" target=
=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>60<span>]</span></a></sup><span class=3D"Apple-co=
nverted-space">&nbsp;</span>Many countries regulate<span class=3D"Apple-con=
verted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Web_acc=
essibility" title=3D"Web accessibility" style=3D"text-decoration: none; col=
or: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">web accessibility</a><spa=
n class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>as a requirement for website=
s.<sup id=3D"cite_ref-62" class=3D"reference" style=3D"line-height: 1; unic=
ode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-weight: normal; font-style: norm=
al;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web#cite_note-62" =
style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; white-space: nowrap; backgr=
ound: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>62<span>]</span></a></sup>Inte=
rnational cooperation in the W3C<span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp=
;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Web_Accessibility_Initiati=
ve" title=3D"Web Accessibility Initiative" style=3D"text-decoration: none; =
color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">Web Accessibility Init=
iative</a><span class=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>led to simple =
guidelines that web content authors as well as software developers can use =
to make the Web accessible to persons who may or may not be using<span clas=
s=3D"Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.or=
g/wiki/Assistive_technology" title=3D"Assistive technology" style=3D"text-d=
ecoration: none; color: #0b0080; background: none;" target=3D"_blank">assis=
tive technology</a>.<sup id=3D"cite_ref-WAI_60-2" class=3D"reference" style=
=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-weight: =
normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World=
_Wide_Web#cite_note-WAI-60" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080;=
 white-space: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>60=
<span>]</span></a></sup><sup id=3D"cite_ref-63" class=3D"reference" style=
=3D"line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-size: 11.2px; font-weight: =
normal; font-style: normal;"><a href=3D"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World=
_Wide_Web#cite_note-63" style=3D"text-decoration: none; color: #0b0080; whi=
te-space: nowrap; background: none;" target=3D"_blank"><span>[</span>63<spa=
n>]</span></a></sup><br data-mce-bogus=3D"1"></p><h2 style=3D"color: black;=
 font-weight: normal; margin: 1em 0px 0.25em; overflow: hidden; padding: 0p=
x; border-bottom-width: 1px; border-bottom-style: solid; border-bottom-colo=
r: #aaaaaa; font-size: 1.5em; font-family: 'Linux Libertine', Georgia, Time=
s, serif; line-height: 1.3; background: none;"><span class=3D"mw-headline" =
id=3D"Internationalization">Internationalization</span><span class=3D"mw-ed=
itsection" style=3D"-webkit-user-select: none; font-size: small; font-weigh=
t: normal; margin-left: 1em; vertical-align: baseline; line-height: 1em; di=
splay: inline-block; white-space: nowrap; unicode-bidi: isolate; font-famil=
y: sans-serif;"><span class=3D"mw-editsection-bracket" style=3D"margin-righ=

ndex.php?title=3DWorld_Wide_Web&amp;action=3Dedit&amp;section=3D11" title=
